loans.name: Jairo De Jesus

texts.es:
Jairo es un veterano con mucha experiencia en el campo. 

Es humilde y sencillo, tiene un gran don de gente y energía suficiente para poder cualquier cultivo a producir.

El tiene un cultivo de plátano y yuca el cual trabaja todos los días para vender sus cosechas en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Cocornà.

Gracias a sus años de experiencia y enseñanzas que le dio su padre desde niño, tiene plena capacidad para trabajar y para asesorar en estos temas a los demás agricultores de la zona que necesiten ayuda con su producción.

El solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, semillas de plátano y pesticidas, de esta manera inyectara capital a su actividad y mejorara sus cosechas de una manera significativa.
 
Tiene mucha fe en su negocio y grandes esperanzas en las personas solidarias que apoyan a los campesinos trabajadores.

Apoya a un humilde agricultor para que pueda sacar adelante sus tierras!
texts.en:
Jairo is an older man with extensive experience in farming. He is humble and simple, has great people skills, and the energy to produce any crop. He has plantain and yuca harvests, and he sells the crops at the Cocorná town square every day. Thanks to his vast experience and lessons from his father when he was a child, he is fully capable of working and advising other farmers in the area with help with their production. 

Jairo is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, pesticides, and plantain seeds, so he can invest in his business and significantly improve his crops. 

He has a lot of faith in his business and has the best wishes for the caring people supporting the farm workers. Support a humble farmer so he can improve his land!

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, plantain seeds, irrigation, and supplies for farm preparation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, iron, bricks, galvanized metal sheeting, and posts to construct a sidewalk and replace her home’s roof.

loans.name: Antolina

texts.en: This sweet and tender hearted woman is named Antolina. She and her husband live in Isabela region, wherein the main source of income is from agricultural work. She wants to become an independent and self-assured woman. She is starting her own business in animal husbandry. She is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 to buy feed, vitamins and piglets for her business. This new business will give her family an additional income. She is hoping to obtain her requested loan to start her new business and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and piglets for her business

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 37 years old and married with three children, who are in school. She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing 18,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Jennifer has been fattening pigs for 11 years and also earns additional income from fishing. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 26 years old and married with four children.  With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 18,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy items for resale such as shampoo and groceries.

Jocelyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 42 years old with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Marina has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from rice farming.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa would like to take a further loan to buy noodles, beef and ingredients to make soup to sell from her food stall. Hoa's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy noodles, beef and ingredients to make soup to sell from her food stall.

loans.name: Neria

texts.en:
Neria is 38 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Neria has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en: Minh would like to take a further loan to buy more soft drinks for resale and pay school fees for her children. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks to resell and pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Dúo Nueva Generacion Group

texts.es:
DUO NUEVA GENERACION
El señor Willian de 22 años, soltero, desde hace 5 años posee una panadería ubicada en los Aposentos, que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio el ha mantenido y a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de Willian es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a FAPE; con el préstamo quiere comprar Harina y azúcar y todo lo necesario para hacer crecer su panadería, esperando que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
“DUO NUEVA GENERACION” (NEW GENERATION DUO)
Willian is 22, single, and has owned a bakery, located in los Aposentos, for 5 years. With his effort, he has been able to establish and improve his home. Through his business he has helped his family get ahead.

Willian's dream is to improve the quality of his and his family’s life through the loan he is requesting from FAPE. With the loan he wants to buy flour, sugar, and all the necessary supplies to expand his bakery. He hopes that the Kiva lenders will help him with the requested loan.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and other supplies to make and sell bread.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is married and has six children; they live in Alcala. She is managing a carinderia (food stall) for income. They cook and sell food for daily meals and snacks.  She usually earns 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) monthly and uses it for school expenses. She would like to improve her sales but has insufficient funds to buy more ingredients for the food stall. Francisca is now asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy vegetables, meat, and other ingredients to cook and sell. She hopes to continue selling delicious foods so she will acquire more customers and earn more profits. Someday, she hopes to construct a more convenient stall.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, and other ingredients to cook and sell.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en: Nieves is 54, married, and blessed with one child. She owns and manages a retail store in their village to generate income. She aims to further improve the business and increase her income to provide for her family's necessities and save for her child's future. She wants to acquire more groceries to sell but does not have enough capital. For this reason, she wants to avail herself of a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional stocks of canned goods, noodles, seasonings, laundry soaps, breads, snack foods, and soft drinks to resell. She is hoping that she will succeed with her loan request so she can improve the business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of canned goods, noodles, seasonings, laundry soaps, breads, snack foods, and soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en: Marlon is married and had a child who is studying. To gain income, he manages a store selling grocery items to the people in their village. He wants to increase sales capacity and needs to increase his merchandise. So, he is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy noodles, eggs, soft drinks and canned goods to sell. He hopes this loan will be given to him as additional capital in the business. He hopes to keep selling good and affordable products so he can attract more customers to buy in his store.

loans.use: to buy noodles, eggs, soft drinks and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Ma. Linda

texts.en:
Ma. Linda has faithfully repaid her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. She had to work hard, with the determination of having better income, to provide their children with better education. 

To improve sales, Ma. Linda would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 30,000, she can purchase greater quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Ma. Linda hopes that her business will continue to help with their everyday expenditures. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en: Maricar is 32 years old and has two children. She is engaged in raising ducks and chickens. Everyday she wakes up early in the morning to feed her ducks and chickens. With her determination to improve her income, she decided to request a loan amounting to PHP 12,000 to buy feeds and vitamins for her business. She is a happy person and she loves to play with her kids. She hopes that someday she can achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 42 years old and single.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Remedios has borrowed and repaid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ritchelle

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Ritchelle works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Ritchelle is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.  for her general store business.

Ritchelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 29 years old with three children. With two children in school, Rosita works very hard to provide for them. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale.

Rosita has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is 54 years old and married with twelve children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase household goods to sell such as canned goods, soap, coffee, and sugar.

Leonarda has previously borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from fishing. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of household goods to sell such as canned goods, soap, coffee, and sugar

loans.name: Nonette

texts.en:
Nonette is 40 years old and married with five children who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like can goods, egg, milk, sugar, soap, etc.

Nonette has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like can goods, egg, milk, sugar, soap, etc

loans.name: Tu

texts.en:
Tu would like to take a further loan to buy a variety of vases and flowers to sell from her store. Tu's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and
increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of vases and flowers to resell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is a married woman with four children. She owns and operates a retail store where she sells soft drinks and many items to earn a living. She has been in this business for more than six years. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business, for she is earning well from it. To increase sales, she took a new loan recently, to purchase additional goods to sell. In the future, Fe wants to build a house and to see her children be successful.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is 44 years old and married. She was blessed with three children, and they live happily in a rural community. To generate income, she buys and resells accessories, toys, kitchenware, and school supplies at the public market. Due to the high cost of school fees, she needs to increase her income to support her children's education. To improve the business, she wants to access financial assistance in the form of a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from Kiva lenders; she will use the loan to buy more accessories, toys, kitchen utensils and school supplies for resale. Through this financial assistance, Delia believes that she will improve her business and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy more accessories, toys, kitchen utensils, and school supplies for resale

loans.name: Ruth Maritza

texts.es:
Ruth Maritza tiene 37 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, huevos, menestras, su bodega está ubicada en su mismo domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 4 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Ruth Maritza is 37 years old. She lives with her children in the district of Oyotun, located in the Chiclayo Province of the Lambayeque Region in the north coast of Peru. The community makes a living from agriculture, retail, and livestock.

She makes a living from selling groceries, like rice, sugar, milk, oil, eggs, and lentils. Her shop is located in her own home. She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 4,500 nuevos soles to buy a greater quantity of products to offer her customers in order to generate more revenue for her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of products to offer her customers.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 54 años de edad, de estado civil casado tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad vive en casa propia junto a su cónyuge en un caserío del distrito de La Matanza, una comunidad tranquila, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público mediante su mototaxi, trasladando a sus pasajeros a zonas aledañas a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos como aceites y lubricantes para su vehículo y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 54, is married and has two grown children. He lives in his own house with his wife in a settlement in the La Matanza district.  It is a peaceful community, and the population works in agriculture, commerce, and with livestock.  It is in the Morropon province in the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru.

He uses his mototaxi  [three wheeled motorized vehicle] to provide transportation services to the public.  He transports his passengers to the outlying areas of his district.

He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 3,000 soles in order to buy replacement items like oils and lubricants for his vehicle.  This way he will generate greater income for his family.

loans.use: to buy replacement items like oils and lubricants for his vehicle.

loans.name: Maria Violeta

texts.es:
María Violeta tiene 36 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico junto a su hijo en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de combustible como gasolina, petróleo así como también a la venta de cerveza y comida, en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de combustible y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos con la venta.
texts.en:
María Violeta is 36 years old and lives with her son in a house made of basic materials in the District of Pucará.  Her community is known for agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding.  It is located in Jaén Province, which is part of the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.  

María Violeta sells fuel, such as gasoline and petroleum.  She also sells beer and food from her home. María Violeta is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN so that she can buy a large quantity of fuel.  This will help her to generate more income from her sales.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fuel.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es:
Jacqueline tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, como leche, aceite, arroz, azúcar, gaseosa, art. de aseo, entre otros, cuenta con clientela fija que en la mayoría son sus vecinos y moradores de su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3500 nuevos soles para la compra de una cantidad mayor de productos y así surtir su negocio y poder atender a todos los pedidos de sus clientes; de esta manera generará mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia mejorará.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is 36 years old.  She lives with her children in the district of Oyotún, a community of farmers, merchants, and ranchers located in the province of Chiclayo, which is part of the Lambayeque region on Peru's north coast. 

She sells groceries for a living, such as milk, oil, rice, sugar, sodas, personal hygiene products, and other things.  She has a set clientele who are mainly her neighbors and people who live in the district.  She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 3,500 nuevos soles to buy better quality products to stock her business to meet her customers orders, and thereby generate more income and higher profits to improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy better quality products to stock her business to meet her customers orders

loans.name: Rocio Del Pilar

texts.es:
Rocío del Pilar tiene 32 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos y esposo en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad de clima calurosa, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa en su distrito y caseríos aledaños, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Rocío del Pilar is 32 years old, and lives together with her children and husband in the district of Cayalti, a community with a very hot climate.  Its population is dedicated to agriculture, commerce and livestock.  It is located in the province of Chiclayo that belongs to the region of Lambayeque, in the northern coast of Peru.

Rocío works in the sale of clothing in her area and the surrounding villages.  She requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2000 soles in order to purchase a greater quantity of merchandise to offer her customers and like that, she will be able to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to offer her customers.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Sally works hard to support her family. She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Sally is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional kilos of dried fish to sell for her dried fish vending business.

Sally has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional kilos of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Profetiza

texts.en: Profetiza is 59 years old and married with nine children, one of whom is in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.  She has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from farming rice and selling natural medicines. Profetiza aspires to save enough money to expand her business and to repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 44 years old and has three children who are in school.

Amelia has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her sewing machine.

Amelia has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Ruditha

texts.en:
Ruditha is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy new fish nets and other fishing materials for her fishing business.

Ruditha has been in this business for 23 years. Ruditha earns more income from rice farming and raising pigs.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy new fish nets and other fishing materials

loans.name: Dúo Ixim Group

texts.es:
DUO IXIM
La seña Dorcas Alicia de 29 años, casada,  desde hace dos 5 años posee una Tortillería ubicada en Chimaltenango, que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio ella  ha mantenido y  a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de la señora Dorcas es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a FAPE; con el préstamo quiere comprar Maíz  y gas propano para seguir creciendo con su tortillería.
texts.en:
Dorcas Alicia is 29 years old and married. For five years, she's had a tortilla shop located in Chimaltenango, which, through her efforts, she succeded in establishing in improving her life. Though her business, she has sustained her family and brought them ahead.

Dorcas' dream is to be able to improve her family's quality of life through the microloan she's seeking from FAPE. With the loan, she wants to buy corn and propane gas to continue growing with her tortilla shop.

loans.use: to buy corn and propane gas to make and sell tortillas.

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en:
Jenefer is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to her, as she was able to buy more stock of mineral water needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy additional stock of mineral water to further expand her inventory. The more mineral water displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jenefer hopes to become rich and prosperous through her business, for she desires to help her family and also other people. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more containers of mineral water.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria, 49 years old, is married and blessed with five children. She has managed a retail store for almost five years. According to her, she encounters many trials in her life. That's why she works hard for her family, so that they won't experience her past hardships. Due to insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan amounting PHP 8,000 to buy cooking oil, salt, sugar, flour and rice grains to sell in her store. She hopes some day that she can achieve her dreams for her family.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, salt, sugar, flour and rice grains for her store.

loans.name: Lagrimas

texts.en: Lagrimas is 57 years old, is married, and has three grown children. She manages a computer shop for income. She offers internet browsing, encoding, and printing services. She wants to improve her services but needs additional capital, so she is asking for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy printer ink and pay internet use fees. This will help her maintain good services in her shop and thus earn good profits. She promises to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy ink for printer and pay internet fee use in the computer shop

loans.name: Elkin Dario

texts.es:
Elkin un hombre de 35 años de edad el cual ha trabajo muchos años como vendedor en almacenes, tiene un hijo de 15 años de edad que está próximo a terminar sus estudios y su futuro no es muy seguro puesto que no cuenta con un capital para ofrecerle estudios universitarios

Elkin ha tenido 5 créditos en la corporación con un excelente habito de pago y quiere que le depositen su confianza en un nuevo préstamos para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de mercancía con ahorres y ayuda del préstamo puedo alquilar un pequeño local (ver foto) y ha ido adornándolo a hora solo queda surtirlo y empezar a vender con la ilusión de poder darle a su hijo estudios universitarios que es su gran anhelo.

El crédito para él es de vital importancia pues lo invertirá netamente en la compra de mercancía de hombre y dama tanto de ropa como de calzado y con este podrá iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Elkin is a 35 year old man who has worked for many years as a department store salesman.  He has a 15 year old son who is about to finish school, and whose future is not secure since Elkin doesn't have the money to pay for his university education.

Elkin has received five loans through the organization, with an excellent record of payment, and wants to again be trusted with a new loan.  This loan will be to start his own business selling merchandise.  With his savings and the loan he can rent a small place (see in the photo) and has been outfitting it.  Now all that remains is to stock it and begin sales, with the hope of being able to provide his son a college education, which is his greatest desire.

The loan is of vital importance to him because he will invest it completely in purchase of merchandise for men and women, clothes as well as shoes, and with this will be able to begin his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to start a business selling clothing and shoes for men and women

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other inputs to improve his flower fields and prevent losing his only source of income.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie is 45 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Rosemarie has been farming rice for three years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Pedro Dionisio

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 45 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive con su madre en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

El trabaja como policia municipal en ventanas. Solicita el crédito para la compra de un electrodomestico . La compra  realizara en Ventanas. Su meta es comprar un terreno para construir una casa. Su desafío es enfermarse. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte y leer mucho.
texts.en:
Pedro is 45 years old. He is single and lives with his mother in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Rios.

He works as a municipal policeman in Ventanas. He is requesting the loan to purchase a household appliance. He makes his purchases in Ventanas. His goal is to buy a plot of land to construct a house. His challenge is getting sick. In his free time he likes to play sports and to read a lot.

loans.use: to buy a domestic appliance

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela es una mujer de 32 años que vive y lucha por su pequeña hija de 6 años de edad pues sabe que toda la responsabilidad recae en la madre. 

Se dedica a la distribución de productos de uso personal básicamente de la marca Herbalife, los cuales distribuye diaramente puerta a puerta conociendo clientes con la esperanza de que le compren.

Todo el capital de trabajo lo usa para el pago de las deudas y forjarle un futuro prometedor a su hija por ello quiere siempre superarse razón por la cual solicita un crédito para la compra de mercancía como crema de manos, productos capilares entre muchos otros que vende.

El crédito para ella es de gran importancia pues le dará la oportunidad de fortalecer su negocio y pensar en montar un local comercial para estar más tiempo con su hija que es su gran sueño.

Apoyen a esta empresaria solo necesita un voto de confianza para demostrar que con trabajo duro y convicción puede lograr grandes cosas.
texts.en:
Marcela is a 32 year-old woman who lives and struggles for her little 6 year-old daughter, because she knows that all of the responsibility falls on the mother.

Marcela has a business distributing personal care products of the Herbalife brand.  She sells door-to-door on a daily basis to known customers, hoping that they will buy from her.

She is using all of her working capital to pay off debts and build a promising future for her daughter.  To do this, she wants to always succeed, and this is why she is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as: hand cream, hair care products, and many other products that she sells.

For Marcela, this loan is of great importance, because it will give her the opportunity to strengthen her business.  She also plans to open a shop so that she could have more time to spend with her daughter, which is her greatest dream.

Support this businesswoman, who only needs a vote of confidence to demonstrate that with hard work and conviction, one can achieve great things.

loans.use: to buy personal care products like creams and hair care products to sell to her clients

loans.name: Yonatan Stibel

texts.es:
Hace tres años comenzó el sueño del señor Yonatan cuando muy humildemente se montaba en un bus a distribuir sus productos como ropa y tenis los cuales vende a amigos, familiares y almacenes pero con mucho esfuerzo. 

Luego de un tiempo logro consolidar un almacén de ropa y quiere comenzar a emplear gente, ayudar a familiares que se encuentran con graves problemas financieros ofreciéndoles un empleo. 
Yonatan es una persona que vive con sus padres vela por su cuidado y por las cuentas del hogar y desde que es independiente le ha ido mucho mejor.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de una moto para distribuir sus productos y comprar más mercancía, el crédito para Yonatan será de gran importancia pues es la oportunidad de comenzar a emplear personas. 

Su gran sueño es tener un gran almacén de ropa y calzado con muchos clientes y empleados.
texts.en:
Three years ago, on a bus on his way to deliver products such as clothes and shoes to friends, relatives and stores, Yonatan started to dream about the future.

After some time, he was able to open a store. He wants to create jobs and help those relatives that are going through a difficult financial situation by employing them. He lives with his parents and takes care of them. He covers the home expenses, and since he became independent, things have been better for him.

He is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle to distribute his products and more clothes. This loan will be of great importance for Yonatan, because it will give him the opportunity to employ people. His biggest dream is to own a store with many employees and sell clothes and shoes to many customers.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to better distribute the clothes he sells to better provide for his parents.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 65 años de edad que hace 10 años de edad se veía en la difícil tarea de conseguir empleo para poder alimentar a su familia conformada por su esposa y tres hijos ya mayores de edad.

Gracias a unos créditos que le brindo Interactuar ha logrado mejorar su negocio y mantenerse 10 años pero de momento una gran amenaza lega al sector y son las sucursales de los grandes supermercados que ponen en riesgo su tienda pues sus ventas han bajado considerablemente.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de mercancía para competir con los precios de estos almacenes. Su gran sueño es seguir con su negocio pues sabe que a sus 65 años de edad no encontrara empleo y esta pequeña tienda es lo único que les da de comer a su familia. 

El crédito será invertido en productos de la canasta familiar como granos, productos de aseo, abarrotes y demás productos que le han solicitado en su tienda.
texts.en:
Luis is a 65 year old man, who ten years ago found himself struggling to find work to feed his family, consisting of his spouse and their three children, now adults.  

Thanks to loans that Interactuar provided, Luis has been able to improve his business and maintain himself for 10 years.  However, now a great threat looms, the competition in this sector from huge supermarket branches, placing his store in danger of failing.  Luis' sales have gone down by quite a bit.

Luis is asking for a loan to buy merchandise to make his business more competitive with the large stores.  His big dream is to continue with this business since he knows that at 65 years of age he won't find work.  This small store is the only means he has to feed his family.  He will invest the loan in staple products such as grains, cleaning products, groceries and other products that customers have asked for at his store.

loans.use: to buy grains, cleaning products to better compete with big supermarkets and continue providing for his family.

loans.name: Inginio Jose

texts.es:
José un agricultor criado en el campo, aprendió su profesión trabajando diariamente junto con su padre, trabaja diariamente entre 8 y 10 horas dependiendo de las demandas del cultivo. 

Se enfrente con un gran problema el cual es que debe legalizar su parcela un problema que lo ha afectado pro mucho tiempo pero lo único que puede hacer es trabajar y cuidar de sus terrenos. 

Solicita un crédito para a compra de insumos agrícolas, como abonos, riegos, y exterminadores de plagas, mejorando  su producto final pues tendrá mayores existencias, sanas y de muy buena calidad. 

Este terreno es todo lo que tiene el señor José con este logra mantener a su pareja y a sus 3 hijos de 18, 9 y 6 años de edad y trabajando es la única manera de poder legalizar su parcela por eso este crédito es de vital importancia pues podrá ejerciendo su admirable profesión por mucho mas tiempo.
texts.en:
José was brought up in the country and is a farmer. He learned the trade working every day with his father. José works between eight and ten hours every day, depending on the needs of the crops.

José has a big problem: he needs to take out legal papers for his plot of land. This problem has affected José for a long time but the only thing that he can do is work and look after his lands.

José is applying for a loan in order to buy farming supplies such as manure, anti-insect chemicals, and tools for irrigation. These items will improve his final products: there will be a greater abundance of them, they will be healthier, and they will be of very good quality.

This land is the only thing that José has and he uses it to support his partner and three children, aged 19, 9 and 6 years old. Working is the only way that José can take out the legal papers for his land and so this loan is of vital importance. It will allow him to continue practicing his profession for a long time to come.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as manure, anti-insect chemicals, and irrigation tools to improve his fields and one day pay legal fees to document his property rights.

loans.name: Ana Mirleidis

texts.es:
Debido a los conflictos armados y los constantes desplazamiento forzados a mano de grupo ilegales los campesinos que han recuperado sus tierras e incluso otros que han estado toda la vida en ellas se han visto en un gran conflicto el cual es poder legalizar sus tierras para trabajar tranquilamente. 

Una de estas personas es Ana una campesina que ha trabajado toda su vida en la agricultura la cual tiene este problema pero solo se preocupa por trabajar y demostrar que nadie conoce mejor estas tierras que ella.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos para preparar la tierra, como abonos, semillas y riegos.

Este crédito es de vital importancia para Ana pues podrá seguir trabajando sus tierras a pesar de la incertidumbre de no tenerlas legalizadas pero muy bien sabe que sus dos hijos de 6 y 11 años necesitan comer y necesitan una madre con gran fortaleza para salir a delante en la vida. 


Su sueño es tener sus tierras legalizadas y salir adelante con sus hijos económica y espiritualmente. 

Por favor apoyen a esta empresaria que trabaja diariamente sin importar clima o estado de salud  que solo busca un buen futuro para sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Because of the armed conflicts and the constant forced displacement at the hands of illegal groups, the farmers who have reclaimed their land as well as those who have spent their whole lives on their land have faced a great conflict to be able to legalize their land in order to work in peace. 

One of these people is Ana, a farmer who has worked in the type of agriculture affected by this problem her whole life. However, she is only interested in working and showing that nobody knows the land better than she does. 

She is requesting a loan to buy inputs such as fertilizer, irrigation and seeds to prepare the land. This loan is vitally important to Ana to enable her to continue working her land despite the uncertainty of it not being legalised. She is well aware that her two children of 6 and 11 need to eat and need a mother with strong drive to move forward in life. 

Her dream is to have her land legalized and move forward both economically and spiritually with her two children. 

Please help this businesswoman who works every day irrespective of the weather or her state of health in search of a good future for her two children.

loans.use: to buy inputs such as fertilizer, irrigation and seeds to prepare the land.

loans.name: Gabriel Ivan

texts.es:
Gabriel pasa por un caso particular que se presenta pero no es lo más común y es que la separarse de su esposa quedo con la custodia de sus 4 hijos.

Hace 3 años logro montar una cafetería empleando dos personas las cuales les ofrece todos los servicios de salud y pensión tal y como debe ser aunque es un gasto mayor él prefiere tener a sus empleados en excelente condiciones contentos y felices de trabajar con él.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido mejorando su empresa y aún más piensa en tener buen rentabilidad para comenzar un ahorro pues mantener 4 hijos realizando el papel de madre y padre es bastante complicado y sabiendo que sus hijos de 17, 16, 14, 12 demanda un mayor capital porque su educación es más avanzada. 

Para Gabriel este crédito lo ve como prioridad pues podrá mejorar su negocio y aún más importante no tendrá que prescindir de ninguno de sus empleados antes por el contrario si tiene éxito lograra emplear otra persona y seguirá creciendo su familia laboral que buscan siempre mejorar y mejorar y nada más que mejorar.
texts.en:
Gabriel is going through the peculiar case that is presented, but it is not very common: when he got divorced from his wife, he was left with the custody of his 4 children. 

Three years ago he was able to open a cafeteria, employing two people and he offers them all health services and a pension, just like it should be although it poses a greater cost. He prefers to have his employees in excellent conditions, cheerful and happy to work with him. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase an assortment of goods to improve his company. Even more, he thinks of having good earnings so that he can begin saving because maintaining 4 children, acting as the mother and father, is quite complicated knowing that his children are 17, 16, 14, and 12 years old and demand a greater capital because their education is more advanced. 

Gabriel sees this loan as a priority because he will be able to improve his business, and even more important, he will not have to let go of any of his employees. Contrary to that, if he is successful he will manage to hire another person and he will continue to grow his work family, who are always looking to improve, improve, and nothing else but improve.

loans.use: to purchase assorted foods to improve sales at his cafe that will help pay for his childrens higher education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hair-care products, gel, an electric trimmer, brushes, a hair-dryer, and a hair-iron to improve her beauty services and provide for her son.

loans.name: Mercyl

texts.en: Mercyl has been running a snack vending business in order to provide for the needs of her two children. She also receives money from her husband who works abroad. It helps a lot to sustain their living. She wants to have a retail store for business expansion. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy raw ingredients to prepare snacks to sell. In the future, Mercyl wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to prepare snacks to sell.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan has been raising and selling hogs for three years now. He also manages a junk shop in his village, so he earns well for his family. Jonathan used the income from his previous loan to buy feeds and additional pigs and successfully repaid the loan. 

For the time being, Jonathan is requesting another loan of 50,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase more feeds and hogs for his business. He will use his loan to improve his profits and will use the additional revenue to improve his family's general living conditions. He sincerely lets you know in advance his heartfelt thanks and appreciation for the assistance.

Jonathan hopes to further improve and expand his piggery. He also hopes for good health for him and his family and for the education of his children. He meets every week with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for feeds and additional hogs for his business.

loans.name: Damian

texts.en: Damian, 52 years old, is married and blessed with three children. He's been engaged in a hog-raising business for almost ten years. Due to insufficient funds, he is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 8,000 to buy additional piglets for his hog-raising business. He really loves to raise hogs and wants to earn more income in this business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets for his hog-raising business.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 58 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal for resale.

Perlita has previously borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF. She has been running her charcoal business for 3 years and also earns an income from a general store.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en:
Filipina is 46 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy items for resale such as shampoo and groceries.

Filipina has previously borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy items for resale such as shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 59 years old and married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

Angelina has borrowed and repaid 29 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal business for two years and also earns an income from a general store. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena operates a general store in her village to make a living. She has been doing this for more than five years and earns well, so she can sustain her family. She has three children who want to have a better education.

Rowena successfully repaid her previous business loan. Recently, she took out a new loan to buy additional items to sell. In the future, she wants to expand her business to ensure a better source of income. She also hopes to see her children succeed.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ma. Rowena

texts.en:
Ma.Rowena owns and manages a general store near the public market. She is 48 years old and has two school age children. She and her husband want their children to become successful in the future. Therefore, they help each other in financing the education of their children, and in sustaining their daily necessities. 

Due to high cost of commodities and school fees, she needs to increase her income. She aimed to improve her business but she has limited capital.

For this reason, she would like to avail a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy more picture frames, albums, sim cards, wall clocks and accessories to sell. She believes that this financial help will enable her to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy more picture frames, albums, sim cards, wall clocks and accessories

loans.name: Karina Del Rocio

texts.es:
Karina del Rocio tiene 34 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene dos hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia; la cual está en una zona rural, en el distrito de Oyotun, Chiclayo, Perú.

La señora se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral; desde hace 14 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, solicita préstamo para invertir en su negocio; comprando màs y nuevos animales tales como cuyes, patos, gallinas, pavos.
texts.en: Karina del Rocio, 34, is in a common-law relationship and has two children.  She lives in her own home in a rural area in the district of Oyotun, Chiclayo, Peru.  She has been engaged in raising and selling barnyard animals for fourteen years.  Her business is located in her home, and she is requesting the loan to invest in her business by purchasing more new animals such as guinea pigs, ducks, chickens, and turkeys.

loans.use: to invest in her business by purchasing  more new animals such as guinea pigs, ducks, chickens, and turkeys.

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es:
Nicanor tiene 23 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Morropon al lado de su conyugue e hija, en una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre, en el departamento De Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Nicanor presta servicios de albañileria, lo cual desempeña a diario, en las tardes se dedica hacer transporte público en su Mototaxi, adicionalmente su esposa contribuye en su hogar dedicandose a la crianza de animales de corral tales como son gallinas, patos, pavos. Él ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de S/.3000 Nuevos Soles para mantenimiento de su moto taxi, ya que hará arreglos para su vehículo(medio de trabajo), y el resto de dinero será para la compra de calaminas para techar la parte trasera de su casa.
texts.en:
Nicanor, 23, lives in the Morropon district with his wife and daughter in a community with a warm climate.  The population here works in agriculture, trade, and animal husbandry.  This district is located in the province of the same name in the Piura department of the northern coast of Peru.

Nicanor works in construction; he performs this work daily.  In the afternoons, he works in public transportation using his moto-taxi.  In addition, his wife contributes to the household by raising barnyard animals such as hens, ducks, and turkeys.  Nicanor has requested a loan from EDPYME ALTERNATIVA for 3,000 Peruvian soles to do maintenance work on his moto-taxi, because he will make some repairs to his vehicle, which is his means of employment.  He will use the rest of the funds to buy sheets of corrugated metal to put a roof on the back part of his house.

loans.use: to maintain his moto-taxi and tune up the motor, and to buy sheets of corrugated metal for his roof

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria has owned and operated farmland, planting and harvesting pineapple for sale for years. She was able to provide for her family, and had successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming. She earns well from her investments.

Gloria wants to improve her farm; she wants to ensure a better and greener farm. She would like to apply for a new loan, this time PHP 10,000, to purchase organic fertilizer to improve the farm.

In the future, Gloria wants to buy a delivery truck for fast and easy transactions with her customers. She dreams of progressing her life and business, too. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and farm inputs for her business.

loans.name: Irein

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Irein works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Irein is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell for her buy and sell vegetables business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested the additional loan to further build her business.

Irein has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Alma has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from buying and selling dry goods.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase baking ingredients such as flour, cooking oil, yeast for his bakery to increase his productivity and provide more for his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products like grains, refrigerated products, and groceries.

loans.name: Virginia De Los Angeles

texts.es: Virginia de 48 años de edad vive con su hijo de 19 años de edad. Ella es una mujer visionaria que desde hace 3 años se gana la vida elaborando y vendiendo pizza, la venta la realiza de forma ambulante por los alrededores del mercado municipal. Virginia desea ampliar su negocio de venta de pizza, para lo que desea comprar los ingredientes por mayor y comprar herramientas para mejorar su trabajo. Es por ello que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para invertir en: harina, peperoni, salsas de tomate, margarina y queso, además comprará latas para pizza y un tambo de gas.
texts.en: Virginia, 48, lives with her 19 year old son.  She is a visionary woman who has been earning a living making and selling pizza for three years.  She conducts her sales on foot around the town market.  She wishes to expand her pizza sales business, and wants to purchase wholesale ingredients and tools to improve her job.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Fusai to invest in wheat, pepperoni, tomato sauce, margarine, and cheese as well as tin pizza plates and a propane tank.

loans.use: to invest in wheat, pepperoni, tomato sauce, margarine, and cheese as well as tin pizza plates and a propane tank.

loans.name: Señor De Huanca Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE HUANCA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yadmina ella es soltera y tiene 37 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.



Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de internet, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "SEÑOR DE HUANCA” communal bank. This bank is located in the central district of Cusco; it belongs to the Cusco province in the department of Cusco. 

Mrs. Yadmina is single, 37 years old, and has two children. She works in her grocery store business and sells convenience items like rice, sugar, milk, and oil. She works from 8:00 am until 10:00 pm. She has had this business for 5 years and it is going very well. Her dream is to expand her grocery store. She requests the loan so that she can purchase milk, sugar, oil, and rice.

The other members provide internet services, sell animals, own a grocery store, and sell food. The member thanks everyone who has made her dream possible and promises to make her payments in the established time frame.

The borrowers whose photos are attached to the original photo were unable to attend the group meeting.

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, oil, and rice.

loans.name: Mesias

texts.es:
Mesias tiene 20 años de edad, vive con sus suegros, esposa e hijo de 19 meses, en casa familiar, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Laguna y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza Mesias es la crianza y venta de animales, como patos, conejos y cuyes, desde hace 4 años en su propio domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1200 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos de engorde para los mismos y para realizar arreglos en el corral donde él cria a dichos animales, lo que le permitirá ofrecerlos a un mejor precio en los restaurants de su distrito; ayudandole a crecer su negocio generandole mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mesias is 20 years old. He lives with his in-laws, wife and 19 month old son in the family house. It is in large community in the urban area of Laguna. He has good personal and work references from neighbors. The people in his community work in agriculture, commerce and ranching. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.  

Mesias' activity is selling animals such as ducks, rabbits and guinea pigs. He has been doing this for 4 years from his house. He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1200 nuevos soles to buy feed to fatten the animals and to improve the space where he raises these animals which will allow him to offer them at a better price to the restaurants in his district. This will help him to grow his business, generating better income and therefore a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his animals and to improve the space where he raises them

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato is a farmer who is raising his family in a rural community. He is 55 years old and has two children. He aimed to uplift the living status of his family to give them a better life. Aside from planting and harvesting rice, he was also engages in hog-raising to have additional income

He aimed to improve this business and increase his income but he has inadequate capital. For this reason, he would like to avail a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise. 

Being a patient and industrious father, he believes that someday, he will improve the business as well as their status of living.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds vitamins, and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial tiene 44 años de edad, vive con su conyuge, en el sector de las Adelinas – Cayalti en casa propia, una comunidad de clima variado, su población es amable, se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El señor se dedica a la crianza de animales, con más de 10 años de experiencia, y además brinda el servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, transportando a sus pasajeros a los alrededores como también anexos, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimento para los animales así como tambien para comprar animales, y asi mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Marcial is 44 years old. He lives with his wife in the area of Adelinas – Cayalti in their own home. It is a community with a varied climate with a friendly population. They work in agriculture, commerce and ranching. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. 

Marcial raises animals. He has more than 10 years' experience. He also offers public transportation service in his own motorcycle taxi. He transports his passengers to the surrounding areas and beyond. He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 3000 nuevos soles to buy feed for the animals as well as to buy animals, thus improving his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed for them to have bigger animal sales.

loans.name: Sia

texts.en: This is 40-year-old Sia. She is married, and has three children ages 23, 17 and 8. She has two additional dependents that live with her for assistance. In 2003, Sia established her palm oil and charcoal business. She began her business because she wanted to help her husband with some family responsibilities. Working six days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about Le 600,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Sia requires a loan in order to buy more containers of palm oil, and bags of charcoal for resale. In the future, Sia plans to build a house and to educate her children. She is very hard working. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more containers of palm oil, and bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Mohamed. He is married and has two children who are 15 and 10 years old. He has one additional dependent who lives with him for schooling.

In 1999, Mohamed established his pharmacy business. He began his business because his salary was very small and he was unable to take care of the home. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SLL 400,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of SLL 5,000,000. Mohamed requires a loan in order to buy more drugs for resale. In the future, Mohamed plans to get a clinic of his own. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drugs for resale.

loans.name: Nayduth Patricia

texts.es:
Con el sueño de poder montar un restaurante la señora Nayduth se despierta cada día a trabajar en su micro-empresa de venta de comidas que tiene en su casa. 
Nayduth opto por esta opción ante lo difícil que es conseguir un empleo y los que tenía de medio tiempo no era suficiente para cubrir los gastos, un arriendo, los servicios y comida. 
Solicita un crédito para la compra de una mesa de aluminio que es lo que requieren para trabajar, utensilios de cocina e insumos para la elaboración de comidas como carnes, verduras, frutas y granos. 
Con el crédito tendrá la oportunidad de crear nuevos platos de comida para sus clientes. 

Por favor apoyen este cliente que solo tiene su negocio para vivir, quiere demostrar su espíritu emprendedor y que puede sacar su negocio adelante si le dan un voto de confianza para continuar con su proyecto para adquirir un restaurante.
texts.en:
Nayduth hopes to open a restaurant. She wakes up each day to work at her small food sales business that she has in her home. Nayduth decided on this option instead of the difficult task of finding a job. The part-time jobs she used to have were not enough to cover her expenses; rent, utilities, and food. 

She is requesting a loan to buy an alimunum table that is needed for work, kitchen utensils and consumable goods to make food, such as meat, vegetables, fruit and grains. The loan will allow her to create new food dishes for her customers. 

Please support this client as she only survives off her business. She wants to show her entrepreneurial spirit and that she can make her business thrive if she is given a vote of confidence in order to continue her plan of buying a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy an aluminum table that is needed for work, kitchen utensils and consumable goods to make food, such as meat, vegetables, fruit and grains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more foam mattresses at a cost of 2,500,000 SLL, big rubber bowls at a cost of 1,000,000 SLL, pillows at a cost of 1,000,000 SLL, rubber baskets at a cost of 500,000 SLL, etc., for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 150 chicks to re-stock her business

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 21 años de edad, su estado civil es soltero, vive en una casa familiar, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Cayalti, goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, dicha comunidad esta ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Pedro ofrece servicio de mototaxi desde hace 5 años, adicionalmente se dedica también a la crianza y venta de animales(cerdos), él ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2500 nuevos soles para la compra una mayor cantidad de animales (cerdos) y para la compra de alimentos de engorde de los mismos, lo que le permitirá atender a un número mayor de clientes y ofrecerlos a un mejor precio en los restaurants de su distrito, generandole mayores ganancias y mejorando su calidad de vida y la de familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is 21 years old and single. He lives in the family home, in a large community located in the urban area of Cayalti. His neighbors give positive personal and working references for him. His community makes a living from agriculture, trade, and livestock raising. The said community is located in the Province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque Region, in the northern coast of Peru.

Pedro has been providing motorcycle taxi services for the past five years. Additionally, he makes a living raising and selling animals (pigs). He has requested a loan of 2,500 nuevo soles to Edpyme Alternativa to buy more pigs and animal feed to fatten them. This will allow him to attract more clients and offer the animals at a better price to the restaurants in his district, which will increase his profits and thus improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs and animal feed to fatten them and sell to his customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Karina Yasmy

texts.es:
Karina Yasmy tiene 33 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, vive en Cayalti, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Karina tiene como herramienta de trabajo principal su motataxi, la cual alquila su a un tercero para transporte urbano; adicionalmente ella se dedica a la venta de panca; a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, desde hace algunos años, Karina cria a sus animales en la parte posterior de su domicilio, y ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para la compra de una mayor cantidad y variedad de animales como cuyes, patos y gallinas que le permitan ofrecerlos a un mejor precio, lo que le ayudará a la captacion de más clientes, generandole así mayores ingresos y mejoers ganancias que le permitirán mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Karina Yasmy is 33 years of age, married, and lives in Cayalti, a community which is involved in farming, business and animal raising. Cayalti is located in the province of Chiclayo which is part of the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

Karina rents her moto taxi out for urban transport and a third of the earnings are made from the rental. In addition to this she also grows and sells maize and raises and sells barnyard animals, which she has done for some years now. She raises her animals in the back of her home. 

Karina has applied for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy a better variety and quantity of animals such as guinea pigs, ducks and hens which will allow her to sell them at a higher price. By doing so she will be able to garner more customers, generate a greater income and improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy a better variety and quantity of animals such as guinea pigs, ducks and hens to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to re-stock 200 chicks and chicken feeds

loans.name: Sol De Oro Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SOL DE ORO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Delia ella es soltera y tiene 46 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y también la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de truchas, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.

La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to Sol de Oro Communal Bank, located in the district of Cusco in the province and department of Cusco. Delia is a member who is single and is 46 years old with 4 children. She works in her grocery store business and she also sells trout, rice, sugar, milk and oil. She works from 8:00am to 10:00pm. She´s worked in this business for 5 years and it´s going really well for her. Her dream is to grow her grocery business. 

She is asking for a loan to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice. Delia was added separately to the photo because she was working when the the group photo was taken. The other members have businesses such as selling candy, selling clothing, running a grocery store and a bookstore. Others also work selling dried grains, running an internet business, running a grocery store and running a restaurant. 

Delia is thankful to those who are part of this dream and she promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, oil and rice to sell in her store

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
La socia Concepcion se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de platos tipícos, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y pescado frito, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Concepción continues working in her business selling traditional dishes. She makes various dishes such as baked chicken, soups, and fried fish. She works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm, she already has been in this business for 8 years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a restaurant. She asks for this loan to purchase cooking products such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

She is happy for the loan and commits to making the payments on her loan.

loans.use: to purchase cooking products such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 70 años de edad, su estado civil es viuda, tiene 1 nieta a su cargo, viven en el Distrito de Cayalti, una zona rural, con clima variado, la población de dicha comunidad se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como cuyes, tiene experiencia en el rubro desde hace varios años, su negocio está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de animales menores como cuyes para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos y mejores ganancias, lo que le permitirá apoyar con los estudios a su nieta, dado que la niña es huerfana, mejorando así la calidad de vida de ambas.
texts.en:
Isabel is 70 years old.  She is a widow and takes care of one granddaughter  She lives with her family in the district of Cayalti, a rural area with a varied climate.  The people in the community work in farming, commerce, and livestock.  It is located in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

She works raising and selling animals such as guinea pigs.  She has many years of experience in this area.  Her business is located in the rear part of her home.  

She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1000 nuevos soles to purchase small animals such as guinea pigs to offer to her customers.  She will generate more profits which will allow her to help pay for school costs for her young granddaughter, who is an orphan, which will improve both of their lives.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs and make repairs to their pen.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo tiene 62 años de edad; su estado civil es soltero, sin hijos a su cargo tiene casa propia vive en el distrito de oyotún, provincia de chiclayo en la región de Lambayeque - perú esta es una zona rural donde su actividad principal es la agricultura y la crianza de animales.

Ricardo trabaja como obrero – jornalero en los campos de agricultura de este distrito con mucha experiencia en sus labores. Solicita préstamo a edpyme alternativa el monto es de 2500 nuevos soles para la compra de herramientas nuevas como son palana, machete entre otros por lo que mejorará su desempeño en el campo y aumentar sus ingresos, mejorando su caldiad de vida de esta manera.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 62 years old, he is single and has no children to look after. He has his own home and lives in the district of Oyotún, a province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region of Peru. This is a rural area where the main activities are agriculture and the raising of livestock.

Ricardo works as a day labourer in the agricultural fields of the area, and has a lot of experience doing this work. He is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan amount of 2500 nuevos soles to buy new tools such as a hoe and machete. In this way he will be able to improve his working performance in the fields and increase his income, thus improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain and buy new tools for his work.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella has owned and operated farmland for years, planting and harvesting pineapple to sell. She has been able to provide for her family and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming. She earns well from her investments.

Bella wants to improve her farm; she wants to ensure a better and greener farm. She would like to apply for a new loan, this time PHP 30,000, to purchase organic fertilizer to improve the farm.

In the future, Bella wants to see her farming business thrive, for she hopes to give her family a prosperous life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and farm inputs for her business.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina:
Valentina tiene 24 años y nació en Armenia, Quindío, población ubicada en el occidente de Colombia, pero actualmente se encuentra residiendo en Cali, Valle del Cauca. Es la hija mayor de su familia, su hermano menor es estudiante de la Universidad del Valle, su madre es ama de casa y su padre es Ingeniero Mecánico.
