A pesar de las dificultades económicas que tuvieron, dado que solamente su padre aportaba dinero para la manutención de la casa y muchas veces no era suficiente; Valentina realizó su carrera profesional en la Universidad del Valle y en noviembre de este año, obtendrá su título en Comunicación Social. 
Valentina se ha trazado la meta de seguir con los estudios de posgrado, una vez se gradué. Por esto sueña con realizar una maestría en Media, Culture and Communication en la Universidad de Nueva York en Estados Unidos, y para lograrlo necesita solicitar el apoyo de Kiva, puesto que es la única forma para poder cubrir los gastos de exámenes de idioma y aplicación a las universidades. Una vez realice su maestría y regrese a Colombia, Valentina desea proyectar el emprendimiento cultural en su región, por medio de proyectos como la revista virtual sobre cine “revista visaje” y así contribuir en el crecimiento cultural y crear espacios de cine para las personas de bajos recursos, además de incluir a grupos víctimas del conflicto y proporcionar espacios de formación.
texts.en:
Valentina, 24, was born in Armenia, Quindío, located in the west of Colombia, but currently lives in Cali, Cauca Valley.  She's the oldest daughter in her family.  Her younger brother attends the Universidad del Valle, her mother's a homemaker, and her father's a mechanical engineer.  Despite the financial problems they had because only her father was earning money to support the household and often it wasn't enough, Valentina studied at the Universidad del Valle and will receive her degree in social communication in November.

Valentina has planned a goal for herself of continuing her studies at the graduate level once she graduates.  That's why she dreams of doing a master's degree in media, culture, and communication at New York University in the United States.  To achieve this she needs to ask for Kiva's support, because it's the only way to be able to cover the expenses for language tests and university applications.  Once she finishes her master's and returns to Colombia, Valentina wants to plan a cultural venture in her area through projects such as "Revista Visaje," a virtual film magazine.  That way she can contribute to cultural growth and create film spaces for low-income people and include groups of conflict victims and offer spaces for training.

loans.use: to apply for a master's degree in Media, Culture, and Communication at New York University

loans.name: Marbelita

texts.en:
Marbelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall. Marbelita has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Marbelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Djulita

texts.en:
Djualita is making great progress in selling green technologies in her community. She is excited to educate his customers in the health and cost benefits of the water filters.

Kopernik originally listed this loan with fixed monthly repayments however as actual sales are difficult to predict in advance, repayments were not being made at the fixed rate. This loan will be repaid as actual sales are made. She may even pay her loan off early! 

Djualita hopes you can support her again.

loans.use: to purchase clean energy products and resell them in her community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials to construct a permanent shelter for pigs and feeds

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan has been operating her snack vending business for more than three years and she earns well from this. She had to work hard with the determination of having a better income to provide their children with a better education than they have. Her husband is earning with their transportation services. To increase sales, she took a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare snacks to sell. In the future, Susan hopes to improve the general living conditions of their family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare snacks to sell.

loans.name: Alcides Frank

texts.es:
Alcides es un joven muy emprendedor, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Parcona junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Desde muy joven ha trabajado para poder apoyar a su familia quienes son de bajos recursos económicos. Gracias a su desempeño en  su trabajo, lo han ascendido y él está muy contento porque con esto puede apoyar a sus padres en los gastos del hogar.
Una de las metas de Alcides es tener su licencia de Conducir para poder trabajar como chofer ya que esto lo favorecerá con mayores ingresos económicos. Él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado iniciará sus trámites para la obtención de su Brevete y así en poco tiempo aplicar para el puesto de Chofer en la empresa donde trabaja.
texts.en:
Alcides is a young enterprising man; he is 21 years old, single and lives in Parcona with his family.

He is a person with a great desire to get ahead. Since he was young he has worked to help his family who are economically disadvantaged. Thanks to his efforts at work, they have promoted him and he is very happy because with this he can help his parents with the household expenses. 

One of Alcides goals is to get his driver’s license so that he can work as a chauffeur as this will give him greater earnings. He is very grateful with Kiva investors because with the support they have provided him he will initiate the process to obtain his Brevete and in a short while apply for a position as a chauffeur in the company where he works.

loans.use: Process his driver's license

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria tiene 58 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera, pero tiene a cargo la responsabilidad de velar por sus padres, los cuales ya son ancianos; vive en casa propia en el distrito de Cayaltí, Provincia de Chiclayo en la Región de Lambayeque costa norte de Perú.

María se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimento de engorde de los cerdos, dicha inversión le servirá para poder vender por precio mucho mayor a sus animales lo que le generará mayores ingresos, mejorará sus ganancias y por consecuente su calidad de vida y la de su famila.
texts.en:
Maria is 58, single, but she takes care of her parents who are very old. She lives in her own home in Cayaltí District, Chiclayo Province, in the Lambeyeque region along the northern coast of Peru. 

María raises and sells pigs, and has applied for a loan of 2,000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase feed for the pigs. This investment will allow María to sell her pigs at a much better price and improve her income, earnings, and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: for the purchase animal feed to fatten her herd.

loans.name: Edison Loreto

texts.es:
Edison tiene 32 años de edad, su estado civil es soltero, sin hijos a su cargo,vive en casa propia la cual se situá en el distrito de Oyotun en la provincia de Chiclayo en la región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú, este distrito es una zona rural en la que su población se dedica a la agricultura, al crianza y venta de animales.

Edison se dedica a brindar servicios de jornalero – obrero con varios años de experiencia en el rubro; solicita préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa el monto es de 2000 nuevos soles para la compra de una moto-taxi y así incrementar sus ingresos para obtener un mejor nivel de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Edison is 32 years old, he is single, without children in his care. He lives in his own house which is in Oyotun district in Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Perú. This district is a rural area whose population works in agriculture, and raising and selling animals.

Edison works as a day laborer with some years of experience in this field. He asks Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles to purchase a moto-taxi and, in turn, increase his income to have a better quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Cesar Enrique

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 46 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, vive en casa propia en el distrito de Cayaltí, Provincia de Chiclayo en la Región de Lambayeque costa norte de Perú.

Cesar se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales; ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para la compra de animales de corral y arreglo de su casa, dicha inversión le servirá aumentar su ingresos y generar mayores ganancias mejorando también su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar is 46 years old and lives with his partner in a house they own in the district of  Cayaltí, Province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. 

Cesar makes a living by raising and selling animals; he has asked for a loan of 2,000 Peruvian nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy barnyard animals and to repair his house. This investment will help him to increase his income and to generate greater earnings, also improving his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy barnyard animals and to repair his house.

loans.name: Reinaldo Rafael

texts.es: Reinaldo cunado terminó sus estudios de bachiller, apoyado por su tía emprendió su propio negocio, con el fin de genera ingresos y poder  estudiar en la Policía Nacional. Así fue como en Febrero de 2011, compró con recursos de su tía una vitrina y la surtió y fue observando que sus ventas cada vez mas se incrementaban y por eso empezó a reinvertir las utilidades en su negocio. Poco a poco ha ido pagandole a su tía y logró tener mas vitrina, hoy su meta es expandirlo y estructurarlo cada vez mejor pues tiene que reunir dinero para estudiar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  papelería, como boligrafos, libretas, útiles escolares etc, para continuar vendiendo directamente a su clientela, mediante las modalidades crédito y contado. Reinaldo ha logrado construir una clientela de jóvenes y mujeres,  entre estudiantes y  amas de casa, comprando en almacenes especializados del centro de la ciudad para obtener mejores precios y hacer una oferta que le permita competir en el mercado.
texts.en:
When he finished high school, Reinaldo started his own business with the support of his aunt in order to be able to make a living and study to become a state police officer.  In February of 2011, he used the resources of his aunt to buy a display cabinet and stock it.  He began noticing that his sales went up each time and therefore he started to reinvest the profits in his business.  He has been paying back his aunt little by little, and he has been able to buy more display cabinets.  Today his goal is to expand and structure his business better and better since he has to put together enough money to study.  

Presently he is applying for a loan from Kiva, the first loan that he has gotten from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which he will use to buy stationary such as pens, notebooks, and school supplies, among other things, to continue to sell directly to his clients for cash or on credit.  Reinaldo has been able to build a clientele of young people and women, from students to housewives.  He buys from specialized warehouses in the center of the city in order to get better prices and make offers that permit him to compete in the market.

loans.use: to buy stationary such as pens, notebooks, and other school supplies to sell to his customers

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marissa works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.  Marissa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. for her general store business.

Marissa has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Shg Group

texts.en:
Maa Laxmi Self-Help Group is a group consisting of ten members, all of whom are women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. A few years back, they all were facing the same kind of situation of poverty, so they planned to start grocery shops where they can provide the basic household consumables to their customers. 

One of them is Subhasmita, who was selected as their president. Subhasmita is a 26-year-old woman living with her husband and her one son. The lady in the picture standing fourth from the left with her hand raised is Subhasmita.

Subhasmita runs a grocery shop to help her husband financially. She sells rice, grains, lentils, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil, etc. in her shop. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village. She likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her village. 

She has a plan to make her shop bigger and keep multiple things in her shop to satisfy her customers. She also wants to purchase the items for her shop in bulk directly from the wholesalers, for which she has requested a loan for purchasing items such as toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables.

loans.use: to purchase items, such as toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables, for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Maxi

texts.en: 11/8/14: A loan of Rp 10,000,000 helps Maxi to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to his community. Maxi is married with three children. He completed teacher training and became a secretary of a child development program at age 18. He now is a primary school teacher. However he struggles to save money as there is often unexpected family related expenses. To increase his income, Maxi has joined Kopernik’s Tech Kiosk network to sell simple life-changing technologies. He will use the loan to buy stock and grow his business. He is excited about Kopernik’s training program to learn about these new technologies, promote them to his customers and improve his general business skills.  Maxi plans to use the additional income to buy food and pay for his children’s education.

loans.use: to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to his community

loans.name: Servarius

texts.en: Sevarius is making great progress  selling green technologies in his community. He is excited to educate his customers in the health and cost benefits of the solar lights. Kopernik originally listed this loan with fixed monthly repayments however as actual sales are difficult to predict in advance, repayments were not being made at the fixed rate. This loan will be repaid as actual sales are made. He may even pay his loan off early! Sevarius hopes you can support him again.

loans.use: to buy renewable energy products and grow his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy feeds and re-stock 200 chicks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 300 chicks and chicken feeds

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Andrés tiene 31 años de edad, está trabajando en una carpintería desde hace 6 años donde asegura sus ingresos para   costear sus estudios. No tiene pareja ni hijos, pero piensa formar una familia a la que pueda mantener dignamente, ya falta poco para culminar su carrera de abogado y le falta un poco de dinero para ir pagando sus cuotas atrasadas ya que se endeudó para comprase una moto y electrodomésticos y no quiere abandonar tan cerca de lograr su título, ya que está por cumplir con su meta.
texts.en:
Andres, 31, has been working in a woodworking workshop for six years, where he earns an income to pay for his studies. He isn't married, nor does he have any children.  However, he would like to form a family who can live comfortably in the future.  

He is near the end of his degree as a lawyer, but he needs a bit of money to pay the instalments for his course.  He has fallen behind with these payments as he needed to buy a motorbike and some electrical appliances.  Nevertheless, he doesn't want to have to give up his studies so close to getting his qualification.  He is on the point of fulfilling his dream.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolás tiene 52 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, tiene dos hijos a su cargo,vive en casa propia, su domicilio está en Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, del departamento de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Nicolás brinda servicio de carga en su mototaxi y motocarguera, hace 3 años, transportando a moradores del mismo distrito y sus alrededores, él solicita el préstamo para capital de trabajo, ya que desea invertir en la compra de animales para su posterior reventa y así aumentar sus ingresos, obtener mayores ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su toda su familia.
texts.en:
Nicolás is 52 years old. He has a live-in partner and two children in his care. He lives in his own home, which is in Oyotún, in the province of Chiclayo, department of Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Peru. 

Nicolás has been driving his mototaxi for 3 years, transporting residents of the same district and the surrounding areas. He is requesting the loan to use as working capital, since he wants to invest in the purchase of animals to re-sell later and thus increase his income, which will in turn improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to have working capital to invest in the purchase of animals to re-sell later and thus increase his income.

loans.name: Reah

texts.en: Reah is a responsible homemaker who supports her husband in gaining income for their family. She is 33 years old and blessed with three children attending school. She and her husband aim to become successful to give their children a bright future. For this reason, Reah wants to improve her hog-raising business to generate a higher income. Having insufficient capital, she would like to access financial assistance from Kiva lenders, amounting to PHP 50,000, to buy hog feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her hogs. She is hoping that someday she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like chips, sugar, coffee, milk, etc. for her general store business. Mely has been in this business for 15 years. She also earns more income from buying and selling dried fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she requested additional loan to further build her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like chips, sugar, coffee, milk, etc.

loans.name: Martin Emilio

texts.es:
Martin, con 39 años de edad, es padre de un hijo y vive en unión libre con su pareja. 

Nació y se crió en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agrícolas al lado de su padre; gracias a ello, hoy en día tiene un cultivo de café, cuya cosecha es vendida y de esta manera obtiene los recursos para llevar el alimento a su hogar. 

El prestatario es un hombre pujante, luchador, dedicado a su familia y a su trabajo, eso lo motiva para trabajar largas jornadas y tratar de salir adelante; día a día lucha para sobrepasar los obstáculos que se le presentan. 

Martin solicita su primer ciclo de crédito para invertirlo en la compra de un plástico grande para construir una marquesina que es el lugar donde se pone a secar el café para luego venderlo. 

Martin sueña con mejorar su producción para obtener de su café una buena renta mensual, que le permita brindarles mejores condiciones de vida a su familia y una mejor educación a sus hijos, para que su futuro sea exitoso.
texts.en: Martin, 39 years old, is the father of a son and lives in common law marriage with his partner. He was born and raised in the countryside where he learned work in agriculture together with his father. Thanks to this he now grows coffee. He sells the harvest, and in this way he gets the resources to bring food to his home. He is a hardworking, striving man, devoted to his family and his job. This motivates him to work long days and try to move ahead day after day, overcoming the obstacles he encounters. Martin is requesting a loan in its first cycle. He will invest it by buying a big plastic to build a canopy, which is the place where one puts the coffee to dry before it gets sold. Martin dreams of improving his production in order to obtain a good monthly income from his coffee. This will allow him to provide better living conditions to his family and a better education to his children, so that their future is successful.

loans.use: to buy plastic to build a canopy and improve his coffee production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chicken feeds and water cans

loans.name: Hebert Alexander

texts.es:
Hebert se desempeña exitosamente en su negocio de cerrajería y soldadura de metal, siendo una persona muy reconocida en el barrio por su buen trabajo y servicio. 

Ya que ha laborado 5 años con los conocimientos que adquirió por medio de su trabajo en distintos talleres, ha tenido la oportunidad de mantener su trabajo y ha intentado mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. 

Por esta razón quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de herramientas para facilitar su trabajo como tranzador, prensa, compresor, un soldador y herramienta de mano. 

Con estos elementos podrá continuar prestando su servicio ya que la herramienta que utiliza esta en mal estado y hay otra que le hace falta.

Actualmente es soltero y vive con sus padres a los cuales siempre trata de ayudar económicamente para que puedan sustentar su hogar y mejorar su vida. 

Su mayor sueño es poder tener un gran taller con varios empleados y poco a poco podrá lograr su objetivo. 

Ayuda a un joven emprendedor con ganas de salir adelante con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Hebert has a successful business as a locksmith and metal welder; he is well known in the neighborhood for his good work and service. As he has five years of experience through working in various workshops, he has been able to keep his job, and has tried to improve his family’s living conditions. 

For this reason, he is requesting a loan to purchase tools for his work, such as leather-crafting tools, a press, compressor, welding gun, and hand tools. With these supplies he will be able to continue to provide his services, since the tools he currently uses are in poor condition, and he is lacking some. 

Hebert is single and lives with his parents, who he always tries to help financially, so that they can support their home and improve their lives. His biggest dream is to have a large workshop with several employees. 

Help a young, driven entrepreneur with a loan!

loans.use: to buy tools such as leather-crafting tools, a press, compressor, welding gun, and hand tools, which will allow him to improve his service and continue working.

loans.name: Laura Argentina

texts.es:
Laura de 33 años de edad, es una  muy dinámica, a ella le gusta participar en todos los eventos de la comunidad, es una persona muy respetuosa con las demás, eso la a llevado a que las personas le tengan mucho aprecio, ella aun convive con su  esposo y sus hijos de 2 años de edad. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de productos de cosmetología.

 Ella estudio hasta octavo grado en una escuela del lugar de residencia, fue muy reconocida por sus aspiraciones de sobresalir y ser alguien en la vida con el dinero que obtiene de las ganancias ayuda a sus padres en la compra de medicamentos así como en el sostén de comida y otras necesidades de su familia. 


La señora tiene un negocio de venta de productos de cosmetología, trabajo que lo aprendió con una de sus amigas quien le enseño como distribuir los productos a orden de catálogo. De esta forma, continúo trabajando y motivada por los ingresos económicos, también formo parte de un curso de formación de cosmetología impartida por programas del gobierno.
 
El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar tintes, tips, limas, peróxido, pinta uñas, labiales, polvos, rubor, etc. manifiesta que cada día la demanda crece  y las personas le encargan nuevos productos, esto le permitiría que venda otros productos, esto traerá mejores ingreso para ella y la de su familia, también su negocio que está ubicado en su casa, donde ha comenzado a montar su propio salón de belleza.

Los sueño son que su negocio crezca  día a día y ofrecerle el producto que las personas necesitan, también prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ella manifiesta que con el crédito lograra ampliar más su negocio, esto permitirá que se expanda con mayor eficiencia de acuerdo a las necesidades del cliente.
texts.en:
Laura, 33 years of age, is very dynamic and likes to participate in all the community events. She is very respectful of everyone, and this has made people appreciate her a lot. She still lives with her husband and 2-year old children. She currently makes a living selling cosmetics.

She studied until the 8th grade at a boarding school. She was recognized for her aspirations to get ahead and to be someone in life. With the money she gets from her earnings, she helps her parents purchase medications as well as food and her family's other needs.

The woman has a business selling cosmetics, work that she learned with one of her friends, who taught her how to distribute catalog order products. In this way, she continues to work and is motivated by the financial returns. She also enrolled in a cosmetology training course offered by government programs.

The loan that she is applying for is to buy dyes, nail tips, nail files, peroxide, nail polish, lipstick, powders, blush, etc. She says that everyday demand grows, and people order new products from her. The loan would allow her to sell other products, and this would bring better income for her and her family.

Her business is located in her home, where she has started to set up her own beauty salon. Her dreams are for her business to grow every day and to offer products that people need. She would also like to offer better service to her customers. She says that with the loan, she will be able to grow her business more, and this will allow her to expand with greater efficiency according to her customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy dyes, nail tips, nail files, peroxide, nail polish, lipstick, powders, blush, etc.

loans.name: Sin Ta Khar Village

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s Yasagyo township, this community currently has 18 village customers, including 6 CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members who help to lead the loan program in the area. This village is located in Myanmar's dry zone, where insufficient rainfall is very common. Most villagers are Buddhist and struggle finding access to affordable credit, as the state-owned agricultural bank is not active in the area.

The main income generating businesses in the village are farming, livestock raising, weaving, and trading.  Farmers used their past loan to buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, to boost the yields of their sesame, cotton, and groundnut crops.  The new loan would help borrowers buy livestock, such as goats and cows. These animals are important because they can be used during planting and harvesting seasons, which save farmers the $10 hourly cost of renting a tractor.  They also produce manure that can be used as natural fertilizer, and they can be sold at a profit of ~$50 each after many seasons of farm use.

Pictured above are the committee members from the Sin Ta Khar Village CBO: U Thaung, U Zaw, U Aung, U Tin, U Myint, and U Tin. Included in the photo (farthest to the left) is 60-year-old U Thaung, who lives with his five family members. With his past loan, he purchased high quality sesame and groundnut seeds. Given that he has a collection of 60 goats, he will use his new loan to invest in other breeds of livestock.

loans.use: to help 18 villagers raise and sell livestock

loans.name: Mauk Loke Village

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s Yin Mar Pin township, this community currently has 24 village customers, including 5 CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members who help to lead the loan program in the area. This village is located in Myanmar's dry zone, where insufficient rainfall is very common. Most villagers are Buddhist and struggle to find access to affordable credit, as the state-owned agricultural bank is not active in the area.

A new loan would enable borrowers to purchase farming seeds such as chickpea, sunflower, pigeon and paddy (rice).  For this season, most farmers planted sesame, but the yields were lower than expected due to weather inconsistencies.  In additional to selling the raw crops, farmers sell sunflower and sesame oil to other towns.  Although there is no pasture for goats and sheep near the village, this community will raise pigs and cows to supplement their farming incomes.  With their profits, the village is planning to construct a 500-meter deep well to supply their families with fresh water, even during drought periods.

Pictured above are the committee members from the Min Ma Kone Village CBO: U Khin, U Chit, U San, U Aung, and Daw Thi.  Included in the photo is 62-year-old U Khin, who has ten family members. As he has a large family, he has to do both farming and raising livestock to support their needs.  As he bought three pigs with his previous loan, he is planning to invest his new loan in paddy, chick pea and pigeon pea seeds.

loans.use: to help 24 villagers to purchase chickpea, sunflower, pigeon pea, and paddy (rice) seeds

loans.name: Grupo Chuimaza Group

texts.es:
Al trabajar la tierra bajo un sol agotador sin embargo dispuesto a sudar todo el tiempo para brindarle un mejor futuro a sus hijos. De 33 años de edad ya con grandes aspiraciones en dar a conocer a su comunidad y a todos los que la visitan la actividad que ella realiza con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación, es casada y vive con su esposo con el deseo de superar en la vida e alcanzar grandes sueños que ella quiere realizar en la vida, ella tiene cuatro hijos los cuales son estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad, (ella tiene una blusa de color azul con cuadritos y se encuentra en la primera fila de la derecha a izquierda)

El trabajo que ella realiza con tanto esmero es la compra y venta de cortes típicas dicha actividad lo realiza en su casa y en lugares cercanos de su comunidad donde ella vive, la segunda actividad que ella realiza es la venta de hilos negocio que realiza con una hermana por más de tres años porque les genera una ganancia para el bienestar de su familia y mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia y comunidad.

Ella ha sido un ejemplo en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se han unido a Manuela para poder emprender sus negocios para que cada uno de ellas pueda supera y tener ingresos importantes.
El uso que ella le dará al préstamo que ella está realizando es para la compra de mercadería o corte típica para luego su respectiva venta por los alrededores. Uno de las aspiraciones de ella es tener un local en el mercado de su comunidad.
texts.en:
The borrower works under the grueling sun, willing to sweat all the time to provide a better future for her children.  At 33 years of age, she has a great desire let her community and all the visitors know about the activity she engages in with so much effort and dedication.  She is married and lives with her husband, and has a desire to succeed and has big dreams that she wishes to achieve in life.  She has four children that are students at the community school.  (She is wearing a blue blouse with squares and is first in the row from right to left).

The work she performs with so much care is buying and selling traditional clothing.  She carries out this activity in her home, and in places near the community where she lives.  The second activity she is engaged in is selling thread, an activity she has been sharing with a sister for more than three years because it generates profits for the welfare of her family and improves her family’s financial conditions and those of the community as well.

She has been an example in her community and, for this reason, a group of women have joined with Manuela to be able to establish their businesses so that each one may succeed and have significant incomes.  She will use the loan she is applying for to purchase merchandise, traditional styles, for later respective sale in the surrounding areas.  One of her aspirations is to have a sales location in the community market.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, (traditional clothing).

loans.name: Taymour

texts.en: Taymour is a 25-year-old married man, living with his family in Dhamar city, Yemen. He works in his pharmacy store. He has been graduated from the college of pharmacy for three years. Now, he is a pharmacy man. Taymour started his business two years ago with financial support from his father. With that financial support, he could open his own pharmacy in the city of Dhamar. Taymour earns good profits, but he faces a hardship of inadequate capital to meet the high demands of the patients. He thinks the loan from Kiva lenders will help him very much to increase his business. For this reason, he has applied for a loan of 300,000 YER from Kiva partner AMB. He will use this loan to buy more medical requirements and medicines for his pharmacy store. Taymour looks forward to improving his business and expanding it more by opening other branches inside the city where he lives. He hopes to open a saving account in AMB.

loans.use: to buy more medical requirements and medicines for his pharmacy store.

loans.name: Merla

texts.en:
Merla has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for seven years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her four children. She has to work hard, with the determination of having better income, to provide their children with a better education. 

To improve sales, Merla would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 30,000, she could purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Merla wants to transform her sari-sari store into a grocery store. She dreams only for her family to have a well-contented and fulfilled life. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. At these meetings she also draws strength and inspiration from studying the word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Viet's Group

texts.en:
Viet is barber who was born in 1979. He lives in Dong Anh which is well known for growing vegetable. Viet has one son who is currently studying in first grade. His wife is also a barber. Viet has been doing this job for seven years. His family total income is VND 8,000,000. 

Viet has participated in the SEDA program since 2010, with the current loan cycle being the fifth, and has successfully repaid a loan of VND 8,938,000. Due to lack of capital to extend his business, he would like to borrow VND 9,810,000 to buy more tools, such as glue, shampoo and hair rollers for his barber shop. Viet wishes that he could earn more money, to improve the living standard of his family and provide  a better condition for his child’s studies.  

Viet is also the leader of a group that includes six other SEDA members, who are included in the following list:
1. Lan is a worker who is 23 years old. She is requesting a loan of VND 9,810,000 to refurbish her house.
2. Cuong is 35 years old. He runs a food stall and sells beverages to earn a living. He would like to borrow VND 9,810,000 to buy more food for his stall. 
3. Thang is 37 years old and the mother of 2 children. She is applying a VND 9,810,000 loan through SEDA program to buy sim, phone cards, to resell.
4. Trang is a barber who is 29 years old. She is requesting a loan of VND 9,810,000 to invest her hair salon. 
5. Binh is a worker who has two children. She is 31 years old. She wants to borrow VND 9,810,000 to sell beverages. 
6.That is a 61 years old. She has two children. She runs a store to repair computers. She is requesting a loan of VND 5,014,000 to buy tools for her store.

loans.use: to buy more tools, such as glue, shampoo and hair rollers for his barber shop.

loans.name: April

texts.en:
As a parent of three children, April works hard to support her family. She has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. April is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell for her buy and sell vegetable business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. April has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Lerma

texts.en:
Ma. Lerma is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Leyte, Philippines. She has been engaged in her hog-raising business for more than five years now. This is the source of her income. Her husband works as a fisherman. 

Ma. Lerma's hog-raising business was affected when typhoon Haiyan hit the country several months ago. She has just started with it again. Ma. Lerma is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise, feed and food supplements for the pigs. With this, she will be able to improve her hog-raising business thus allowing her to grow healthy pigs which she can then sell at the market. Ma. Lerma  believes that through hard work, she will be able to improve her way of living and support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feed and food supplements for the pigs

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase sacks of charcoal for her business to sell. Judy has been in this business for 5 years. She earns more income from fish vending. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Judy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for her business to sell.

loans.name: Natela

texts.en: Natela is 57 years old. She lives in a small village of Kobuleti district with her son and his family. The family runs an agricultural business. They have a small land, where they grow fruits to sell seasonally at local markets. As the income is only seasonal and is not enough to cover everyday costs for the family, Natela decided to start a new business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 2,500 USD. With the loan she will renovate rooms and will rent them out. She will have a stable income and will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate rooms to rent in order to earn a stable income.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 54 years old and married with six children; one of her children is in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

Julie has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business for eight years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Marissa works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Marissa is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice grains to sell.

Marissa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en: Fadia is a 28-year-old lady living in Baqaa, Jordan with her husband and three sons and daughter. She has been helping her husband in covering their children's needs for two years by selling Russian gold, clothes, and detergents. She has found clothing sales profitable. For that reason, she is now seeking a youth loan to buy a new collection of clothes to sell in order to respond to her customers' requests and raise her income. She is also seeking to open her own mini market in the future to sell food products and detergents so that she will improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a new collection of clothes to resell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a 59 year old woman and a mother of three children from Leyte, Philippines. She is engaged in a sari-sari or retail business selling various goods and items to the people in her area. Maria's store was damaged when typhoon Haiyan hit the country several years ago. As of now, she has just starting to work on her store again. She is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, cooking oil, salt and sugar. With this, she will be able to augment her stocks, which will attract more buyers in her store. In the future, Maria hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, cooking oil, salt and sugar

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en: Bienvenida is a 46-year-old married woman, and a mother of three grown-up children, from Leyte, Philippines. Bienvenida has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income. Bienvenida's hog raising business was affected when a typhoon hit the country several months ago. As of now, she is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets, feed and food supplements for her pigs. With this, Bienvenida will be able to improve her hog raising business again, thus augmenting her profits and income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed and food supplements for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy broken plastic materials for recycling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a push-cart and bags of water to start a water delivery service to become more independent.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay operational costs for the transport business

loans.name: Eminda

texts.en:
Eminda is 42 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Eminda has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from buying and selling  charcoal.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en: Herminia, a 59-year-old married mother of three, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Herminia has been selling dried fish in the Philippines for 10 years, and is now requesting a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of dried fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo comenta que sus metas serian convertirse en un profesional, trabajar en el campo que está estudiando y así ayudar a su familia e independizarse.
Vive con su hermana y su marido trabajando actualmente para estudiar. La carrera que está siguiendo es la de ingeniería agroindustrial.
El pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en cubrir sus gastos de titulación y así seguir luchando por su meta.
texts.en:
Arturo says that his goals are to finish his degree, to work in the field for which he is studying, to help his family and to become independent. 

Arturo lives with his sister and her husband. Arturo works in order to study for his degree in agro-industrial engineering.

Arturo is applying for this loan in order to pay to apply for his degree title and continue working towards his goals.

loans.use: to pay to apply for his degree title.

loans.name: Djiguiya  2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUIYA 2 est constitué de 9 hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34ans et 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles polygames à BLADIE, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Ils sont à leur  3ème prêt avec l’institution, les 2 prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Le  maïs est la spéculation cultivée de MADOU, le 2ème homme debout dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche.
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour exploiter  2 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 300.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  de gérer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Djiguiya 2 Group is made up of nine married men who, on average, are 34 years old and have five children each, all living in polygamous families in Bladie, a village in Bougouni, in the third administrative region of Mali.

These men work with microfinance institution [MFI] Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully complete their rainy-season farming activities. They are on their third loan with the MFI, [and] the two previous loans have been properly repaid.

Corn is the crop grown by Madou, the second man standing in the photo, right to left. With his loan, Madou plans to purchase farm inputs and seeds, and to pay the costs of labor and hoeing to farm two hectares. The crop will be sold after the harvest, at the market in the village to a group of male and female customers.

Madou expects to see a profit of 300,000 CFA francs per crop. This profit will allow him to repay his loan and to manage the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and seeds, and to pay the costs of labor and hoeing.

loans.name: Elilanie

texts.en: Elilanie is 20 years old from Baggao, Cagayan. She is taking up a BS Business Administration. Her family is having financial difficulties that she even experienced going to school with not enough money for food. Because of that incident, she persevered and she is trying her best to finish her schooling and be able to help her family.   To make her dreams happen, she has requested P 10,000 financial assistance from the KIVA lenders. She is hopeful that KIVA lenders will approve her loan so she can pay her tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay tuition fee

loans.name: Sally

texts.en: Sally is 36, married, and blessed with three children. She engages in buying and reselling dry goods within the public market, while her husband cultivates their small farm. She aims to improve the business and increase her income to help her husband in financing the school fees of their children and sustain their daily necessities. Having insufficient capital, she wants to avail a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy more stock of dry goods to sell in the market. She is hoping that she that requested amount will further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dry goods to sell in the market.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia raises pigs to make a living. Having done it for many years, she has helped her husband's income from farming to sustain the needs of her family. She is hoping to earn a better income from her business and make it a better source of income for the family. To boost her income from her pigs, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC, which she joined recently, in order to buy feeding supplies.

Olivia has aspirations of soaring high to improve the general living situation of the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
Domingo tiene 36 años de edad, vive en el Caserio Yerma que pertenece al distrito de Cañaris, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, y está ubicada en la Provincia de Ferreñafe que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la cria y comercio de ganado, realizando esta actividad desde hace mas de tres años, adicionalmente se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte por mototaxi ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de ganado y de esta manera generar ingresos adicionales para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Domingo is 36 years old and lives in the town of Yerma in the Cañaris district, a tranquil community with a hot climate.  Its population works in agriculture, trade, and livestock farming. The district is located in the Ferreñafe Province of the Lambayeque region, in the northern coast of Perú.

He works in the raising and trade of livestock, and has been performing this work for over 3 years.  Additionally, he works offering motorcycle taxi transportation service.  He has requested this loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 nuevos soles (PEN) for the purchase of livestock.  In this way, he will generate greater additional income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of livestock, with which he will generate a greater income and improve his quality of life.

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en: Ferdinand has been  running a retail business in order to provide  the needs of his family. He sells assorted groceries in their village to make a living. His family helps him in operating the business. To increase sales, he took a new loan from GDMPC micro-credit to buy additional grocery goods to sell. In the future, Ferdinand wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 40 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Jocelyn has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc

loans.name: Blesilda

texts.en:
Blesilda is 50 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are in school.

Blesilda is in the agricultural business, farming root crops in the Philippines. Blesilda requested a PHP 6500 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and pay for labor costs.

Blesilda has been farming root crops for five years and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Blesilda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
Wonderful people, meet David, who is 53 years old, very ambitious, hardworking and very humble. He hails from Makimeny village in the rural town of Siongiroi. He has a beautiful wife and together they have five children whom they value and love. Being raised in a humble background has nurtured David to practice humility and patience in life, and that what it takes to be a successful farmer. David never got any formal employment and has been practicing farming as a source of livelihood for the past 20 years. Through those years he has been making good profits. Being a very ambitious farmer, all the profits that he gets in farming he reinvests back into his farm and uses the rest to support his family and parents. 

David passionately loves dairy farming and this can be shown through the nickname he has given his cow “cheniaj” which makes him proud whenever he is milking the cow.

David has a very expansive land and has planted trees and Napier grass, which has high protein and is used to feed his dairy cow. As a result of this he has always wanted to buy more dairy cows but has been facing challenges of lack of funds; that is why he is seeking funds to buy a quality dairy cow. David plans not to just buy an ordinary dairy cow but plans to buy a quality breed that will be producing between 10-15 liters of milk a day.

Demand for milk has gone up and David has been unable to meet the demand but through the loan he will be able to meet the milk demand in his village. David has a vision of accumulating more profits and opening a large milk-selling business where he will be selling milk products such as cream and yoghurt. Through the loan he will improve his living conditions and impact society positively through creating employment in his farm and milk shop.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario, es una mujer de 51 años de edad, que habita en un municipio área metropolitana de la ciudad, y conforma su familia con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 24 y 33 años. Para genera ingresos realiza de todo un poco, por un lado vende minutos a celulares y recargas, por otro lado vende confitería y por otro elabora con su propias manos, vestidos y manteles tejidos. Su negocio nació desde el año 2011, por la necesidad de generar ingresos familiares, que apoyaran la gestión de bienestar de su hogar. Su dia laboral inicia desde las 7 de la mañana y no termina antes de las 10 de la noche, trabajando así durante todos los dias de la semana, con el fin de lograr su  meta  de aumentar los ingresos familiares. Como su mayor desafio es tener el capital de trabajo suficiente, para fortalecer su negocio, Rosario está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará un computador para agregar el servicio de internet e impresión y ofrecerlo, este es un servicio complementario a las llamadas telefonicas y ha sido solicitado por su clientela. Con esta inversión aprovechará a su clientela, quien ya la conoce y mejorará su negocio, con mas ingresos fortaleciendo tambien su infraestructura empresarial.
texts.en:
Rosario is a 51-year-old woman who lives in a metropolitan area of the city in a municipality.  Her family is made up of her partner and her two sons, ages 24 and 33.  In order to generate income, she does a little bit of everything.  She sells cell phone minutes and top-ups, as well as sells sweets, and also manufactures woven dresses and tablecloths with her own hands.

Her business was born in 2011, from the need to generate more family income to support the upkeep and wellbeing of her home.  Her workday begins at 7 in the morning and does not end before 10 at night, working like this every day, with the end of obtaining her goal to increase the family's income.  Her greatest challenge is having enough working capital to strengthen her business.

Rosario is applying for a kiva loan, and it is her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With the loan she will purchase a computer to add internet and printing services for her clients.  With this investment she will make the most of her clientele, who already know her.  She will improve her business, and with greater income further strengthen her business.

loans.use: to purchase a computer to add internet access and printing services for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy peanuts for peanut butter-making

loans.name: Lina Marcela

texts.es:
Lina es una mujer dedicada a su familia y a su labor. 

Su tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido salir adelante, sobrepasando diversos obstáculos que se le presentan. 

Desde hace 2 años inició su propio negocio, prestando el servicio de arreglo de uñas y maquillaje, además, presta el servicio a domicilio, según el requerimiento de sus clientes. 

Esto le ha permitido generar los recursos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y a solventar las necesidades de su bebé. 

El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de una motocicleta que le permita transportarse fácilmente para prestar su servicio a domicilio ya que actualmente usa transporte público y esto le genera retrasos en sus servicios.

Esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y prestar un servicio más completo a sus clientes, de una manera más ágil y eficiente; lo que beneficiará el margen de utilidades que percibe por su labor. 

Lina manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder continuar con su labor, acreditar y fortalecer bien su negocio para lograr ser más competitiva en el mercado y así tener la capacidad para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Apoya a una emprendedora colombiana que quiere cumplir sus sueños!
texts.en:
Lina is a woman who is very dedicated to her family and her work. Her tenacity and perserverance have allowed her to get ahead, while surpassing many different obstacles that have stood in her way.

2 years ago, she started her own business, providing nail grooming services and makeup. She also provides in-home services, depending on the desires of her customers. Her work has allowed her to generate more income in order to support her husband with the economic burdens of the household, and to meet the needs of her baby.

With the loan she is requesting, she will invest in buying a motorbike, which will allow her to travel more easily in order to provide her home services. She currently uses public transport, which really delays her business. This will allow her to continue her work and provide a more complete service to her customers, in a more agile and efficient way. This will also improve her profit margins for her labor.

Lina says that her biggest desire is to be able to continue her work, and to establish and strengthen her business so she can be more competitive in the market. Therefore, she will have the ability to provide a better quality of life for her family.

Support a Colombian entrepreneur that wants to fulfill her dreams!

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike which will allow her to travel more easily in order to provide her home services.

loans.name: Djiguiya 3 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUIYA 3 est constitué de10 hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40ans et 6 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles polygames à BLADIE, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Ils sont à leur  3ème prêt avec l’institution, les 2 prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Le  maïs est la spéculation cultivée de AROUNA, le 1er homme debout dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite.
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter des intrants, la semence, payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour exploiter  2 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 320.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  gerer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Djiguiya 3 Group is made up of 10 married men who, on average, are 40 years old and have six children, all living in polygamous families in Bladie, a village in Bougouni, in Mali's third administrative region.

These men work with microfinance institution [MFI] Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully complete their rainy-season farming activities. They are on their third loan with the MFI, and the two previous loans have been properly repaid.

Corn is the crop grown by Arouna, the first man standing in the photo, left to right. With his loan, he plans to purchase farm inputs and seeds, and to pay the costs of labor and hoeing to farm two hectares. After the harvest, the crop will be sold at the market in the village, to a group of male and female customers.

Arouna expects to see a profit of 320,000 CFA francs per crop. This profit will allow him to repay his loan and manage the family's day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and seeds, and to pay the costs of labor and hoeing.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
This is Ruth. She runs a tailoring business and made good use of a previous loan to buy the materials she needed to do her work. She has been in this line of work for years, and shares her responsibilities with her husband.

She is requesting a new loan for PHP 20,000 to buy additional supplies such as fabric, cloth and thread. The profits she earns from this loan will help her to meet her daily needs. She is grateful for the support she receives from Kiva lenders.

Ruth wants to buy another unit of sewing machine. She dreams of a prosperous life and good health for her family. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week; this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Pasiencia

texts.en:
Pasiencia is thankful for the previous financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy spare parts and cover maintenance costs of her computer shop. The loan was also a big help for the education of her children and in their everyday expenses. 

Now, Pasiencia is applying for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy parts and cover maintenance costs of her computer shop. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Pasiencia hopes for her business to expand and grow bigger. She dreams a happy, healthy and wealthy life for her family as well. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda owns and operates an ornamental plant business to earn a living. She has been successful in this enterprise for 20 years, and she was able to repay her previous loan. She also has found ways to boost her income by managing a farm and maintaining a tricycle unit that is used to provide transportation service.

Erlinda would like to take out a new loan to buy additional gardening materials and supplies. She is requesting an amount of 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy greater quantities and varieties of ornamental plants such as ylang-ylang, golden shower, dahlias and various hanging plants.

In the future, Erlinda wants to grow her business, and desires to give her family a good life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Fellowship groups, each composed of 15 to 30 community partners, gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials and supplies for her business.

loans.name: Bevelith

texts.en:
Bevelith is 43 years old and single with  children.  With  children in school, Bevelith works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Bevelith has been in this business for six years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita, a 53-year-old married mother of six children, one of whom is in school, has been  farming calamansi (an orange-like fruit) in the Philippines for 10 years now. Having borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business, she is requesting a new loan for PHP 6000 in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Margarita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items for resale

loans.name: Gesilsito

texts.es: Gesilsito: Es un señor cordial, originario de Waspam, tiene 56 años de edad, casado con 10 hijos: 7 son mayores de edad y 3 adolescentes que estudian su secundaria. Cuenta con una experiencia de más de dos décadas de ser docente. Con el propósito de reducir el hacinamiento, solicita financiamiento para mejorar su vivienda de tambo de madera y comprar materiales: postes de madera, clavos, madera y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener una vivienda con las condiciones necesarias y apoyar en el desarrollo humano y profesional de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gesilsito is a warm-hearted man, originally from Waspam. He is 56 years old, married, with ten children: seven of them are adults, and three are adolescents attending secondary school. He has over two decades of experience as a teacher.

For the purpose of reducing overcrowding, he is requesting a loan to improve his wooden stilt home and buy materials: wooden posts, nails, wood, and to cover labor costs. 

His dream is to have a home with the necessary conditions and to support the human and professional development of his children.

loans.use: to buy materials: wooden posts, nails, wood, and to cover labor costs.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Los jóvenes forman parte importante en el fortalecimiento de un país para su desarrollo. Futuros profesionales en los diversos campos laborales de la vida y del  país, Jorge tiene 21 años de edad y es soltero el se a propuesto sacar su familia adelante en el sistema económica.

La actividad que el dignamente realiza es la agricultura campo que le ha venido abriendo puertas para nuevas oportunidades en la vida par poder llegar a ser alguien mejor en un futuro y por medio de lo que realiza el puede tener un ingreso económico para el sustento diario de su familia, los ingresos la obtiene con la siembra de tomate que lo realiza en su comunidad, el eligió esta actividad porque hay pocas personas que se dedican a dicha actividad y por lo tanto es muy rentable, la segunda actividad que el   realiza es  de jornalero.

El uso respectivo que el le dará al préstamo que está solicitando es para la compra de pilón de tomates para sembrarlas, los sueños de Jorge es la ampliación de su siembra de tomate para que le generen más ingresos económicos para el y su familia.
texts.en:
Young people play an important part in strengthening of a country for its development.  They are future professionals in the diverse work force of our country.

Jorge, age 21, is single.  He has decided to get his family ahead financially.  He works with dignity in agriculture in the fields.  This has been opening doors for him to have new opportunities in his life in order to be able to be someone better in the future.  Through the work that he does he is able to have income for his family’s daily sustenance.

The income that he gets is from growing tomatoes in his community.  He chose this business activity because there are few people engaged in said activity.  Therefore, it is very profitable.  His second business activity is being a day worker.

He will use the loan that he is requesting to buy tomatoes by the ‘pilón’ [a measurement of weight] in order to grow them.  

Jorge’s dream is to expand his tomato plantings in order to generate more income for himself and for his family.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Jose Salvador

texts.es:
José, su estado civil es acompañado, vive con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijas, todos dependen de los ingresos que él genera, no tienen ayuda económica del extranjero; don José se dedica al comercio de CDS, DVS, accesorios de bisutería y juguetes, lo fundo hace ocho años y lo atiende solo en un horario de 7:00 a.m. a 2:00 p.m., manifiesta que en ocasiones los cambios climáticos le afecta en sus ventas.
Invertirá en la compra CDS, DVS, aretes, pulseras, anillos, collares y variedad de juguetes para niños/as, podrá tener más mercadería disponible en su negocio, espera aumentar sus ventas e ingresos, ve en la delincuencia un posible riesgo.
Sus aspiraciones son brindarles una mejor condición de vida a sus dependientes y terminar su crédito con buena calificación.
texts.en:
José is in a common-law marriage, and he lives with his life partner and their two daughters. They all depend on his income and have no financial support from abroad. Jose makes his living selling CDS, DVDS, jewelry accessories, and toys. He started eight years ago and works by himself from 7:00 am to 2:00 pm. He says that changes in the weather sometimes affect his sales. 
He will invest in CDS, DVDS, earrings, bracelets, rings, necklaces, and a variety of children's toys, so that he can have more products available for sale, and thus he expects to increase his sales and revenue. He sees theft as a possible risk. 
He hopes to provide better living conditions for his dependents and to pay back his loan with a good credit rating.

loans.use: He will invest in CDS, DVDS, earrings, bracelets, rings, necklaces, and a variety of children's toys, so that he can have more products available for sale.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Christina works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending.  Christina is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to resell for her rice retailing business.

Christina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice for resale

loans.name: Dúo Rosas De Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es: Dúo Rosas de Vista Hermosa La encargada de este grupo es la señora María Antonieta quien se dedica a la venta de ropa de bebé, perfumes, cremas, talcos para damas y caballeros en general, bolsas de niñas y películas educativas, discos de música para niños y adultos tiene su negocio desde hace 7 años.  Contando con el apoyo incondicional de sus dos hijos está muy satisfecha por los logros alcanzados bajo la dirección de Dios.  Muchos clientes la visitan y se ve en la necesidad de comprar más ropa de bebe en diferentes tallas y colores, calidad, también varias películas, por tal motivo se ve en la necesidad de pedir otro préstamo para comprar lo que le hace falta y no quedarles mal a sus clientes.
texts.en: The person in charge of the Dúo Rosas de Vista Hermosa group is María Antonieta, who makes a living by selling baby clothes, perfumes, creams, talcum powder for ladies and gentlemen, children’s bags, educational films, and CDs for children and adults. She has been doing this for seven years. She has the unconditional support of her two children. She is very satisfied with what she has achieved with God’s guidance. Many clients visit her and she needs to buy more good-quality baby clothes in different sizes and colours, as well as several films. For this reason she needs to ask for another loan in order to buy what she doesn’t have and stay in her clients’ good graces.

loans.use: to buy creams, perfumes, and other things to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials for making baby pampers to sell.

loans.name: Edwin Froilan

texts.es:
Edwin de 25 años de edad, el joven es una persona muy conocida en la comunidad por la actividad que realiza, es una persona muy servicial forma parte de un grupo de jóvenes que se llaman guardianes ambientalistas y sirve como presidente del mismo.  Él se creció con sus padres y sus abuelos él ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida a su formación académica ya que en la actualidad se encuentra cursando su último año de estudio en una universidad, estudia  3 días por semana y los de más días se dedica al trabajo de reparación y mantenimiento de equipos informáticos.

Edwin tiene una experiencia de 3 años en reparar equipos de informática, ya que es una actividad que aprendió de su hermano mayor quien ahora se encuentra en estados unidos, y le enseño a trabajar y motivado por las ganancias y por su clientela decidió continuar con el negocio que su hermano dejo.

Hoy en día el joven se encuentra estudiando su último año para graduarse de licenciado en trabajo social, de esta manera podrá tener un empleo fijo y mejorara sus ingresos para él y su familia. 


El dinero será utilizado en compra de herramientas y materiales para realizar su trabajo de reparación de computadoras, con más eficacia y también otra parte de su crédito será invertida en gastos de graduación de su carrera, de esta forma vera sus sueños hechos realidad. 


 Las proyecciones que él tiene para futuro son las de tener un local más grande y surtido donde él pueda contratar a dos personas más para prestar un mejor servicio. 

De esta forma tendrá mejores ingresos y podrá terminar de cancelar el crédito y hacer una nueva solicitud para ampliar  y mejorar su negocio y comprar un vehículo ya que también le contratan sus servicios en centros escolares donde tiene que viajar y se le dificulta el traslado de los materiales de trabajo.
texts.en:
Edwin, a 25 year old young man, is very well known in his community for the activity that he is engaged in.  He is a very helpful person, and belongs to a group of young persons called “Guardianes Ambientalistas”[Environmental Guardians, a group of children, young people, and adults engaged in preserving the environment and improving living conditions through activities such as recycling*], and serves as president of this group.  He was raised with his parents and grandparents and has devoted most of his life to his academic training.  Currently, he is enrolled in his third year of university study.  He studies three days a week and he spends the other days working in computer repair and maintenance.  

Edwin has three years’ experience repairing computers, an activity he learned from his older brother who now lives in the United States.  He taught him to work and, motivated by the profits and customers, he decided to continue the business that his brother left.

Today, the young man is studying in his final year and will graduate with a degree in social work.  In this way, he will be able to have steady employment and improve income for himself and his family.

He will use the money to purchase tools and materials to perform his computer repair job more efficiently, and he will use the other part of his loan for the graduation expenses of his degree.  In this way, he will see his dreams become a reality.

In the future, he plans to have a bigger location stocked with supplies where he can hire two additional employees and offer better service. In this way, he will have better income and will be able to pay off the loan, and then make another application to expand and improve his business.  He will also purchase a vehicle because he has to travel to the schools that contract his services, and it is difficult to transport his work equipment.  

http://www.bing.com/videos/searchq=guardianes+ambientalistas+and+el+salvador&qpvt=guardianes+ambientalistas+and+el+salvador&FORM=VDRE#view=detail&mid=A62D86D2EAED042FD2FCA62D86D2EAED042FD2FC
.

loans.use: to purchase tools and materials to perform his computer repair job more efficiently, and he will use the other part of his loan for the graduation expenses of his degree and, in this way,he will see his dreams become a reality.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en: Emelda, is age 49, married to a private employee and blessed with four children. She has managed a transportation business in their village for almost eight years and earns a net income of PHP 350 daily. Her net income on this business is usually spent on their agricultural needs for their farm. Due to insufficient funds for her business she would like to request a loan of PHP 18,000 to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 40-years-old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school.
