Mary Ann works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mary Ann has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Mary Ann aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 38-years-old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, sugar, eggs, etc.

Eden has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 9 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport and buying and selling vegetables.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, sugar, eggs, etc

loans.name: Richelle Ann

texts.en:
Richelle Ann works hard to support her family. Richelle Ann is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to buy a new side car and other spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Richelle Ann has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Richelle Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a new side car and other spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Abahuje Snc Group

texts.en:
Claudine is a group leader who is 34 years old. She is married with 2 children who are between 4 and 7 years old, and both of them go to school. 

The group is called Abahuje, which means "togetherness" in English. They sell different products, but they have the same aim of coming up with solutions for a better future. 

Claudine has been selling domestic animals for the past 2 years. With the loan, she would like to buy 3 cows and 2 goats to sell.  The profits will be used to pay school fees for the children and provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more cows and goats to sell.

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en:
Mareta is a pedagogue and has a specialty of historian. With this very important specialty, especially being a specialist of Armenian History, Mareta works at the school for 33 years. 

She teaches Armenian History which is considered to be one of the most important subjects at the schools. Mareta lives in Stepanavan City of Lori region with her small family. Her husband is the director of the school and their single daughter also has pedagogical education and she works as a teacher of elementary classes. Mareta also has a group of pupils whom she helps with the entrance examination teaching them Armenian History. Nearly all her pupils manage to have high scores as she says.

Mareta really hopes to get this loan and she is already impatient to spend it on the purchase of a computer and new literature since, as she says, nowadays the children always demand something new, such as new methods, new information and etc., so she can have a lot of innovations during her lessons both in the methods of teaching and connected with the lesson topics as well.

loans.use: to buy a computer and new literature.

loans.name: Israa

texts.en: Israa is a 20-year-old married lady living in Southern Ghour-Jordan. She is a mother of one son. She has been helping her husband with improving their living conditions and covering their only son's needs by running her own business selling accessories, shoes, and baby clothes for two years. She is seeking to open her own store in the future to build a stronger customer  base. Now she is requesting a loan to buy more accessories, clothes, cosmetics and shoes to raise her profit, since she doesn't have enough money to do so. For that, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more accessories, shoes, cosmetics and clothes to sell

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is 59-years-old, married and has three children, one of whom is in school.

Magdalina is in the agricultural business, farming root-crops in the Philippines. Magdalina requested a PHP 7,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to buy fertilizers and pay for her laborer.

Magdalina has been farming root-crops for ten years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Magdalina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for her laborer.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is a 27-year-old married woman from Batumi, seaside of Georgia. She lives with her husband, two sons, and parents. 

Irine is a consultant at a local shop and her husband is a distributor. They both get small monthly incomes, which is not enough for such a big family. 

Irine decided to renovate her own flat, which is at the seaside, in order to rent it out. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $2300. With the received credit she will purchase all the building materials to renovate the flat. When the flat is renovated she will rent it out and will get stable income.

loans.use: to renovate a flat and rent it out in order to get stable income

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik lives with his family in the city of Stepanavan, which is in the Lori region. Now he is a taxi driver with his own car. He says he is very thankful to his numerous regular customers who help him earn for his family's living by ordering his taxi daily, some of his customers even several times during a day. Among his customers are his friends, neighbors, relatives and once unfamiliar people who already became his friends. 

Gagik is married and in his family he has one very important and urgent problem for the solution of which he is ready to work night and day. Gagik has two children and unfortunately, his newborn son has a severe childhood disease which changed the life of the whole family. Gagik believes that his son will recover, they just must pray and wait, wait with belief of God and of his almighty being. Doctors say that the child needs a very long and particular course of treatment and there is a chance that he may get rid of that problem.

So this loan amount is expected like never before, since now it is time for the baby’s treatment course and this loan will be one more step which will bring the child closer to victory over his disease, closer to the day that he will run healthy, happy and cheerfully to the delight of his parents.

loans.use: to pay for his baby’s treatment course

loans.name: Abizeranye Acb Group

texts.en: Abizeranye ACB is a group led by Hasina who has been actively leading the group for the past 8 years. Hasina and her fellow group mates strive to work hard for a better living. All the group members sell different items and they all aim to attain a big level in their business. Hasina sells various items in her stall, and has requested the loan to add more of items such as basins, flasks and sugar for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in her business. Hasina puts up her hand as symbol of the group leader.

loans.use: To buy more basins, flasks and sugar for sale

loans.name: Saiid

texts.en:
Saiid is a Syrian citizen, married father of one child, and born in 1984. Because of the low social and financial conditions in Syria, he decided to move with his family to Lebanon seeking better job opportunities and living conditions. 

Since eight years ago, Saiid started working as a supervisor in a Home Cleaning Services Office to increase his income and cover his family’s expenses and needs, especially for his newborn baby girl. 

Today, Saiid is acquiring a Loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua, to register his newborn daughter in the government’s records, as he wishes to open his own Home Cleaning Services Office to save a profit for his precious daughter’s future.

loans.use: To register his newborn daughter in the government’s records

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Sopheap is 46 years old. She is a married woman who has been a farmer since 1992. She lives with her husband and two children in the Prey Veng Province of Cambodia. Her husband and children are workers. Together, they can earn approximately $23 per day. Now Sopheap would like to request a loan to build a latrine. This loan will help her family live more healthily and in better conditions. In the future, she plans to run a clothes shop and renovate her house.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Bladimir Antonio

texts.es: Bladimir de 27 años de edad vive con su tía. Él es un joven emprendedor que desde hace 4 años se gana la vida vendiendo productos de forma ambulante en los cantones cercanos a su vivienda. Bladimir desea surtir su mercadería ya que ha observado que sus ventas son buenas, y cada día son más los clientes que solicitan sus productos y preguntan por algunos con los que él no cuenta, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: juegos de cama, sabanas, hamacas, percheros, planchador, roperos plásticos, etc. Y así atraer a más clientes ofreciendo mayor variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Bladimir is 27 years old and lives with his aunt. Four years ago he became a young entrepreneur, making a living as a traveling salesman on the street corners near his home.

Bladimir wants to increase his stock of merchandise because he makes many sales, and each day, more customers purchase his products and ask for some that he doesn't have.

For this reason, he is requesting a loan through FUSAI to purchase comforters, sheets, hammocks, coat hangers, clothing irons, plastic storage sets, etc. so that he can attract more clients by offering a greater variety of products.

loans.use: to purchase comforters, sheets, hammocks, coat hangers, irons, plastic storage sets, etc.

loans.name: Albino

texts.en:
To make a living, Albino operates a business providing transportation services in his village, and he earns well from this. 

He had successfully repaid his previous loan, which was used to improve the business. He always finds ways to improve his situation, working more to provide a better living to his family. He recently took a new loan for additional funds for motorcycle maintenance to secure the services provided. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.  

Albino wants to improve the general living situation of his family.

loans.use: to have additional funds for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Ailenita

texts.en:
Ailenita is 30-years-old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like powdered drinks, canned goods, shampoo, etc. 

Ailenita has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like powdered drinks, canned goods, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel de 27 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 7 y 4 años de edad. Él es un hombre tenaz que desde hace 2 años se gana la vida con la venta de productos básicos como: jabones, pan dulce, golosinas, etc. además vende en su vivienda productos como: antojitos típicos, papas fritas, fruta partida, etc. Manuel desea ampliar su negocio por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: bebidas frías y calientes, leches instantáneas, y productos de la canasta básica. Para ampliar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Manuel is 27 years old and lives with his partner and their two children, who are 7 and 4.

He is a persevering man, and for the past 2 years, he has made a living by selling staple goods like soap, sweetbreads, cookies, etc. He also sells products such as traditional corn-based dishes, french fries, and cut-up fruit from his home.

Manuel wants to expand his business, so he is requesting a loan through FUSAI to purchase to purchase cold and hot drinks, powdered milk, and staple goods.

loans.use: to purchase cold and hot drinks, powdered milk, and staple goods to expand his business

loans.name: Crestia

texts.en:
Crestia has been earning from raising pigs to sell, and she has been doing this for many years. She takes her time in taking care of her pigs and it is her desire to improve her business. 

She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. She took a new loan recently to buy additional piglets to raise. She plans to expand her piggery to gain more income for a better future.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego es un joven emprendedor, soltero, tiene 23 años de edad y vive en San Martín junto a su familia.
Para poder brindar un mejor apoyo a su familia estudió la carrera de Técnico Agropecuario porque sus papás tienen cultivos y quieren tener una mejor producción. Desde hace más de 6 años se dedica al cultivo de cacao, tiene amplios conocimientos y siempre ofrece productos de calidad.
Diego está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar abono orgánico y realizar el pago de mantenimiento de los cultivos de cacao, de esta manera en la etapa de cosecha podrá obtener productos de excelente calidad y generar mayores ingresos. Gracias a esto Diego seguirá estudiando para poder superarse y más adelante formar una empresa.
texts.en:
Diego is a young entrepreneur. He is single, 23 years old, and lives in San Martín with his family.

In order to provide more support to his family, he studied for a degree in Farming Techniques because his parents are farmers and want to achieve better production. For more than 6 years, he has grown cocoa for a living. He is very knowledgeable and always sells quality products.

Diego is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, with the support that they give him, he will be able to purchase compost and pay for the upkeep of his cocoa plants. That way, at harvest time, he will be able to harvest high-quality products and make more income. With this, Diego will be able to continue studying so he can better himself and start a business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase compost to grow cocoa

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna was born in Stepanavan city in the Lori region. She is 57 years old and she still lives here with her big and lovely family, and as she says, she never left her city, which is one of the most beautiful pieces of her sweet motherland. 

Susanna has higher pedagogical education and 36 years of working experience in this field. Now she also works at the school as a teacher of Armenian Language and Literature. As she says, her second occupation is no less important than her first occupation at the school; it is her private courses with the pupils whom she helps with great pleasure and devotion to pass the entrance exams. 

Susanna is married and she has two sons; her elder son is already a very famous and skilled beekeeper in their city, and her younger son works at the gas station. Susanna’s husband is happy with his farming activities. 

This loan Susanna asks in order to buy a computer and some literature in order to make her lessons more informative and more attractive for her pupils.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some literature in order to make her lessons more informative and more attractive for her pupils

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 48-years-old and married with ten children.  With seven children in school, Julie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock of goods to sell like candies, bread, soap, shampoo, noodles, etc.

Julie has been in this business for 30 years. 

In the future, Julie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods to sell like candies, bread, soap, shampoo, noodles, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more grocery products, an air conditioner and to renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Dúo Yeshua Group

texts.es:
DUO YESHUA 
EL señor Carlos de 45 años de edad, casado,  desde hace 10 años posee una Tienda  ubicada en la Alameda, que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio ella  ha mantenido y  a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de don Carlos es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a FAPE; con el préstamo quiere comprar productos de consumo diario  para seguir creciendo con su tienda.
texts.en:
DUO YESHUA

Carlos is 45 years old and married. For the past 10 years, he has owned a store on the main street. Thanks to his efforts, he has managed to establish and improve his house. Through his business, he has maintained and supported his family.

Carlos' dream is to be able to improve his family's quality of life through the microloan that he is requesting from FAPE. With the loan, he wants to buy staple goods to continue expanding his store.

loans.use: To purchase staple goods

loans.name: Felimon

texts.en:
Felimon owns and operates a stall for street food. He has been successful in this business for many years, and he repaid his previous loan used for the business. He also finds ways to improve his income by cooking and selling other food items and pastries, as shown in the photo.

Relative to this, he would like to take a new loan to increase his profit. This will be his seventh loan from Kiva and his fifteenth time to borrow from CCT. He is requesting an amount of PHP 50,000 to buy products like fish and squid balls, quail eggs and other street food, in larger quantities.

Felimon hopes for his business to thrive more and he wants to own and operate a food stall within a commercial market. He dreams of giving his children a good life in the future. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week, where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more ingredients for his fish balls and other dainties and sweet meats that he sells.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in the city of Sevan in the Gegharkunik region. She lives here with her husband and two already grown-up children. Her husband and son are taxi drivers and her daughter is a teacher at the school. Susan, despite having a vocational education, she always managed to be employed in different workshops and organizations.  Since 2007 till now she works at one of the biggest and famous telephone operators in Armenia and there she is a member of the technical staff. Susan now is very concerned about the health of her husband. The last visit to doctor made clear that he must pass an operation since he has the spinal hernia, which causes him much pain and greatly limits his movements in everyday life. 

Susan will be very happy to have this loan which will help her to pay for the operation and finally her beloved husband will get rid of both the pain and endless visits to doctors.

loans.use: to pay for the operation of her beloved husband

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and transportation, and to hire help

loans.name: Cruz Maria

texts.es: Cruz de 30 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 12 y 8 años de edad. Ella es una mujer tenaz que se gana la vida con la venta de productos por catalogo, actividad que realiza desde hace 2 años. Cruz desea encementar el piso de su vivienda, además desea comprar un portón para instalarlo en la entrada de su vivienda, para tener mayor seguridad, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, grava y arena para encementar el piso de su vivienda y comprar un portón y pagar por la instalación del mismo frente a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Cruz  is 30 years old and lives with her partner and their two children, who are 12 and 8 years old. She is a persevering woman who makes her living by selling products by catalog, which she has done for two years now.

Cruz wants to install a cement floor in her house, and she also wants to buy a gate to install at her house's entrance for the sake of security. Therefore, she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to purchase cement, gravel, and sand for the cement floor, and to buy a gate and pay for its installation at the front of her house.

loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, and sand to install a cement floor in her house; and to buy a gate and pay for its installation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to preserve cocoa and plantain crops.

loans.name: Buthaina

texts.en: Buthaina was born in 1965. She is married and lives in Hashmiya-Jordan with her retired husband. Buthaina is seeking to improve their living conditions as much as she can. For that, she started her own business selling Hooka flavors and smoking materials at an independent store where she is running her business perfectly. But it's not licensed yet as she doesn't have enough money to do so. She is also out of merchandise and needs to buy more tools and materials. As Buthaina doesn't have enough money to do all of that, she needs your help in giving her a loan.

loans.use: To license her hooka flavor store and to buy new merchandise for it

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 51 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school; Marissa works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like powdered drinks and groceries.

Marissa has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Marissa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like powdered drinks and groceries.

loans.name: Maria Elicia

texts.es:
María, se dedica  a la siembra de granos básicos, es acompañada, vive con su compañero de vida y cuatro nietos; trabaja de siete de la mañana a tres de la tarde, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres y en la actualidad es la forma con que genera los recursos económico para cubrir las necesidades de su familia, en ocasiones contrata mozos para finalizar en menor tiempo su jornada, ya tiene 15 años realizándola de manera independiente. Con su experiencia ve en el factor clima un riesgo, por sus cambios tan inesperados.
Invertirá el crédito en la compra de insumos agrícolas y preparación del terreno en el que cultivara granos básicos, eliminara la maleza y protegerá su cosecha de plagas, espera aumentar la productividad, atraer nuevo clientes y resarcir su deuda a la brevedad posible.
Su visión es ampliar su negocio, dar a su familia buena alimentación, vestuario, salud y educación.
texts.en:
Maria earns a living planting basic grains. She is married and lives with her life partner and four grandchildren. She works from seven in the morning to three in the afternoon. She learned this work from her parents and it is currently the way that she generates the economic resources to cover her family’s necessities. She occasionally hires laborers to finish her work day in less time. She has been doing this independently for 15 years. With her experience, she sees the weather factor as a risk because of its unexpected changes. 

She will invest the loan in buying agricultural supplies and to prepare the land on which she will cultivate basic grains. She will eliminate weeds and protect her harvest from pests. She hopes to increase production, attract new customers and repay her debt as soon as possible. 

Her vision is to expand her business and to give her family good nourishment, clothing, health and education.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to prepare the land on which she will cultivate basic grains.

loans.name: Wazma

texts.en: Wazma is a 53-year-old married woman who is mother of six children. Wazma started a small business selling different kinds of snacks and food supplies at her house three years ago. After she noticed that her neighbors started to come and buy and ask for other products, she decided to open her own independent mini market where she is currently selling her products and making a profit. Now her mini market is running out of products, and in order to be able to cover all the area needs, she is now applying for a loan to add more products and to cover her clients’ requests.

loans.use: To add more variation in the food products that she sells.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Arshaluys

texts.en:
Arshaluys is 54 years old and she lives in the city of Kapan in the Syunik region. Arshaluys is divorced and her single son is already married and lives with his family in the capital city Yerevan. Arshaluys used to work for a shoe fabric company, then for some time she moved to Yerevan and while living with her son she worked as a saleswoman. She moved back to Kapan in 2011 and now she is in trading business; in her flat she sells a great assortment of women's clothes, underwear, sport suits and children's clothes as well. As she says her customers are all the citizens of her city since the city is small and she became popular very quickly, having great assortment and cheap prices.

Arshaluys refreshes her clothes assortment with new fashionable ones regularly, nearly twice in a month from the Yerevan wholesale markets. Now she is going to change the seasonal clothes, from summer to autumn. For this she hopes to have Kiva support.  With the loan amount she will buy autumn season clothes and also clothes for school-aged children, for the beginning of a new school-year.

loans.use: to buy autumn season clothes and also clothes for school-aged children.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a Palestinian Refugee. He is a married father of one child and born in 1988. He has worked in an antiques shop for five years and has a limited salary compared to the expenses and needs of his family. 

Due to the living difficulties of Palestinian refugees in Lebanon, Ahmad is working hard to provide his beloved family with a better living. For this reason he is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to buy a new living room, and to store necessary wood logs to warm up during the coming winter season.

Ahmad hopes he can make his own business in the future to improve his financial situation and plan a better future for his family.

loans.use: To buy a new living room, and to store necessary wood logs to warm up during the coming winter season.

loans.name: Davron

texts.ru:
Даврон жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 44 лет. Он женат и имеет 3-их детей. Он обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку. Сам Даврон живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Жена Даврона также не имеет образования и является домохозяйкой, она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей.

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Даврон занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Также Даврон работает в местной школе учителем. От бизнеса животноводства он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает Даврону в его деле, она продаёт молоко, полученное от скота. Сейчас Даврон хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Даврон очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Davron is a happy and hardworking 44-year-old man. He is married and has 3 children. He comes to Arvand for the first time once he learned about the possibility of obtaining financial support. Davron lives with his family in a rural area. He does not have a higher education because he did not have an opportunity to study at a university due to his family's financial difficulties. Davron's wife also does not have an education and is a homemaker, involved in household work and raising the children.

Davron is involved in his own business to have an income for living. He fattens up and sells cattle. Davron also works as a teacher at a local school. He earns a good income from the animal husbandry business. The wife also helps Davron in the business by selling milk obtained from the livestock. Now Davron wants to increase his livestock quantities in order to expand his business. This is why he came to Arvand and wants to buy livestock. Davron hopes very much for a positive result and thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Kan Aye Village

texts.en:
Located in Kan Aye Village in Central Myanmar’s Taung Thar township, this community currently has 70 village customers. Five of them are CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members helping to lead the loan program. The area has limited rainfall and only specific crops, such as sesame and beans, can be grown in this region.

With a new loan, village members are planning to buy inputs, such as seeds, insecticides, and fertilizer, for their farms. Access to these quality inputs will boost crop yields and, therefore, farming income. To supplement crop sales, some people in this community also grow limonia trees (which are sold to cosmetic companies) and roll cigars at home.

Pictured above are U Soe, U Myint, U Min, U San and U Kyaw. They are the committee members from the Kan Aye Village CBO. Included in this photo is U San, who is 34 years old and lives with his wife and three children. He invested his previous loan in the production of sesame and peanuts, but his yields were not as high as he expected due to drought. Therefore, he will invest his new loan in cultivating limonia trees.

loans.use: to help 70 villagers purchase high quality inputs to boost sesame and peanut yields

loans.name: Club De La Amistad Group

texts.es: María de 52 años de edad tiene 04 hijos independientes. La Alcancía Comunal “Club De La Amistad” conformada por 09 socios solidarios y responsables. Hace más de 01 año que María se dedica a la venta de productos golosinarías como caramelos y chicles. Como actividad segundaria el fin de semana ofrece tamales. Solicitó el  crédito para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio la cual comprara galletas, caramelos, chupetines y chicles. Su deseo es poner un Kiosco golosinaría en su local propio. El grupo “Club De La Amistad” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el crédito brindado. María es la primera del lado derecho y viste casaca azul.
texts.en:
María is 52 years old and she has 4 independent children. The communal bank: “Club de la Amistad” is made up of 9 responsible and supportive members. For over a year María has been selling candy products such as caramels and chewing gum. As a secondary activity, Maria offers tamales during the weekends. 

She is seeking the loan to continue investing in her business by purchasing cookies, caramels, popsicles and chewing gum. Her wish is to set up a candy kiosk in her own store. The group, “Club de la Amistad” is thankful to the Kiva loan lenders for the loan given. María is the first person on the right-hand side, wearing a blue sweater.

loans.use: to continue to invest in her business by purchasing cookies, caramels, popsicles and chewing gum.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a single young man, born in 1994, and has an intermediate level of education. Due to the low financial situation of his family, he was forced, four years ago, to leave school and start working in order to cover his family’s expenses and needs. He is the sole breadwinner out of three members of his family.

With his persistence, Ali was able to improve his family’s living conditions. He is acquiring now a Youth Loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car which is necessary for his transportation to and from work easily. 

Ali wishes to open his own Mobile shop to save some profit for his future.

loans.use: To buy a car which is necessary for his transportation to and from work easily.

loans.name: Ma. Linda

texts.en: Ma. Linda is a nipa weaver from Leyte, Philippines. Ma. Linda has been in the weaving business for more than 9 years now. She works with her mother. Ma. Linda is asking for a loan to buy  more nipa palm for weaving. With this, she and her mother will be able to weave more mats to sell in the market. In the future, Ma. Linda hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more nipa palm for weaving

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to process his university degree.

loans.name: Melojean

texts.en:
Melojean works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years now.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall. In the future, Melojean would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Ekhlas

texts.en:
Ekhlas is a married woman who was born in 1984. She is a mother of four. Her husband works at a government entity and at the same time works as a personal driver. 

She has been helping her husband in improving their living conditions by selling clothes for two years. She is now seeking to buy a new collection of clothes to respond to her customers' requests and to raise her sales, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, Ekhlas has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy a new collection of clothes to sell

loans.name: Ibragim

texts.ru:
Ибрагим добродушный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 56 лет. У Ибрагим очень большая семья. Он женат и имеет шестерых детей. Со своей семьёй Ибрагим живёт в сельском посёлке. Для того, чтобы иметь доход на проживание он занимается своим бизнесом. Вот уже на протяжении 10 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхозкультуру, а также выращивает лук. Затем, когда собирает урожай, вывозит на большой базар и там продаёт свой урожай. 

Раньше он занимался деканством и потом решил реализовывать свой урожай. Также как дополнительный доход, Ибрагим имеет от другого вида бизнеса. У него имеется несколько голов скота, которых он выращивает для дальнейшей продажи. Но сейчас Ибрагим хочет расширить бизнес, именно по выращиванию сельхозкультуры. Но сейчас у него недостаточно собственных денежных средств, чтобы закупить семена для посева урожая. Поэтому Ибрагим обратился в Арванд и хочет взять кредит для закупа семян для посева. Ибрагим очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Ibragim is a kind and hardworking 56-year-old man. Ibragim has a very large family. He is married and has six children. Ibragim and his family live in a rural village. He is involved in his own business to have an income for living. He has been involved in growing agricultural crops and onions for 10 years. He then gathers the harvest, takes it to a large market and sell it there.

He was previously involved in dekhan farming and then decided to sell his own harvest. Ibragim also has an additional income from another type of business. He has several heads of livestock that he fattens up for subsequent sale. Now Ibragim wants to expand his business, specifically the farming on, but he currently does not have enough of his own savings to buy seeds for sowing. This is why Ibragim came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to buy seeds for sowing. Ibragim hopes very much for a positive result and thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy seeds and expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's school expenses.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a widow with three children. She also takes care of additional family members (orphans).
Halima has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for 12 years, and works seven days out of every week. Halima sells her products from home, by means of wholesale/retail. She has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from  MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal.

Halima also generates additional income through rental rooms and selling piped water. Her main business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations is to build more rental income. She lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is single with one child and takes care of additional family members.  She lives in rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major expense includes food and medication.

She operates a restaurant at the market on retail basis and serves all kind of people in her restaurant.  Maria has been in this business for the last 4 the years, working seven days a week. 

She has requested for a loan of 200,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, beans, sweet potatoes, flour and cooking oil.   Her major challenge includes transportation and seasonality.  She is aspiring of buying a fridge for her restaurant.

loans.use: buy bunches of green bananas, beans, sweet potatoes, flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 46-year-old woman, married to John, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with three children. Regina has been a fruit and vegetable vendor for a period of ten years, earning an income of KES 8,000 at the end of every month.

Regina is now servicing her fourth loan of KES 11,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the entire amount to buy the following fruits; watermelons, mangos, grapes, oranges, bananas, and vegetables.

Regina plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees to her children and hopes to become a successful business woman.

loans.use: To buy watermelons, mangos, grapes, oranges, bananas, and vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Evelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional rice to sell for her  business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional rice to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is aged 44, married to a farmer, and blessed with three children. 

She has owned and managed a transportation business in their village for almost 10 years and earns a net income of PHP 300 daily.

Due to insufficient funds she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 14,000 to pay for the repairs and maintenance of her motorcycle. 

She's hoping that her business will continue to become more profitable.

loans.use: To pay for the repairs and maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a university degree.

loans.name: Korng

texts.en:
Korng is 20 years old, a student and a shop assistant. She lives in Siem Reap Province of Cambodia. She can earn approximately $3 per day. 

Because of the lack of financial support, Korng would like to request a loan to pay for her tuition fee. This loan will help her graduate with a specific skill. 

In the future, she wants to have a personal souvenir shop in Siem Reap.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
This is Mary Grace, 26, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jerico and they have a child. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
  
Mary Grace operates a salon business. She offers hair styling, hair grooming, manicures, pedicures, and the like. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy supplies for her salon like shampoo, hair treatment creams and oils, and other things needed for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Mary Grace dreams to be able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

loans.use: To pay for beauty supplies and hair products needed in her salon.

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor is a married woman and a mother of four children from Leyte, Philippines. 

She is engaged in selling seafood products like fish, shrimp and crabs. This is the source of her income.

Flor is requesting for a loan to buy more fish, shrimp, crab and other seafood products to sell. 

With this, she will be able to sell more to her customers thus increasing her sales and income. 

In the future, Flor hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more fish, shrimp, crab and other seafood products to sell

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a 39-year-old woman married to John, who adds additional income to support their family.  They are blessed with two children. 

Priscilla has been operating a clothing shop for a period of ten years, earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Priscilla is now requesting her fifth loan of KES. 48,000 and intends to use this amount to buy some additional shirts, blouses ,trousers, dresses and children's clothes to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Priscilla plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees to her children and hopes to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: To buy additional shirts, trousers, dresses and children's clothes to add to her stock, which is running out.

loans.name: Maa Tarini Shg Group

texts.en:
Maa Tarini Shg consists of ten women from a small village in Odisha. They formed a group to help themselves share their problems and to solve their problems themselves. 

One of them is Sapna, who was selected as the President of Maa Tarini Shg. The lady standing first from right with her hand raised in the photo is Sapna. Sapna is 27 years old and is staying with her husband and her two children. She is involved in growing and selling vegetables in her village. Her husband is supporting her in this activity. 

She has requested a loan of 165,000 INR, which will help her to purchase the required resources for vegetable cultivation. She says her portion of the loan amount will help her to purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labor charges.

She, along with her group, says"Thank you, Kiva, for this support".

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a 40 year old married woman and a mother of three children from Leyte, Philippines.

Aida earns a living through her food vending business selling home cooked foods to the people in her place.

Aida is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients for cooking like meat, vegetables, cooking oil, salt and seasonings. With this, she will be able to cook more which allows her to sell more to her customers. 

In the future Aida hopes of expanding her store so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family especially for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for cooking like meat, vegetables, cooking oil, salt and seasonings

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is 42 years old and she is married to Edwin. God has blessed them with four loving children. Life indeed is hard. But by the grace of God, they were able to raise their children well and they are helping each other in working for their family.

Crisanta owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community and the store is just connected to or just inside their houses. Here you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg, etc.  She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price then she will sell it per piece for a higher price to have profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passerbys and the people in the community. She earns Php300 a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting an Php 8,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.

Crisanta hopes that her business will thrive more and that she will be able to send her children to college. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Mirabai Shg Group

texts.en:
In 2014, 12 women from a small village in the Koraput district in Odisha stepped out and formed a group named Mirabai Self-Help Group. They help each other, share their problems, and solve them among themselves. They celebrate their festivals together in their village. 

One of the women from this group is Nila (the lady standing with her hand raised). She is the leader of the group and she has seven goats. She purchases the goat kids from the market and takes care of them. She provides vaccine and fodder to them when required. She sells them for meat to the local butcher shops when they grow. 

It takes eight to nine months for her to raise and sell them. She goes out in the morning to leave the goats grazing in the fields and returns by noon. Then she cooks for her family. She resumes taking care of her goats by feeding them at home. Her husband assists her in selling and maintaining these goats. 

In this way, she is earning to improve her cash flow, which is not sufficient to manage her daily activities. She wants to enlarge her business, so she wants to purchase 10 more goats. In this way, she can earn a good amount after all expenditures in her business. She and her group members have requested a loan of 144,000 INR for her group so that they can all earn more and improve their families' cash flow.

loans.use: To purchase goats, fodder, and vaccine

loans.name: Lois

texts.en:
Lois is a 57-year-old widow who is taking care of six children and has been operating a cereals stall for a period of ten years, earning an income of KES. 10,000 at the end of every month.

Lois is now servicing her sixth loan of KES. 60,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the entire amount to buy beans, maize, green grams and rice to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Lois plans to use the anticipated income to open a permanent cereals stall and hopes to become a successful business woman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy beans, maize, green grams and rice to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with three children, two of whom go to school. She takes care of one additional family member.  She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expense includes food and school fees.

Teddy sells fruit juice and other soft drinks on retail basis at the market. She has been in this business for the last 3 the years.  She works six days a week and earns additional income from selling piped water.  

She has requested for a loan of 200,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy oranges, passion fruit, pineapples, oranges and crates of soda. Her major challenges includes seasonality of fruits and electricity to make the juice. 

She is aspiring to build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy passion fruit, pineapples, oranges and crates of soda

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en:
Carlita is a 62-year-old married woman and a mother of two grown up children from Leyte, Philippines. She earns a living through selling seafood products like crab, shrimp, fish and others. This is the source of her income.

Carlita is asking for a loan to buy more fish. shrimp, crab and other seafood products. With this, she will be able to sell more to her customers thus increasing her sales and income. 

In the future, Carlita hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more fish. shrimp. crab and other seafood products

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single, with four children, one of whom goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She lives in rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses includes food and medication.

Alice sells green bananas from the market on retail basis. She has been in this business for the last two the years. She works six days a week.

She has requested for a loan of 200,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. Alice's major challenge includes transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring of educating her children to university level.

loans.use: To by bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Peace Group

texts.en:
The two members of the Peace Group are married people who, on average, are 36 years old with three children. Both of them live in traditional families in Teshie, one of the populous neighborhoods in the city of Accra.

They are on their sixth group loan with the ID-Ghana micro-finance institution, seeking to meet their customers' needs. They are selling African wax-prints and shirts.

Joyce, the female in the photo, is part of the Peace Group selling African wax-prints and materials. She intends to use her loan to buy African wax-prints and materials from the main market. She then retails them in Teshie, where she is in high demand by customers for the quality of her products, to clients composed of men and women, for cash. She makes good monthly profits and a portion of which is used to pay off the loan and its interest, and the rest to be put into her savings and also take care of her home.

loans.use: To buy African wax-prints and materials from the main market.

loans.name: Maa Serabali Shg Group

texts.en:
Maa Serabali Self Help Group is made up of ten women from a small village of Odisha, India. All the members of this group are involved in different activities, such as betel leaf cultivation, milk selling, paddy and vegetable cultivation, etc. They are very hardworking women having a willingness to learn new business trends. They all help and support each other. Whatever they are earning from their businesses is used for their monthly household expenses. 

One of the group members, Binodini, is the president of this group. The lady standing with her raised hand in the photo is Binodini. Binodini is 22 years old and lives with her husband, parents-in-law, and two children. She does betel leaf cultivation. She produces betel leaf and sells it at the market. Her husband is a farmer. Her husband helps Binodini in betel leaf selling at the market. 

Binodini is planning to buy standard-quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides, so she can produce more betel leaf and can increase her income. Binodini, along with her group members, is asking for a loan amount of 150,000 INR to invest in their business activities. She will use her portion to purchase standard-quality seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for her betel leaf cultivation. She wants to construct a house for her family. She says, on the behalf of the group members, "Thank you, Kiva, for providing this opportunity for us!"

loans.use: to purchase standard-quality seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for her betel leaf cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 700 chicks and chicken feeds

loans.name: Maa Mangala Shg Group

texts.en:
Girija is a 36-year-old lady who lives with her husband, parents-in-law, and three children in a small village in Odisha, India. In the picture, the lady standing with her raised hand is Girija. She is engaged in paddy cultivation. Her husband is doing the same business. Some years ago, Girija formed a group with nine other women from her village with the group name of "Maa Mangala Self Help Group". All the group members are engaged in different business activities, such as selling milk, vegetable cultivation, etc., to alleviate their poverty. 

Girija is the president of this group. She motivated all the group members to form this group so they could help and support each other in their business and personal lives. Girija, along with her group, requested a loan of 150,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase standard-quality seeds and fertilizers for her paddy cultivation. She hopes to build a house for her family, and she is very grateful to Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a 47-year-old woman from the town of Baybay, Leyte. She is married with nine children aged 6-25.  Mercedita and her husband have been fishing for 25 years now. This is their main livelihood. She is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy fuel and fishing net so they can continue fishing. 

Her loan will be the means for her to recover her loss caused by the typhoon that hit their area months ago. In the future, she hopes to have more boats so she can have a better income in their fishing business.

loans.use: to buy fuel and fishing net

loans.name: Chamrong

texts.en:
Chamrong is 24 years old, a student and a trainee security guard. He lives in Takeo Province of Cambodia. He can earn approximately $5 per day. 

Because of the lack of financial support, he would like to request a loan to pay his tuition fee. This loan will help him graduate. In the future, he wants to find a better job.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 55 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to buy more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for twelve years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, noodles, soft drinks, and beverages.  In the future Anita would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Hello, world!  Meet Nancy, a 35-year-old, very energetic, hardworking and ambitious small scale farmer.  She hails from Kiamutugu village in the rural town of Kerugoya, a very fertile place that has wonderful weather patterns that support farming. She is happily married and has been blessed with 2 lovely children. 

Nancy passionately loves farming and has been doing it for the past 7 years and has never looked back.  The animals on her farm have been given names of “wangechi” which is from a person’s name, and taking care of them makes her very proud. Crop farming is close to Nancy’s heart but she faces financial challenges buying farm implements.  

That is why she is requesting a loan. Through the loan she will be able to buy good quality seedlings and fertilizer that will boast her crop production.

Nancy always says, “To be a successful farmer all you need is good quality seed, fertilizer and advice from successful farmers”. Improved crop production will immediately result to more profits and hence improved living conditions.

When asked how this loan will benefit her your family, Nancy replied "I will be able to educate my children and feed my family."

loans.use: buy good quality seedlings and fertilizer that will boast her crop production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy water tank and cotton for mushroom growing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's college tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 300 chicks and chicken feeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy maize brand (chicken feed)  and packaging materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for fruit, meat, condiments, and corn to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lorener

texts.en:
Lorener is 39 years old from the community of Baybay, Leyte. She is married with six children. Her eldest is 22 and her youngest is 4. 

Lorener and her husband has been engaged in fishing for 22 years now. 

She is asking for a loan of 30000 PHP to buy wood, fishing nets and fuel for her boat. These will be necessary so she can continue to do fishing for her family's needs. 

In the future, she hopes to make a major repair and renovation on her boat as part of her maintenance so they can be more productive.

Her income will be for her family's daily consumption and the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy wood, fishing nets and fuel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his grandson's school fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chicken feeds and 200 chicks and finish her chicken shelter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chicken feeds and water tank

loans.name: Hungry Lions Group

texts.en:
Tsitsi is the chairlady of Hungry Lions Group. The group is based in Dzivarasekwa 3, a township in Harare. Tsitsi is a tailor by profession.  She is a widow with three school going children. Tsitsi started her trade working for other tailors until she saved up some money to buy her own sewing machines. Her progress was slow until she heard about Thrive and came to business training and was advanced a loan together with her group members.

With her first and 2nd loan from Thrive, Tsitsi has managed to grow her business and she now sews uniforms and wedding attires. Tsitsi has also established a brand name for her business, being “Chibvaruranhamo Tailoring Shop”, translated meaning Tearing Poverty Apart Shop. Tsitsi will use the money she borrows to change from using a small sewing machine to a heavy duty one. The growth of her business has also had a positive bearing on her personal life as she has managed on her own to send her oldest child to boarding school, providing her children with quality education.

loans.use: To buy a heavy duty sewing machine

loans.name: Praise Group

texts.en:
Viola lives in Budiriro, Harare. She is a member of the Praise group. She started her poultry business two years ago when she realized that her rental income could no longer cover her household commitments, such as paying fees for her deceased sister's two children, now attending high school.  Since her husband died as well, she did not have enough income to sustain her. 
On the first 100 chickens she raised, most of the birds died as a result of poor feeding. A friend from her ROSCA group told her to seek training on how to raise chickens. After getting training, her business started doing well.
She then thought of expanding her business buy keeping not only broilers chickens, but layers as well. Viola has identified the market for eggs are not satisfied in her community. With a Kiva loan Viola can be able to buy layers and feeds as well.

loans.use: to expand her poultry business

loans.name: Anenyasha Group

texts.en:
Grace, 44, started doing business in 2002 after her husband died. At the time, she was not employed and she did not have any stream of revenue to support her and her 2 children. She started off by selling fruit and vegetables. During the first 2 years of the business, inflation affected her working capital a lot in that after selling products at low price, when she restocked prices would have gone up. A friend from her group, Anenyasha, advised her to start trading as a cross border. After getting a passport she then started selling clothes and shoes, restocking from South Africa, Botswana and Mozambique.
She thinks selling clothes and shoes alone is not enough and she has identified the market for household goods, i.e. Televisions, Fridges and Stoves. She has started getting orders from the people in the community but these needs high capital and she is confident that a Kiva loan can help her to meet more orders.

loans.use: To buy household goods for resale.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Kuña aty, lo que quiere decir “unión de mujeres”, es un grupo nuevo que se formó con la unión de mujeres trabajadoras que quieren salir adelante.
Ramona es una de ellas, el negocio que tiene es la venta de prendas variadas que hace de manera ambulante, es muy trabajadora y luchadora, quiere dar a su familia todo para una vida digna y sin privaciones. Pide este préstamo para comprar prendas variadas para la venta, y de esa forma poder seguir con su negocio como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group is called "Kuña aty", which means "unity of women". It is a new group that formed with the coming together of working women who want to progress.

Ramona is one member. Her business is selling a variety of clothing in the streets. She is very hard-working and tenacious and wants to provide her family with all they need for a dignified life without hardships. She is requesting this loan to buy a variety of clothing for sale and in this way continue with her business as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase roofing beams and zinc and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement and sand and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: La Sra. María Mercedes, continua con su labor como comerciante vendiendo comida en una avenida principal, gracias a esta actividad económica y los financiamientos obtenido ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos con los estudios y mejorar las condiciones de su hogar, su objetivo con este nuevo crédito que solicita es comprar verjas para instalar en algunas ventanas que aun le hace falta para darle condiciones optimas a su vivienda.
texts.en:
María Mercedes continues with her work as a merchant by selling food on a main avenue.  Thanks to this business activity and the loans, she has managed to get her children ahead with their education and to improve the condition of her home.

Her objective with this new loan that she is requesting is to buy grills to put on some of the windows that still need them.  She will do this in order to put her home in optimal condition.

loans.use: to buy grills for the windows.

loans.name: Luís Alfonso

texts.es:
Luís de 45 años de edad, no estudio en la escuela. Está casado su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar, también se dedica al comercio informal  venta de frutas y verduras dentro de la misma comunidad. Tienen en común 3 hijos los cuales aún viven con ellos y uno se dedica a la agricultura y los otros dos están estudiando educación básica del cliente dependen solo su familia.

Luís es agricultor se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol, ajonjolí, verduras y algunas hortalizas, se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace 28 años, esta actividad la aprendió de su padre ya que desde pequeño le enseño. 

La distancia de su lugar de trabajo está cerca de su casa, lo que más se le dificulta al cliente es hacer llegar los insumos agrícolas, ya que vive en una zona bastante aislado del municipio más cercano, en el trabajo se involucra un hijo quien ya es mayor de edad y le colabora. Su horario de trabajo es 6 horas al día aproximadamente. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar abonos, para fertilizar el maíz que ya sembró y está en la etapa  de crecimiento y fertilización del producto. El préstamo mejorara el negocio del cliente, ya que podrá mejorar la producción porque abonara a tiempo. La necesidad a satisfacer, será la de producir el maíz gracias a la fertilización a tiempo de su producto.

Los sueños de Luís, siguen siendo, expreso, los que se formó desde hace mucho tiempo los cuales son salir adelante trabajando y seguir cultivando la tierra ya que ha sido el elemento que le ha servido para sacar a adelante a su familia. Para sus hijos sueña con que ellos se superen a través del esfuerzo y la perseverancia y el colaborar con ellos.

El crédito será una herramienta para mejorar la productividad de su negocio y mejorar los ingresos y quizá con la ganancia llegue a formalizar su comercialización y volverse empresario son objetivos y sueños que quiere alcanzar.
texts.en: Luís, 45 years old, did not attend school. He is married and his wife does household chores. She also informally sells fruits and vegetables in their same community. They have 3 children who still live with them. One of them works in agriculture; the others are studying basic education. His family depends only of him. Luis is a farmer. He works growing corn, bean, sesame, green vegetables and some vegetables. He has worked doing this for 28 years. He learned this activity from his father who taught him when he was young. The distance to his place of work is close to his house. What is more difficult is how to bring the agricultural inputs, because he lives in an area which is pretty far from the closest municipality. One of his adult children helps him with this. His work schedule is of approximately 6 hours per day.  He is requesting the loan to CREDICAMPO to buy manure so he can fertilize the already sown corn, which is now growing and in need of fertilization. This loan will improve his business since his production will improve through timely fertilization. As mentioned earlier, Luis' dreams are to keep on advancing through work and to keep on cultivating the soil. This has allowed him to move his family forward. He wishes that his children will be able to move ahead through effort and perseverance and that he can help them. The loan is a tool to improve his business' productivity and improve his earnings. He would like to formalize his business and become an entrepeneur. These are goals and objectives that he would like to accomplish.

loans.use: to buy manure to fertilize the already sown corn which is in the time of growing and fertilization.

loans.name: Socrates

texts.en:
Clean drinking water is hard to get in the remote jungle covered island of Papua. Because of that, many people get sick from drinking water. Socrates sells Nazava water filters that enable everybody to filter their well, river and rain water so it becomes safe to drink. 
Mr Socrates, who sells Nazava Water filters in Papua notices the impact of water filters directly:
“The impact of the use of Nazava Water Filters has been remarkable - people who had stomach ache now experience much better health. Almost every week there is a very touching story of the people in the interior who are not sick anymore because of wear water filter. There are many stories about people walking for a whole day so that they could drink from a water filter that is in another village. Anyway, we are grateful that we can run this service in West Papua.”
Mr Socrates will use this loan to provide filters for his network of kiosks so that together they can tackle the lack of safe drinking water in Papua.

loans.use: To provide filters for his network of kiosk that provide more safe drinking water to remote villages in Papua, Indonesia

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his tuition.

loans.name: Reinaldo

texts.es:
El señor Reinaldo tiene 64 años de edad, es separado, tiene una hija ya mayor de edad e independiente a él, vive en la ciudad de Itá, donde tiene un puesto comercial hace 3 años, allí realiza la venta de diversos artículos como ser de bazar, regalos, juguetes, bijouterie y artículos de santería, solicita el préstamo en esta ocasión para surtir sus artículos de juguetería.
El señor Reinaldo es una persona muy seria, responsable y trabajadora, con ganas de trabajar desde muy joven.
texts.en:
Reinaldo is 64 years old and separated.  He has a daughter who is now grown and independent.  He lives in the city of Itá, where he has had a commercial stand for three years.  He sells diverse items like miscellany, gifts, toys, costume jewelry, and religious items.

At this time he is requesting a loan to stock up on toys.  Reinaldo is a very serious, responsible, and hard-working person.  He has had the desire to work ever since he was very young.

loans.use: to buy toys to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es: Rosa de 33 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos de 9, 5 y 2 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 9 años se dedica a la venta de artesanías en un pequeño local, su compañero de vida aporta a la economía familiar por medio de su trabajo como electricista. Rosa desea instalar agua potable en su vivienda lo más pronto posible, y para ello debe pagar derecho de instalación y los materiales necesarios para realizar la instalación. Por lo anterior Rosa solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: tubos, grifos, codos y pagar el derecho de instalación de agua potable en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa is 33 years old and lives with her partner and their three children, who are 9, 5, and 2. She is an enterprising woman who, for the past 9 years, has sold handcrafts for a living in a small community. Her partner contributes to the family income through his work as an electrician.

Rosa wants to install potable water in her house as soon as possible. She needs to pay for installation and the required materials, so she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to purchase tubes, elbows, and faucets and to pay for the installation of potable water in her home.

loans.use: to buy tubes, elbows, and faucets, and to pay for the installation of potable water in her house

loans.name: Blanca Alicia

texts.es: Blanca de 48 años de edad es madre soltera y vive con sus dos hijos de 18 y 8 años de edad, además vive con ella su hija y su yerno. Ella es una mujer visionaria que se dedica a la venta de lociones por catalogo, además vende productos para la salud logrando tener un ingreso extra. Blanca desea construir un servicio sanitario por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava y ladrillo, además deberá pagar mano de obra para la construcción de un servicio sanitario en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Blanca is 48 years old and a single mother. She lives with her two sons, who are 18 and 8, as well as her daughter and son-in-law.

She is a visionary woman who sells lotion by catalog for a living. She also sells health products to generate some extra income.

Blanca wants to build a sanitary bathroom, so she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to purchase cement, sand, gravel, and brick. She also will need to pay for the labor to build a sanitary bathroom in her home.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, and brick; also to pay for labor to build a sanitary bathroom in her house

loans.name: G.s El Barro Group

texts.es:
La señora Matilde tiene 41 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos y vive con su compañero de hogar, su actividad principal es la caficultura y cuenta con más de 4 años de dedicarse  a esta actividad.
Doña Matilde su producto lo vende a los intermediarios en la ciudad de Trojes quedándole muy buenas ganancias, lo que le permite cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos adquiridos, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de una planta solar para su vivienda. 
Doña Matilde está solicitando el préstamo de manera grupal y junto son sus compañeros esperan que esta inversión les permita mejorar su calidad de vida, atreves de la obtención de energía renovable y asu ves están contentos por estarán contribuyendo a cuidar el medio ambiente.
Doña Matilde uno de sus sueños es tener luz en su hogar y con este proyecto espera logarlo.
Doña Dionisia se dedica a la ganadería, desde hace varios años.
Doña Ana se dedica a la ganadería, desde hace varios años.
Don Oscar Manuel se dedica a la caficultura, desde hace varios años. 
Don Santos se dedica a la caficultura, desde hace varios años.


  Trojes, Honduras – Julio 2014
texts.en:
Matilde is 41 years old, the mother of three children, and lives with her partner. Her main source of income is coffee cultivation, and she has been doing this for more than four years. Matilde sells her product to intermediaries in the city of Trojes, which provides her with decent earnings that allow her to cover her household expenses and debts. 

Matilde is requesting this loan to buy a solar panel for her home. She is requesting this loan through her group. She and her fellow group members hope that this investment will allow them to improve their quality of life by obtaining renewable energy, and at the same time allow them to help look after the environment. 

One of Matilde's dreams is to have electricity in her home, and she hopes that this project will help with that. 

Dionisia and Ana have both been earning a living for several years by raising livestock. Oscar Manuel and Santos have both been earning a living through coffee cultivation for several years. 

Trojes, Honduras – July 2014

loans.use: to buy a solar panel for her home.

loans.name: Nueva Siembra-Chuisajcab Group

texts.es:
El campo fértil donde alumbra el sol cada mañana donde los trabajadores hacen presencia para otro día de labrar la tierra y provecharlas al máximo, es el trabajo de  Juan casado de 46 años motivo por el cual el a acudido a otro préstamo para seguir en el cultivo de maíz que el ha venido haciendo hace un tiempo atrás para el beneficio de su familia y su comunidad, (Juan es la que tiene puesta una chumpa color negro y se encuentra de primero de derecha a izquierda)

Cuando no tenía acceso a  préstamos  Juan no sacaba buena cosecha, pera gracias a los préstamos que él ha venido realizando en ADICLA él ha podido tener muy buena cosecha para tener una mejor producción y realizar el cultivo de maíz para el beneficio de su comunidad y la de su familia y como una fuente de ingresos económicos.

La inversión que realizara para el nuevo préstamo es para la compra de fertilizantes, ya que es muy importante para la producción de maíz, para tener  buena cosecha de su familia y comunidad.  Juan es un buen líder en su comunidad y es por ello que se han juntado con el un grupo de mujeres y hombres para emprender juntos el comienzo de sus actividades para tener cosechas par el mañana.

El cambio principal que Juan obtiene de los créditos realizados es asegurar las cosechas de maíz y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

Uno de las aspiraciones de don Juan es llegar a la compra de más terrenos y darles educación a sus hijos para que sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Don Juan works in the fertile field where the sun shines each morning, and the workers are present each day to till and make the most of the land. He is married, is 46 years old, and is asking for another loan in order to continue cultivating corn, which he has been selling for some time now. He does this for the benefit of his family, and for his community. (*Juan is the one wearing a black sweater; first from the right hand side).
	
When he did not have access to loans, don Juan was not producing a good harvest. However, thanks to the loans that he has been getting from ADICLA, he has had a great harvest and better production, and has used his corn cultivation for the benefit of his community and family as a source of income.

The investment that he will be making with the new loan is the purchase of fertilizers, which are very important for the production of corn, and to have a good harvest for his family and community. Don Juan is a great leader in his community, and he has gathered a group of women and men to work together to get started in their activities in order to harvest more crops in the future. 

Juan hopes that the loan will secure his maize harvest and improve the living conditions of his family.

One of don Juan's aspirations is to purchase more land, and provide an education for his children so they can be professionals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his corn production

loans.name: Eliseo Fermin

texts.es:
Eliseo de 33 años de edad,  no tiene grado de estudio. Esta acompañado y tiene un hijo que lo lleva a parvularia. 

Eliseo es agricultor, pero también es una persona que le gusta comprar y vender productos, motos, carros, es negociante, etc. El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar una motocicleta a precio mas bajo para luego ponerla a la venta. Él planea en un futuro tener ingresos buenos, para darle una buena vida a su familia y darle un buen estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en: Eliseo is 33 years old. He did not go to school. He has a domestic partner and a son who goes to preschool. Eliseo is a farmer, but he is also a person who likes to buy and sell products, motorcycles, cars: he is a businessman. He will use this loan to buy a motorcycle at a low price that he will later put up for sale. In the future he plans to have a good income so he can give his family a good life and give an education to his children.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle at a low price that he will later put up for sale

loans.name: Ranokhon

texts.ru: Ранохон целеустремленная и трудолюбивая женщина из района Шахритус. Она собирается начать новый бизнес по производству и продаже сахарной ваты. По словам Ранохон У Ранохон имеется торговая точка на центральном рынке своего района. Она на сумму кредита собирается приобрести аппарат для производства сахарной ваты, а также необходимые продукты. Ее начальный капитал составляет всего 200 долларов США. Как видите этой суммы недостаточно для открытия этого бизнеса, поэтому Ранохон обратилась за кредитом. В новом бизнесе ей будет помогать ее дочь. Они ожидают финансовой поддержки.
