texts.en: Ranokhon is a focused and hard-working woman from the Shahrituz region.  She plans to start a business making and selling cotton candy.  According to Ranokhon, she has a stall at the central market in her region and she plans to use her loan to buy a cotton candy machine and the necessary supplies to go with it.  Her starting capital is only 200 US dollars.  As you can see, this is not enough money with which to start a business, which is why Ranokhon has asked for a loan.  Her daughter will help her in her new business.  They are awaiting financial support.

loans.use: to buy a cotton candy machine and the necessary supplies to go with it.

loans.name: Misael

texts.es:
El joven Misael  es  una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive con su esposa y sus  hijos en la zona sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la   compra y venta  de semilla de marañón. 
Misael el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de semillas de marañón y así poder ofrecerles  una mejor  atención y cubrir todas las necesidades de sus clientes y con esto mejorar la situación  económica  de su  familia.
Misael en unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo y  consolidándose  para que se convierta en la más grande y  reconocido de la zona y  seguir  apoyando a su familia  y a  sus  hijos para que se conviertan en personas  con principios  y valores  para  la  sociedad.


Choluteca, Honduras –  Julio  2014
texts.en:
Misael  is a responsible, hardworking, and honest person. He lives with his wife and their children in the southern part of Honduras. He makes a living buying and selling cashews. Misael needs this loan in order to buy more cashews to offer to customers so that he meets their needs and improves his family's financial circumstances. 

Misael hopes that, over the next few years, his business will keep growing and strengthening until it becomes the biggest and best-known in his region. He also hopes to continue supporting his family and his children so that they become people with good principles and values in society. 

Choluteca, Honduras –  July  2014

loans.use: to buy cashews for his business.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia conformado por su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, el posee un vivero ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Julio está solicitando un crédito para la compra de plantas, bolsas, tierra y abono para continuar con su negocio y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: 48-year-old Julio lives in his own house with his family, conformed of his life companion and two children. He has a nursery located in his place of residence, he has a lot of customers, and with what he gets from his sales he resolves some of his home expenses. Julio is requesting a loan to buy plats, bags, land and fertilizer to continue his business and therefore be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy plants, bags, land and fertilizer for his nursery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, and gravel to install a cement floor in his house

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es: María de 45 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 20 y 13 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que presta sus servicios domésticos, su compañero de vida apoya a la economía familiar por medio de su trabajo. María desea instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: alambre, interruptores, tubos para realizar la instalación, además deberá pagar derecho de instalación, para instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda.
texts.en:
María is 45 years old and lives with her partner and their two children, who are 20 and 13.

She is a hard-working woman who hires out her services as domestic help. Her partner contributes to the family income through his job.

María wants to install electricity in her home, so she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to purchase wire, switches, and tubing for the installation. She will also need to pay for the installation.

loans.use: to purchase wire, switches, and tubing to install electricity, and to pay for its installation

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Малика 56 лет, замужем, мать 6 детей. Дети Малики все взрослые и живут отдельно, только младшая дочь - студентка, проживает совместно и помогает по хозяйству. Малика на протяжении многих лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Малики, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы с телятами и 0,54 ГА  земельного участка, на котором она выращивает преимущественно клевер для заготовки корма для скота. Также ежедневно продает молоко экологичное и вкусное, которое  пользуется большим спросом среди местных жителей. Ежемесячная прибыль Малики составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. На накопленные средства Малика уже начала строительство дома, но ей не хватает средств для его завершения, поэтому Малика  обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку цемента, кирпича и шифера. А прибыль от животноводства Малика планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и строительство дома для сына.
texts.en: Malika is 56 years old, married and a mother of 6 children. All of Malika's children are grown and live separately, and only her youngest daughter, who is a student, lives with her and helps with the household. Malika has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for many years. Thanks to Malika's hard work, today her business has 2 cows with calves and 0.54 hectares of land, where she primarily grows clover to prepare livestock feed. She also daily sells ecologically clean and delicious milk that is in high demand among the local residents.  Malika's monthly profit amounts to about 20,000 som (KGS). Malika has already started to use her savings to build a house, but does not have enough money to complete it, and this is why she requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy cement, bricks and slate. Malika plans to invest the profit from her animal husbandry business into a future expansion of her business and building a house for her son.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks and slate in order to complete the construction of her house

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
La tierra ha sido bendecida por manos que les gusta trabajar y cuidarla.  Es un oficio digno de admirar el que hombres se dediquen por años y para toda la vida.  La tierra sin la labor de hombres campesinos dedicados al cultivo de la misma, no daría los frutos que sostienen generalmente a toda generación. De 52 años de edad soltero con 8 hijos que sustentar y 4 de ellos ya tienen familias apartes y cuarto son estudiantes de la escuela que les queda cerca de su comunidad.

La actividad que Diego realiza es la siembra de maíz para luego venderlas por quintales en el mercado de su comunidad, para poder obtener un ingreso económico par el y su familia para mejorar las condiciones de vida.

El uso respectivo que el le dará el crédito es para  la compra de fertilizantes para mejorar las cosechas de maíz. Una de las grandes aspiraciones de don Diego es la siembra de 30 cuerdas de milpa para poder realizar ventas muchas más grandes con las que ahora realiza y tener un ingreso económico para dar estudios a sus hijos y que ellos se convierten en profesionales en un futuro.
texts.en:
The land has been blessed by the hands of those who like to work and care for it. It is a profession worthy of admiration, of which men work for years and for their entire life. The land without the work of farmers dedicated to its cultivation would not bear fruits that generally sustain all generations. 52 years of age, single, with eight children to support. Four of them already have their own families and a quarter of them are students at the school that is close to their community.

The work that don Diego carries out is the planting of corn to later sell by the quintal in the community market in order to be able to obtain income for himself and his family to improve their living conditions.

The corresponding use that he would give the loan is for the purchase of fertilizers to improve his corn harvest.One of don Diego’s great aspirations is to plant 30 cornfields to be able to carry out much bigger sales than he does currently in order to pay for his children's education so that they can be professionals in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his maize harvest

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is a 54-year-old married woman from Sagarejo district. She lives with her husband, son and daughter-in-law. Nino's husband is an electrician and generates approximately 400 GEL and her son works as a worker at a private company. Nino was unable to study a professional career and she can't find any stable job. In spite of this she is trying to start a business and generate her own income. She requested a loan and was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, the start-up program giving a chance to inexperienced people to start their own activities. So Nino plans to open a bakery with the requested loan, start baking bread and sell it locally.

With the increased income she is going to renovate her house.

The loan will be a great support for this motivated woman, as she will be able to get her own income and do her bit for the family's welfare. Nino awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a bread bakery

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter es un joven emprendedor, tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Ucayali junto a su familia. Es una persona con muchos deseos de superación. Desde hace algún tiempo trabaja como Cajero en una cadena de Supermercados y le va muy bien debido a su excelente desempeño y con ello apoya a su familia en algunos gastos del hogar.
Walter está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar un ropero para amoblar su dormitorio y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida, gracias a ello seguirá trabajando con mucho empeño y en un futuro espera poder abrir su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Water is an enterprising young adult. He is 22 years old, single and lives with his family in Ucayali. Walter is a person with a great desire to excel. For some time now he has been working as a cashier in a supermarket chain and he is doing very well due to his excellent performance. As a result, he has been able to help his family with some household expenses. 

Walter is grateful to Kiva lenders because he would be able to buy a wardrobe to furnish his bedroom with the support they have given him and thus, he can improve his qualify of life. As a result, Walter would continue to work laboriously and hopes to open his own business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a wardrobe for his bedroom

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
La tierra ha sido bendecida por manos que les gusta trabajar y cuidarla.  Es un oficio digno de admirar el que hombres se dediquen por años y para toda la vida.  La tierra sin la labor de hombres campesinos dedicados al cultivo de la misma, no daría los frutos que sostienen generalmente a toda generación. De 34 años de edad soltero con 5 hijos que sustentar, dos de ellos ya tienen familias apartes y tres  son estudiantes de la escuela que les queda cerca de su comunidad.

La actividad que Lorenzo realiza es la agricultura para luego venderlas  en el mercado de su comunidad, para poder obtener un ingreso económico par el y su familia para mejorar las condiciones de vida.

El uso respectivo que él le dará al crédito es para la inversión de insumos agrícolas para mejorar las producciones de sus cultivos y así poder tener una condición de vida adecuada para el y su familia. Una de las grandes aspiraciones de Lorenzo es la siembra de 5 cuerdas de cebolla para poder realizar ventas muchas más grandes con las que ahora realiza y tener un ingreso económico para la reparación de su casa para tener una condición de vida adecuada.
texts.en:
The land has been blessed with hands that like to work and care for it. It is dignified work and it is worthwhile to admire the men who engage in it for years and for a lifetime. The land without the farmers engaged in cultivating it would not give the crops that generally sustain an entire generation. 

Thirty-four years old, single with five children that he supports, two of them already living away with families, and three being school students that are near his community, Lorenzo has as his activity agriculture which he later sells in the community market in order to obtain an income for himself and his family to improve his living conditions.

In regards to the loan, he is going to use it to invest in agricultural supplies to improve the yield of his crops and thus be able to have adequate living conditions for himself and his family. One of Lorenzo’s greatest desires is the planting of five areas of onion in order to have much larger sales than he has now and to have financial earnings in order to repair his home to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to improve the yields of his crops

loans.name: San Juan Bautista Lovera Group

texts.es:
El comité está conformado por 17 mujeres inspiradas en una mejor y buena calidad de vida pretenden superar y mejorar sus ingresos trabajan exclusivamente en equipo organizan actividades para el buen funcionamiento del grupo y así también generan ingresos
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Celia, que se encuentra contenta por formar parte del comité que mediante eso ella está pudiendo emprender una actividad para ganar dinero, ella elabora comestibles y se dedica a la venta.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser carnes, verduras, pollo, jamón, queso y demás, y todas agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
This group is made up of seventeen women who are inspired by the thought of a better quality of life. They wish to overcome any problems and improve their income by working as a group. They organize activities that enable the group to function well and in this way generate income.

One of the members is Sra. Clara who is very happy to be part of the group as it has allowed her to learn new skills so she can earn a living. She makes and sells food. She is seeking a loan to buy various ingredients for the dishes she makes: meat, vegetables, chicken, cheese etc. 

All the women wish to say thank you for this opportunity to obtain a loan.

loans.use: Buy meat, vegetables, chicken, cheese etc.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
El éxito es simplemente la aplicación diaria de la disciplina y don Esteban está consciente de ello. Orgulloso de sus logros cuenta que hace ochos años, cuando inicio su negocio de alquiler de sillas sólo contaba con diez sillas y una camioneta pequeña  para el acarreo. Ahora, con mucho trabajo y dedicación ha logrado tener aproximadamente quinientas sillas, un pequeño camión e incluir alquiler de mesas. Tiene 54 años, está casado y tiene dos hijos, quienes le brindan apoyo incondicional para que el negocio siga progresando. 
Solicita el crédito para incrementar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar más sillas y mesas, tanto para niños como para adultos; al mismo tiempo brindarle acondicionamiento a su camión para transportarse con seguridad. El deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que anhela aumentar su clientela. Su meta es lograr comercializar más allá de su barrio, de manera que pueda mejorar sus ingresos, ya que el bienestar económico depende de este negocio. Uno de sus planes futuros es lograr adquirir un sistema de audio para ofertar un paquete completo para fiestas y eventos.
texts.en:
Success is simply the daily application of discipline and Esteban is aware of this. Proud of his accomplishments, Esteban narrates that when he started his business of renting chairs 8 years ago he only owned 10 and a small truck to transport them. Presently, with a lot of hard work and dedication he has achieved to own approximately 500 chairs and a small truck, and he is now renting tables. Esteban is 54 years old, married and has 2 children who support him unconditionally so that his business can continue to grow.

Esteban is requesting a loan to increase his profits. He needs to buy additional chairs and tables for kids and adults while at the same time he reconditions his truck so he can move around more safely. He places his trust in this loan as he wishes to increase his clientele. His goal is being able to expand his business outside of his neighborhood so that he can increase his earnings as his financial well-being depends on it.

One of his future goals if to buy an audio system to offer a complete package for parties and events.

loans.use: to buy additional chairs and tables for kids and adults.

loans.name: Maria Aracely

texts.es:
María de 63 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, esta soltera, no tiene pareja y tiene dos hijos de los cuales estan casados y tienen sus propios hogares. Con ella solamente vive un nieto, quien es el que depende de ella. 

María realiza trabajos de cosmetologia, trabaja la agricultura  y tiene como 4 años de hacerlo y lo aprendio de una nuera y decidio hacerlo para obtener un dinero extra para sus gastos y asi tambien se mantiene ocupada. 

Antes solamente se dedicaba a cuidar de sus hijos. Su area de trabajo la tiene en su casa y no viaja. Nadie se involucra en sus actividades. Su horario es de 8:00 am a 12:00 md.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar medicamento para su mamá. Le mejorara el préstamo la condicion de salud a su mamá y por lo tanto tambien la tranquilidad de ella y es como tendra una calidad de vida sana. 

 Sus sueños son instalar una sala de belleza en una zona buena.
texts.en:
María is 63 years of age. She completed high school, is unmarried, has no partner and has two sons who are married and have their own homes. Only a grandson lives with her and is dependent on her.

María works as a beautician and has done for 4 years. She learned from a daughter-in-law and decided to do it for extra money to cover her expenses; it also keeps her busy. Before this, all her time was dedicated to bringing up her children. The she works in her house and she doesn't travel. No one else is involved in her activities. Her hours are from 8:00am to 12:00 midday

The loan she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy medicine for her mother. The loan will improve her mother's state of health and therefore also her own peace of mind. This is how she will have a healthy quality of life.

Her dream is to have a beauty salon in a good area.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her mother.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with six children, all of whom go to school. She sells used clothes at the market .She operates her business on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last four years. She has no additional family members. She works six days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. Her major challenges include defaulters and seasonality. She is aspiring to build a residential house. She lives in rented house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include food and medication.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothing

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is 32 years old and married with one child, who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Ivy has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ivy requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Ivy has been in this business for two years. In the future, Ivy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy meat products such as pork, beef, and processed meat needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to purchase more meat products that are necessary to expand her product inventory. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Francisca hopes to increase her profit from her business and she dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies of pork and chicken needed in her business

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El comité está conformado por 17 mujeres entusiasmadas que quieren mejorar su calidad de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la señorita Luz quien se encuentra muy complacida por formar parte del comité ya que de esa forma pudo realizar su actividad de Venta de Comestibles y Cría de Animales para la venta, cuyas actividades le ayuda a generar ingresos para ayudar a su familia y sustentar sus estudios.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, pollo, condimentos y demás, agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
This group is made up of seventeen enthusiastic women who wish to improve their standard of living.

One of the members is Señorita Luz who is very happy to be part of the group as it enables her to earn a living selling food and raising animals to sell. Through these jobs she earns money to help her family and cover educational expenses.

She is seeking a loan to buy ingredients for the meals she makes such as vegetables, meat, chicken, condiments etc. She is grateful for this opportunity to obtain a loan which provide her with much help.

loans.use: Buy ingredients such as vegetables, meat, chicken, condiments etc.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El Sr. Mario tiene 34 años, casado con la Sra. Francisca de 35 años, tienen casa propia y ambos trabajan arduamente para poder cubrir los gastos de la casa.  
El Sr Mario se dedica a la compra y venta de ropas en general y Electrodomésticos, financiando a sus clientes en pequeñas cuotas. Desde joven empezó en este rubro de negocio pero como empleado, hace más de 10 años que se independizo y actualmente cuenta con  excelente clientela formada      
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de ropas de temporada para satisfacer la demanda de su clientela.
texts.en:
Mario is 34 years old and married to Francisca, 35.  They  have their own home, and both work hard to to be able to cover the household expenses. 

Mario buys and sells general clothing on credit, paid for by his customers in small installments. He began in this line of business from a young age, but as an employee.  He went out on his own 10 years ago, and now has an excellent established clientele. 

He is requesting the loan in order to buy seasonal clothing to satisfy customer demand.

loans.use: To buy seasonal clothing to sell.

loans.name: Nayel

texts.en: Nayel was born in 1960. He is married and lives in Rsaifeh, Jordan with his wife as well as four sons and daughters. Nayel launched his mini-market two years ago to be a good provider for his family. His business was profitable to him and he is seeking to expand it more in the future. Now he is seeking a loan to supply his mini-market with new products. But he doesn't have enough money to do so. For that, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to supply his mini-market with new products

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila is a 40-year-old, married woman and a mother of four sons and daughters. Her husband is a retired man, and his pension isn't enough to cover his children's needs. For that, she started her own business running a mini-market one year ago, and she built a good customer base and started receiving good income. Now she is seeking a loan to bring in new products that her customers requested. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to bring in new products for her mini-market

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children and both go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She operates a kiosk at the market. She sells to all kinds of people on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last two years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX to buy trays of eggs, crates of soda, sweets, biscuits, cooking oil, and other kinds of juice. Her major challenges include high transportation costs and electricity, which increase her operational costs. Her goal and inspiration is to own a fully-stocked kiosk .She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy trays of eggs, crates of soda, sweets, and biscuts

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a married woman and a mother of three children from Leyte, Philippines. Dina earns a living through her sari-sari, or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. This is the source of her income. Several months ago, Dina's business was damaged when typhoon Haiyan hit the country.

As of now, Dina has rebuild her business again and is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell such as canned goods, candies, biscuits and snack foods, soda and beverages, soap, and toiletries. With this, she will be able to increase her stocks which will attract more buyers in her store. In the future, Dina hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell such as canned goods, candies, biscuits and snack foods, soda and beverages, soap, and toiletries

loans.name: Ldyia

texts.en: Ldyia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with one child. She takes care of additional family members (her mother). She operates a kiosk at the market selling soft drinks. She sells to all kinds of people on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last three years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX to buy crates of soda, passion fruits, oranges, watermelons and pineapples for making juice. Her major challenges include high transportation costs and electricity, which increase her operational costs. Her goal is to own a fully stocked kiosk with other merchandise. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy crates of soda, passion fruits, oranges, watermelons and pineapples

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Саодат 51 лет. Она с мужем и одним ребенком живет в маленьком городке Турсунзаде. Городок был назван в честь великого таджикского писателя-героя Республики Таджикистан. Саодат с семьей в этом городе живут долго, и для них город значит многое. Саодат дома предоставляет услугу портнихи. Она шьет таджикские национальные платья. Кроме своих услуг у них имеется семейный бизнес. Они занимаются земледелием. Сейчас пора для посева нового урожая. Саодат намерена посадить лук, но нет достаточной суммы денег, чтобы купить средства. Саодат хочет на заемные деньги купить семена лука и минеральные удобрения
texts.en: Saodat is 51 years old and she lives with her husband in the small city of Tursun-zoda.  The city was named in honor of the great Tajik writer and hero of the Republic of Tajikistan.  Saodat and her family have lived in this city for a long time and it means a lot to them.  She works out of her home as a seamstress sewing Tajik national dresses.  Aside from her own work, there is another family business; they work in agriculture and it is now time to sow the new crops.  Saodat intends to plant onions, but she doesn't have enough money to buy the materials for this.  She wants to use the funds from her loan to buy onion seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer and onion seeds.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina tiene 51 años de edad, es casada, vive con su conyuge e hijos, en casa propia, en una comunidad pequeña en la zona rural del distrito de Cayalti, provincia de chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú, ella goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos.

Martina se dedica a la actividad de servicio de transporte en mototaxi, cuenta con una mototaxi, desde hace más de 10 años de antiguedad en el negocio, brinda servicio de transporte en Cayalti y anexos. Solicita prestamo para el mantenimiento de su mototaxi. De esta manera mantener estable su herramienta de trabajo, hacer crecer sus ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Martina is 51 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children in their own house in a small community in the rural area of the Cayalti district, which is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque department, on the northern coast of Peru. Her neighbors have nothing but good things to say about her character and work.

Martina owns a motorcycle taxi. She has been making a living providing transportation services in Cayalti and surrounding areas for over 10 years. 

She is requesting a loan to perform routine maintenance on her motorcycle taxi. In this way, she will be able to keep the tool of her trade in good condition, increase her income, and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to perform routine maintenance on her motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 27-year-old, hardworking woman, married to Raphael, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with two children.  Jane has been operating a cloth and dressmaking shop for four years, earning an income of 8,000 KES at the end of every month.

Jane is now requesting her second loan of 15,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy new, fashionable clothing materials.

Jane plans to use the anticipated income to buy an additional sewing machine and hopes to begin a fashion and a design school, where the youth will enroll to get quality skills.

loans.use: to buy new clothing materials to add to her stock, which is running out

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 19-year-old, single man living in Jabal Alhussein, Jordan with his parents and three siblings. He has been helping his family financially by selling accessories for three years. He is planning to open his own accessories store in the future to raise his profits. Now he needs to build a stronger customer base so that he can open his store. To do so, he is seeking a youth loan to bring in more accessories to sell, in order to raise his profits.

loans.use: to bring in more accessories to sell

loans.name: Enas

texts.en: Enas is a 26-year-old married woman living with her husband who serves in the military. She has been helping her husband to improve their living conditions by running her own studio for three years where she coordinates ceremonies and works in photography. She is now seeking to buy a new camera in addition to a film developing tool that will help her do her work professionally. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For that, she is asking for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy a new camera and a film developing tool

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud was born in 1965. He is a married man and a father of three sons. He is the only provider for the family. He has been running a restaurant for nine years where he serves several snacks. Because his tools are old, he needs to buy new machines, do some repairs, and buy decorations for his restaurant in order to attract more customers. But he doesn't have enough money to do so. For that, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy new machines, do some repairs, and buy decorations for his restaurant

loans.name: 24 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama 24 DE MAYO están en el 3er ciclo, está conformada por 19 mujeres, es un grupo muy unido y emprendedor, están agradecidas por la ayuda que les brinda la fundación paraguaya ya que es de suma utilidad para que puedan salir adelante en las actividades que llevan a cabo.
La Sra. Erma se distingue por su humildad y ganas de sobresalir, se desempeña como empleada doméstica y con este préstamo está pensando montar un negocio de venta de comidas y bebidas, y de esa forma poder empezar un nuevo trabajo que le permita mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This committee is called "24th of May." They are in their third loan cycle. It consists of 19 women. It is a very united and entrepreneurial group. They are grateful for the help that Fundación Paraguay offers them, since it is a great help so that they can advance in the businesses that they run.

Señora Erma is distinguished by her humility and will to achieve. She works as a domestic employee, and with this loan she is thinking of setting up a business of selling food and beverages and in this way being able to begin a new job that allows her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies to sell food and beverages

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es: Natividad es soltera pero tiene un hijo Ella vive en El Alto en una casa de adobe Natividad se dedica a la venta de frutas y quiere un prestamo para comprar naranjas, mandarinas y otras frutas para su negocio Natividad esta convencida de mejorar sus ingresos, ella es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar y por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Natividad is single, but she has one child. She lives in El Alto in an adobe house. Natividad makes a living selling fruits, and she wants a loan to buy oranges, tangerines, and other fruits for her business.

Natividad is determined to increase her earnings. She is the only source of income of her household. It is for this reason that she needs help.

loans.use: to buy oranges, tangerines, and other fruits.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La Sra. Lida hoy tiene 65 años, es una persona ya mayor, pero que sigue trabajando para poder tener un mejor ingreso que le permita tener una buena calidad de vida, ella es costurera,y comenta que por medio de su préstamo anterior que le brindó Kiva ha podido comprar telas para poder seguir con su trabajo, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide de nuevo este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, botones y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus trabajos como lo viene haciendo. agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
Señora Lida is now 65 years old. She is an older person, but she continues working in order to be able to have a better income that allows her to have a good quality of life. She is a seamstress, and she comments that through the previous loan that Kiva offered her, she was able to buy fabrics in order to be able to continue with her work, which has been a great help to her.

Now she is again asking for this loan in order to be able to invest it in the purchase of fabrics, threads, elastic, buttons, and other items, so that she can continue with her work as she has been doing. She is grateful for this new opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, and other items.

loans.name: Mujeres Humildes Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Mujeres Humildes está en su ciclo número 19° Del programa de comité de mujeres, donde también están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, es un grupo que viene trabajando con unión y ayuda mutua.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Noelia, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir en un nivel medio. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que hace venta de bijouteries y, también se debe destacar el entusiasmo que pone por poder mejorar su estilo de vida y el de su familia.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de bijouteries varios para vender, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group, called Mujeres Humildes (Humble Women), is in its 19th cycle of the women committee program, where they are also taking surveys to eliminate poverty. This is a group that has been working with unity and mutual aid.

One of the members is Noelia, who in her last survey showed a level of poverty within level two, which is an intermediate level. Among the work that she does, she says that she sells jewelry. The enthusiasm that she puts forth to improve her quality of life and that of her family stands out.

She is requesting this loan to buy various jewelry pieces to sell, which will help her solidify her business plan. This will help her increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy jewelry pieces to sell.

loans.name: Adolfo Damián

texts.es:
Adolfo Damian habita en el municipio de Achuapa departamento de león, una ciudad donde existen diversas actividades comerciales e industriales.

Adolfo Damian Es un joven de 47 años de edad casado con tres hijos bajo su cargo, con lo poco que el gana a duras penas ayuda a mantener el sustento diario de sus hijos que tanto ama y estima. 

Viendo la necesidad que día a día va creciendo su familia y su vivienda solo cuenta con un dormitorio, se presento a ceprodel a solicitar un préstamo para la compra de: Zinc, Arena, Cemento y Ladrillo esto le ayudaría a construir un dormitorio para sus tres hijos y así vivir en mejores condiciones con su familia. 

Desde hace dos años ejerce el trabajo como bodeguero en una de las instituciones del estado, pero son de sus sueños tener una vida mejor con sus hijitos. 

Es de su gran necesidad que Ceprodel y Kiva le financie este pequeño préstamo, esto le llegaría a cumplir parte de sus sueños de vivir más comodo con su familia. 

Agrádese mucho a Kiva por haber llegado a su vida y por hacerle cumplir parte de sus sueños, de poder optar a estos pequeños prestamos con mucha facilidad de pago.
texts.en:
Adolfo Damián lives in the Achuapa municipality, in the León department. It is a city where there are several industrial and commercial businesses.

Adolfo Damián is a 47-year-old man. He is married and has three dependent children. The little money that he makes barely helps him provide for the daily needs of his children, whom he loves and cherishes dearly.

Watching every day how his children grow up in a house with only one bedroom, he found it necessary to request a loan from CEPRODEL to purchase metal roofing, sand, cement, and brick. With these materials he could build a bedroom for his three children and thus improve his family’s living conditions.

He has been working as a warehouseman at one of the state’s institutions for two years; however, he dreams of having a better life with his children. 

He badly needs that CEPRODEL and Kiva grant him this small loan. This would help him fulfill part of his dreams of living more comfortably with his family. 

He is very grateful to Kiva for having come into his life and enabling him to fulfill part of his dreams: to be able to opt for these small loans with easy payment terms.

loans.use: to buy metal roofing, sand, cement, and brick.

loans.name: Yunuke

texts.en:
Yunuke is 59 years old and is a very passionate dairy farmer who hails from Keumbu village in the rich Kisii highlands. This area is known to be a banana-growing region and experiences one of the best weather patterns. Their staple food is “matoke,” a mouthwatering delicacy prepared from bananas. She has been happily married and has been blessed with 7 lovely children. She passionately loves farming and has been actively involved in farming for the past 20 years. Through those years, she gained so much experience and is touted as the best farmer in her village, so she offers free advice to young upcoming farmers. Her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, tea and a variety of crops.
Yunuke enjoys dairy farming, milking, and feeding her cows.  The biggest challenge she faces is the lack of a quality exotic breed that can produce more milk and satisfy the milk demand that is in her area. To solve this problem, Yunuke is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo so that she can buy a good quality breed of dairy cow that can produce between 10-20 liters of milk in a day. She does not have to worry about the market because the demand is so high for that type of milk and she could also sell the milk to a large dairy processing company. Through this, she will get an immediate increase in profit margins and she will improve her living conditions.
In addition to profits in milk, she will also benefit from manure (cow dung) from the cow which will boost her farm fertility and production levels. Yunuke is very visionary and in the long run, she plans that through accumulated profits, she will be able to buy more exotic dairy cows and will be able to open a large dairy shop where she will package milk and sell milk products such as cream and yogurt.  Through increased profits, she will fully repay the loan and live a financially secure life.

loans.use: to purchase a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Mujeres Guapas Group

texts.es:
19 mujeres integran el grupo Kuña Guapa, donde todas y cada una de ellas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo unido.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rafaela quien se dedica a la elaboración de comidas, está muy contenta por formar parte del programa de comités, ya que con el préstamo que pide podrá aumentar sus ganancias ya que podrá comprar los insumos para sus comidas al por mayor, lo que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Nineteen members form the group Kuña Guapa, where each and every one of them is putting in her best effort in order to be able to help their families by means of united work.

One of the members is Señora Rafaela, who prepares food. She is very happy to be part of the committee program, since with the loan that she is requesting she will be able to increase her earnings, since she will be able to buy the ingredients for her foods wholesale, which will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy various supplies to prepare food.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan es de la ciudad de Ybycui, el mismo vive con su señora, con su hija y su nieto. El señor Juan posee su despensa desde hace más de 25 años, el cual es el sostén de la familia.
Comenta que empezó este negocio después de casarse, el capital inicial provino de la venta de ganado y una parte de su propiedad que había heredado por parte de sus padres y que luego con su trabajo fue agradando.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de productos varios para su negocio, como ser bebidas, verduras, condimentos, lácteos, etc. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Señor Juan is from the city of Ybycui. He lives with his wife, his daughter, and his grandson. He has had a store for more than 25 years, and it is the sustenance of the family.

He comments that he began this business after marrying. The initial capital came from the sale of cattle and a part of the property that he had inherited from his parents, and then with his work it [the business] has been growing.

He is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of various products for his business, such as beverages, vegetables, condiments, dairy products, etc. He is grateful for this opportunity that he is receiving, which will be of great help to him.

loans.use: to buy beverages, vegetables, condiments, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Qamar

texts.en: Qamar is 18 years old and lives in Hashmiya, Jordan.  He lives with his eight siblings and his parents. After Qamar decided to be a second provider for the family to help his family improve their living conditions and to be self-reliant, he started running his own mini market two years ago.  There, he sells food products and general items.  In order to expand his business, he is requesting a youth loan to buy new merchandise and to add gifts and games to his store merchandise so that he will raise his income successfully.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise for his mini market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a horse.

loans.name: Jepopyhy Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Jepopyhy está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, la cual es una zona que aún se encuentra en crecimiento, y donde las integrantes se dedican a actividades eminentemente rurales.
La Sra. Cecilia es una de las integrantes, ella es de   la misma Zona donde tiene su pequeño negocio de ventas de Golosinas.  Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de la fundación y de Kiva vaya mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Solicito este préstamo para la compra de golosinas variadas que le faltan para ampliar su ventas, y  de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
The group named Jepopyhy is in its first loan cycle of the women's committee program.  The group is from the city of Curuguaty,  an area which is still under development.  The members living here earn a living working at eminently rural occupations.  

Cecilia is one of the members.  She is from the same area where she has her small business selling sweets.  As time goes by, with the help of the foundation and Kiva, Cecilia hopes to better her quality of life.     Cecilia  is asking for this loan to buy different candies to broaden her sales and thus keep her business growing and give her family what's needed to have a life without privation.

loans.use: to buy various candies to sell

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto esta casado y tiene 4 hijos Roberto vive en La PAZ  en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad Roberto es jubilado y percibe una renta Roberto necesita un credito para concluir la obra fina de su casa Roberto es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar pero es un hombre sano que puede ser bastante confiable
texts.en: Roberto is married and has 4 children.  He lives in La Paz in his own home, made of brick and cement.  Roberto is retired and receives a pension.  He needs a loan to finish up some work on his house.  Roberto is the only source of income for his household, but he is a healthy man who is quite reliable.

loans.use: to finish up some work on his house

loans.name: Apolonia Del Socorro

texts.es: Apolonia del Socorro, mayor de edad madre soltera de una hija ya independiente, de origen Chinandegana zona donde predomina el comercio, turismo, y sus hermosas playas,se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y con muchos deseos de superación personal, tambien es una microempresaria propietaria y administradora de sus propio negocio el cual consiste en la venta de mercadería en general como: bolsos, trajes, zapatos,  variedades estilos de ropa para niños, adultos, cosméticos, perfumes, artículos escolares, recordatorios de 15 años, bodas y otros accesorios los cuales coloca en floristería y librería de este departamento y otros municipios negocio el cual la realiza de forma ambulante ,en ocasiones domiciliar y por encargo , inicia su negocio hace mas de 25 años con fondos propios e iniciativa propia,  uno de sus sueños es poder crecer mas en su negocio y realizar ciertas mejoras a la vivienda como la ampliación de la casa y otros proyectos que tiene en mente, El objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería como: ropa nueva en general, zapatos, cosméticos, bolsos y recordatorios varios de los que coloco a mis clientes según demanda, al crecer la magnitud de mi Negocio puedo comprar a mejores precios, surtir de todo lo que no pueda tener, los productos más demandantes y así obtener mayor volumen de ingresos y ofertarle mejores precios a sus clientes, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Apolonia del Socorro, an older single mother with a daughter who is already independent, is originally from the Chinandega area, where commerce and tourism predominate and there are beautiful beaches.  She is known for being a hardworking and responsible woman who has a strong desire for personal advancement.  In addition, she is a small businesswoman who owns and manages her own business, consisting of the sale of general merchandise such as: purses, suits, shoes, a variety of styles of clothing for children and adults, cosmetics, perfumes, school supplies, keepsakes for 15th birthday celebrations and weddings, and other accessories that she places in florist shops and stationery stores in this department (region) and in other municipalities.  She sells from place to place, and at times she sells from her house and through advance orders.  She started her business more than 25 years ago on her own initiative and with her own funds.  One of her dreams is to grow her business and make certain improvements to her home, such as adding onto the house and some other projects that she has in mind.  

Apolonia's goal for this loan is to invest in working capital to stock her business with new merchandise to sell, such as: new clothing in general, shoes, cosmetics, purses, and a variety of the kind of keepsakes that she has sold to her customers according to the demand.  This way she can grow her business, buy at better prices, and stock up with all of the items that she lacks, including those products that are most in demand.  This will enable her to  increase her sales revenue and offer better prices to her customers, so that in the near future she can have a higher income.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise including clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and other items

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 35-year-old woman. She is married to Samuel who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with three children.  Josephine has been a farmer for a period of three years, earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Josephine is now servicing her fourth loan of KES 35,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the entire amount to buy farm fertilizers and seedlings for her farm plantation.

Josephine plans to use the anticipated income to buy some cattle and practice her livestock business and hopes to become a successful business woman with a bright future.

loans.use: to buy farm fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Sidy

texts.fr:
Monsieur  SIDY  est âgé de 32 ans et vit avec son enfant et son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à N’TENTOU, dans la sous-préfecture OUELESSEBOUGOUE  (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali).
SIDY n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt,  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente des marchandises de boutique : savon, lait, huile, riz, farine, sucre et boisson. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son grand frère, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant de marchandises de boutique. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement remboursé le prêt individuel précédent, il est à son deuxième  prêt qui servira à acheter, 2 tonnes de riz, 5 sacs de sucre, des cartons de thé et des sacs de farine de blé auprès des grossistes de BAMAKO qu’il revend en détail a N’TENTOU a crédit et au comptant a une clientèle mixte.
SIDY espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 100.000. FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et réinvestir le reste dans les activités d’achat vente des marchandises de boutique. 

. .
texts.en:
Mr. Sidy is 32 years old and lives with his wife and child in a traditional family in N'tenout in the subprefecture of Ouelessebougoue (Koulikoro Region, the Republic of Mali).

Sidy did not have an opportunity to attend school. Early on he got involved in earning an income, in particular buying and reselling basic necessity goods such as soap, milk, oil, rice, flour, sugar and beverages. He has learned this trade from his older brothers, who used to be a well-known vendor of such goods. With the goal of meeting growing customer demand, he decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. After having duly repaid his first individual loan, he is now on his second loan, which will be used to buy two tons [4400 lbs] of rice, five bags of sugar, a number of boxes of tea and bags of wheat flour from wholesalers in Bamako. He retails his merchandise in N'tentou, on credit and for cash, to a mixed clientele.Sidy hopes to earn an average monthly revenue of 100,000 West African francs, which will  allow him to repay his loan and reinvest the rest in his business.

. .

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous goods [for resale].

loans.name: Lilinus

texts.en:
Lilinus is a 30-year-old woman married to Simon and they are blessed with one child.  Lilinus adds additional income to support their family's welfare.  She has been rearing cattle for four years and she earns an income of 8,000 KES at the end of every month.

Lilinus is now servicing her second loan of 7,500 KES with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy additional cattle.  She plans to use the additional income generated by that cattle to pay school fees to her children.  She hopes to become a successful business woman in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional cattle.

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.en:
Cipriana is a 62-year-old married woman from Leyte, Philippines. She has been involved in the fishing business with her husband for more than 30 years now. This is the primary source of her income.
 
Several months ago, their fishing boat was ruined when a typhoon hit the country.  Cipriana is now asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, plywood and nails so they can repair the fishing boat. With this loan, her husband will be able to go back to fishing, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.  In the future, Cipriana hopes to make their business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, plywood and nails so she and her husband can repair their fishing boat.

loans.name: Fany Margarita

texts.es:
Fany, mantiene su empleo y su negocioso activo, lo ha logrado gracias a la buena administración de los créditos que anteriormente se le han otorgado, las ventas y las ganancias son mayores, ha logrado incluir la venta de artículos plásticos para el hogar en su negocio, su familia mantiene el mismo núcleo familiar con la diferencia que hoy tienen un mejor estilo de vida.
En esta oportunidad solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar insumos para elaborar los licuados (frutas, azúcar y leche) y productos plásticos (cantaros, platos, vasos, tasas, etc.), para mantener su negocio en el mercado y satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fany has maintained her job and kept her business very active. She has succeeded thanks to the previous loans that she was granted, which improved her sales and profits and allowed her to sell plastic housewares at her business.

Her family has maintained the same household, however today they have a better standard of living. She is taking this opportunity to ask for a new loan in order to buy supplies to make smoothies (fruit, sugar, and milk) and plastic products (pitchers, plates, glasses, cups, etc.) in order to maintain her business' place in the market, and satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies to purchase smoothie ingredients and plastic products for her business in order to maintain her place in the market and satisfy her customers

loans.name: Jose Del Transito

texts.es:
José, vive solo, sus hijos ya tienen su propio hogar, 2 de ellos trabajan como motoristas y su hija se dedica a realizar actividades domésticas; José se dedica a prestar su  servicios como sastre, es un oficio que aprendió hace 40 años, esta actividad la desempeño durante 20 años como empleado, posteriormente tomo la decisión de emprender su negocio propio, elabora de 1 a 2 pantalones diarios. Es un hombre muy luchador que a pesar de haber sufrido la amputación de la pierna derecha no ha sido impedimento para salir adelante.
Necesita capital para comprar una máquina de coser nueva, le será de ayuda para agilizar la entrega y mejorar la calidad de sus prendas, espera seguir trabajando para contar con los recursos que necesita para subsistir y cancelar la deuda adquirida.
Sus aspiraciones son mantenerse trabajando mientras pueda hacerlo y para que su familia no tenga más gastos por brindarle cuidados.
texts.en:
José lives alone. His children already have their own households. Two of them work as drivers, and his daughter does domestic work. José offers tailoring services. It is a trade that he learned 40 years ago. He did this work for 20 years as an employee, later he decided to set up his own business. He makes from 1 to 2 pairs of pants daily. He is a very hard-working man who in spite of having suffered the amputation of his right leg has not found it to be an impediment to getting ahead.

He needs capital to buy a new sewing machine. It will be a help to speed up his deliveries and improve the quality of his garments. He hopes to continue working to have the resources that he needs to subsist and to pay the debt he has acquired.

His goals are to continue working while he is able to do so and so that his family doesn't have more expenses to care for him.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, which will be a help in speeding up his deliveries and improving the quality of his garments

loans.name: Budharaja Shg Group

texts.en:
Budharaja Shg consists of 10 women from a small village in Odisha. They formed a group to help themselves share and solve their problems themselves. One of them is Padmini, who was selected as the President of Budharaja Shg. The lady standing fourth from the right in an orange sari in the photo is Padmini. Padmini is 20 years old and is staying with her husband and her two children. She is involved in growing and selling vegetables in her village. Her husband is supporting her in this activity. She has requested a loan of 150,000 INR, which will help her to purchase the required resources for vegetable cultivation. She says her portion of the loan will help her to purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labor charges.

All the members of this group are involved in different activities and all are very happy with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: Rene es soltero pero tiene dos hijos Rene vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento donde paga un alquiler Rene trabaja como chofer asalariado pero desea incursionar el negocio de venta de ropa argentina y requiere un prestamo para comprar prendas para varon y para mujer Rene es el unico sustento del hogar y necesita ayuda
texts.en: Rene is single but he has two children. He lives in La Paz in a house of brick and cement where he pays a rent. Rene works as a salaried driver, but he wants to venture into a business of selling Argentine clothing, and he needs a loan to buy clothing for men and women. Rene is the only breadwinner of the household, and he needs assistance.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothing.

loans.name: Virgen De Caacupe Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Virgen de Caacupe está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan para salir adelante, son mujeres muy trabajadoras y tiene muchas ganas de crecer.
La Sra. Elodia es una de las integrantes, quien tiene un negocio de despensa, es una mujer muy trabajadora que con esfuerzo y lucha está saliendo adelante, comenta que ha crecido poco a poco y hoy día ya tiene una clientela bien formada. Pide este préstamo para la compra de  más productos varios para su venta en la despensa, como ser fideo, carne, productos lácteos ,etc., para que de esa manera pueda aumentar más su clientela y también pueda generar más ingresos en la familia.
texts.en:
This group, called "Virgen de Caacupe," is in its first loan cycle in the women's committee program, where everyone works and helps each other to advance. They are very hard-working women and have a great will to grow.

Señora Elodia is one of the members. She has a grocery store business. She is a very hard-working woman who with her effort and work is getting ahead. She comments that she has grown little by little and now has a well-established clientele. She is requesting this loan to purchase more of a variety of products to sell in the store, such as pasta, meat, dairy products, etc., so that in this way she can increase her clientele and also generate more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy pasta, meat, dairy products, etc. for her store.

loans.name: Amina

texts.fr:
Née en 1968 à FARABOUGOU, AMINA vit avec ses 7 enfants et son époux dans une  famille nucléaire à FILABOUGOU, dans la commune de OUELESSEBOUGOU, (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
AMINA n’a pas eut la chance d’aller à l’école,  très vite s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente de friperie et du pagne basin. Après avoir correctement remboursé le prêt individuel précédent, AMINA est à son quatrième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 2 balles de friperie   et  10 pièces de bazin auprès des  grossistes de BAMAKO. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile et à  OUELESSEBOUGOU à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
AMINA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir le reste dans les activités d’achat vente d’habillements .
texts.en:
Born in 1968 in Farabbougu, Amina lives with her husband and seven children in a nuclear family in Filabougou in the subprefecture of Ouelessebougou (Koulikoro Region, the Republic of Mali).

Amina did not have an opportunity to go to school. Early on she got involved in earning an income, such as buying and selling used clothing and traditional "pagne" damask-type fabric. After having duly repaid her prior loans, Amina is now on her fourth loan with Soro Yiriwaso. She plans to use this loan to buy two bales of used clothing and 10 sets of damask fabric from wholesalers in Bamako. She sells retail for cash and on credit,  out of her home and in Ouelessebougou, to a mixed clientele. Amina hopes to earn an average monthly revenue of 50,000 West African francs, which will be used to help her husband provide for family needs, repay the loan and reinvest the rest in her clothing business.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Reyna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Reyna, se está preparando para la temporada de ferias en la zona y opta por un nuevo préstamo con el que pueda comprar la materia prima para elaborar su venta de antojitos, adquirirá elotes, papas, aceite, aderezos, queso, gas propano, productos desechables y otros materiales.
Con la inversión del financiamiento anterior su negocio ha mejorado, tiene mejores ingresos, ofrece mejor variedad de productos, mantiene a sus clientes satisfechos y las condiciones familiares han tenido un cambio positivo.
texts.en:
Reyna is getting ready for the festival season of the area, and she has decided to get a new loan in order to buy the necessary supplies for her sale of snacks. She will buy corn, potatoes, oil, dressings, cheese, propane gas, disposable products and other materials.

With the investment of her previous loan her business has being improving, as well as her incomes. She now offers a wider variety of products, keeps her customers satisfied, and her family situation has had a positive change.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her sale of snacks, like corn, potatoes, oil, dressings, cheese, propane gas, disposable products and other materials.

loans.name: Lucrisia

texts.en:
Lucrisia is a married woman and a nipa weaver from Leyte, Philippines. She has been in the nipa weaving business for more than five years now. This is the source of her income.

Lucrisia is asking for a loan to buy more nipa palm, which she uses to make mats.  With this loan, she will be able to produce more mats which she can sell in the market for profit. In the future, Lucrisia hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more nipa palm to make mats.

loans.name: Teodola

texts.en:
Teodola is a food vendor from Leyte, Philippines. For more than a year now she has made her living selling food.

Teodola is applying for a 20,000 PHP loan through CEVI to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, cooking oil and seasonings. She then will be able to cook greater amounts of food and so sell more to her customers. She is working to make her business ever more successful.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the food she sells

loans.name: Edeltrudes

texts.en: Edeltrudes is a married woman, the mother of five children, and she lives in Leyte, Philippines.  She earns an income through her sari-sari and retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her community.  Edeltrudes is asking for a loan to buy more items to sell including canned goods, noodles, soda, soap and toiletries, biscuits and bread, and cooking seasonings.  With this loan, she will be able to improve the stocked goods and attract more buyers in her store. In the future, Edeltrudes dreams of making her business a success so that it will generate the income needed for the family, especially for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, soda, soap and toiletries, biscuits and bread, and cooking seasonings to sell in her store.

loans.name: Winnies

texts.en:
Winnies lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is single with one child, and she takes care of one additional family member - her mother.  She operates a kiosk at the market selling soft drinks, and she sells to all kinds of people through her retail basis.  She has been in this business for the last 2 years, and she works for seven days a week. 
She has requested a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings to buy crates of soda, passion fruits, oranges, snacks and pineapples for making juice.  Her major challenge includes the high price of electricity which increases her operational costs. Her goal and inspiration is to expand her kiosk into a retail shop selling different items.  She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expense is food.

loans.use: to buy crates of oranges, passion fruits, snacks, and pineapples for making juice.

loans.name: Hoson

texts.en:
Hoson is a single lady, born in 1990, and has an elementary level of education. She was forced to quit school to cover the expenses and living needs of her four family members, because of their low acquired income.

Years ago, Hoson succeeded, with her effort and ambition, to open her own perfumes, accessories, spices and Asian products shop. She is a hard worker who is developing her business upon her customers’ needs.
 
Today, Hoson is acquiring a Youth Loan from Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special offer products that will respond to her increasing customers’ needs.
 
This loan will help Hoson to expand her work, increase her income, and save profit for her future.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special offer products.

loans.name: Shree Ganapati Shg Group

texts.en:
Jubati is 20 years old and living with her husband and two children. The lady standing fifth from left in the photo is Jubati. She is engaged in selling dried and fresh fish in the market, which is six kilometers away from her village. Her husband catches fish from the lake that is near their village. The demand for fish in the region is very high, as it is consumed by most of the people. Jubati makes dried fish by keeping the fish in sunlight until all the water evaporates, which preserves them for future use (like when fish are not available in the market, in the rainy season). Dried fish is also used as a supplement to fresh fish. 

Jubati is requesting a loan to buy a cool storage box for keeping fish, a fishing net and insecticides to prevent fish from decaying for her fishery business. She says that this will help her to strengthen the business and respond to client demand. This group is made up of neighbors and friends who formed the group Shree Ganapati Self Help Group. The members of the group have selected Jubati as their president. The common goal of the group is to expand their business activity.

loans.use: To pay for a storage box to keep fish and a fishing net.

loans.name: Almuntaser

texts.en:
Almuntaser is a 21-year-old unmarried young man who lives with his parents and two siblings in Jabal Alhussein, Jordan. His mother is a hairdresser.

Almuntaser is a second-year university student majoring in Air Services Management and travelers services. He also works evenings at a cafe.

Almuntaser is planning to find a good job in his field after he gets his diploma. But he doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester's fees. For that reason he has applied for this 518 JOD loan through National Microfinance Bank to cover them.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester's fees

loans.name: Maa Duarasuni Shg Group

texts.en:
Premanjali is 30 years old, married and has two children who are studying in school. She lives in a village in the Kalahandi district of Odisha, India. Premanjali is a housewife who is very happy and responsible. She alternates her household activities with her work in her business. She has a business farming her paddy and selling her crops in the market in the Kalahandi district in Odisha, India. She already has had this business for four years and it is going very well. At this time, Premanjali is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and new and advanced tools for farming. She says that this will help her in strengthening the business and responding to client demands. 

This group is composed of neighbors and friends who formed the Maa Duarasuni Self Help Group. The members of the group have selected Premanjali as their president. The common goal of the group is to increase their business activity. Premanjali is thankful to Kiva and its lenders for this support.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers, seeds and tools for cultivating paddy.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman was born in 1974. He is married and the father of three children. As Ayman is the only provider for his family, he started running his own mini-market four years ago where he sells food and general merchandise.

In order to expand his business, Ayman is requesting a 1,334 JOD loan through National Microfinance Bank to buy more merchandise and a coffee maker to add to his shop so that he can increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and a coffee maker

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 32-year-old married woman. She has four children and is a very dedicated mother. She started a business selling animals a few years ago, with the aim to provide a better living standard for her children. She earns a good amount to contribute to the family income. Her main customers are her neighbors and the people living nearby.

In her seventh loan cycle, she has requested 50,000 PKR to purchase more cattle. She hopes to grow her business. She also dreams of giving a good life and quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Herminda

texts.en:
Herminda is a snack vendor from Leyte, Philippines.  She has been involved in cooking sweetened banana barbecues for more than three years now, and that is the primary source of her income. 
Herminda is asking for a loan to buy more bananas, sugar, and cooking oil.  With this, she will be able to cook more snack foods which she can sell to her customers. In the future, Herminda dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en: Kousar is a 34-year-old married woman who sells animals. She buys baby goats and calves at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. Kousar needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her sixth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Maa Chanchala Shg Group

texts.en:
Maa Sarwasati Self Help Group is located in a small village in the Kalahandi district in Odisha, India and has 10 members. All members are women. As a group, they have supported and encouraged each other to save and improve their financial circumstances. 

Shanti is the president of the group. Shanti, 31, lives with her husband and their one child in a humble home. Shanti’s husband works as a fisherman in Lakes. To help supplement the income of their family, Shanti prepares and dries fish to sell in the village market. A loan from Kiva will help her purchase a fishing net and a storage box to sell more fish and increase her profit. She is very happy and grateful to Kiva for this kind help and support.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing net and a storage box

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to bring in a new collection of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Together Group

texts.en:
Peter is a middle-aged man and the featured member, standing in the middle of the photo. He is from Teshie, in the Accra-Ghana. His family includes his wife and children. He sells firewood at his residence. The family faces financial problems every now and then. Their present family income is not sufficient for their expenditures anymore, which is the reason for upgrading their business. For expansion of his business, he is in urgent need of money, as his meager savings is not sufficient.

Peter has taken loans for four cycles now and this will be his fifth loan. The loan will help to buy firewood from the suppliers that he can sell to customers. The profit he makes will improve his financial condition.

The group, Together, was formed with a common interest in getting a loan for their business endeavors. The loan will be used for expanding and improving their business undertakings.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Noyaa Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the Group called Noyaa, which consists of 5 members and has been operating for more than eight years. They are from Teshie, Accra in Ghana and are selling groceries, cloth materials, wigs, beans, rice and gari (cassava flour). 

Prince, the featured borrower of the group, is 25 years old and sells groceries (Milo, milk, rice, sugar, toffee. etc) in a kiosk at his residence.  Prince is single and lives in the same household with the mother and sibling.

The members of the group have received seven loans from ID Ghana previously and have repaid them on time. These loans have helped them improve their lives. Prince and his group are requesting a loan to purchase a grocery store and other commodities. This loan will help Prince to buy more groceries to sell to customers.

loans.use: to buy groceries like Milo, milk, rice, sugar, and toffee to sell to customers.

loans.name: Cathy

texts.en:
Cathy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and one goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members. Cathy operates a stationery shop that she rents, and she serves all kinds of people in her shop.  She has been in this business for the last 5 years, and she works six days a week. 
She has requested for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy boxes of reams of paper. Her major challenge includes high transportation costs which increase her overall operational costs. She aspires to buy a delivery van to make transportation easier and more affordable and she would also like to buy a computer to process data.  She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses includes food, and rent for her shop and house.

loans.use: to buy reams of paper for her stationery shop.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia is a 34-year-old, vigorous, married woman with eight children.  A year ago she started a hand embroidery business. She is zealous about her work and her client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is a laborer with a low salary. Safia’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of RS 40,000 to buy raw materials.  This includes thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She shared her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, such as thread, sequins, and pearls.

loans.name: Clara Luz

texts.es:
Clara, se dedica a cultivar maíz, plátano, pipián, etc., lo aprendió de sus padres, cuando formo su hogar inicio su propio negocio para tener ingresos con los que cancela los gastos de su hogar, ya tiene 24 años de tener su negocio, además también hacen trabajos de jornaleros. Clara vive con su compañero de vida y dos de sus hijos, sus otros hijos viven en la misma comunidad pero ya tienen  sus propios hogares.
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas para sembrar 3,500 plantas de plátano en una manzana y media, ampliara sus cultivos, en este momento tienen 2 manzanas plantadas de plátano y han realizado dos cortas, espera tener cultivos más variados para mejorar sus ingresos a futuro y ampliar el área de cultivo.
Sus sueños son construir su casa propia, comprar tierras para dejar de arrendarlas, dar a su familia un mejor estilo de vida y diversificar más sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Clara makes a living growing corn, bananas, pipian, etc. She learned her agricultural skills from her parents, and when she got her first home she began her own business in order to earn the money to pay for household expenses. She has now had her business for 24 years along with the help of day laborers.

Clara lives with her life partner and two of her children; her other children live in the same community, but already have their own homes.
