With the loan she is requesting, she will buy agricultural supplies to plant 3,500 banana plants on a plot and a half to improve her harvest. Currently, she has 2 plots of planted bananas. She wants to have a greater variety of crops so she can improve her future income, and expand her growing area.

Her dreams are to build her own house, to buy land that she can lease, to give her family a better lifestyle, and to diversify her crops.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies in order to plant 3,500 banana plants on a plot and a half

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 53 years old and married with four children.  She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Helen is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Helen has been in pig fattening for 15 years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.  She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Radhakrushna Shg Group

texts.en:
Radhakrushna Self Help Group (SHG) consists of 10 women from a village in Odisha, India. They formed a group to help themselves by sharing their problems and solving their problems among them. One of them is Binati who was selected as the president of Radhakrushna SHG. The lady who is seated and holding a register in the photo is Binati. She is 30 years old and is living with her husband and her two children. One of her children is in school and one is only two years old. She hopes to give a better education to her children. Binati has two acres of land in her village and she is using her land to grow sugarcane. Her husband is supporting her in this activity. 

The group has requested a loan of 150,000 Indian rupees. Binati will use her portion to purchase the required resources for sugarcane cultivation. She says a portion of the loan will help her to purchase sugarcane plants, fertilizers, and insecticides and will cover operational expenses such as labor charges.

loans.use: to purchase sugarcane plants, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 30-year-old married woman. For about 8 years she is been working in hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. This will be used to buy reels of threads in different colors, packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She hopes to increase her income by targeting more customers. Safia dreams for her children's bright future and desires to build her own house, as she is living in a rented house with her family.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors, packs of beads, sequins, and stones.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Cayetano está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, un zona eminentemente rural, donde todas ellas se dedican a actividades agrícolas y rurales.
La Sra. Ermelinda es parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a la cría, venta o faena de animales de corral que ella cría. Comenta que su trabajo es sacrificado, pero que lo hace para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Solicito este crédito para la compra de balanceados para sus animales, que le faltan para ampliar sus ventas. Y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su trabajo y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
The group, called "San Cayetano," is in the first cycle of a program committed solely to women. The group is from the city of Curuguaty, which is a predominantly rural area. All of the women make a living in agricultural or rural activities.

Sra. Ermelinda is part of the group--she makes a living breeding, selling, and slaughtering the farm animals that she raises. She describes her work as a sacrifice, but she does it in order to provide support to her family and loved ones.

She is asking for the loan so she can buy feed for her animals, something that she is currently lacking to grow her sales. With the loan she will be able to continue improving her work, and therefore give her family what they need to have a life without hardship.

loans.use: to buy feed for animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to bring in new products for her mini market.

loans.name: Dufashanye Ii Group

texts.fr:
Bibiane  fait partie du groupe  Dufashanye II et  habite à  Bujumbura. C’est une veuve de 53 ans. Elle a 4 enfants  âgés de 20 à 30 ans,dont 2 étudient à l’université.
Elle a sous sa charge 2 orphelins. 

Elle fait le commerce des ustensiles de cuisine  depuis  2ans. 

Elle  est à son cinquième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité d’ustensiles de cuisine  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait importer des  ustensiles de cuisine de Dubaï et  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Bibiane is a member of the Dufashanye II group, and she lives in Bujumbura.  She is a 53-year-old widow and the mother of four children between the ages of 30 and 20.  Two of her children currently study at the university.  Bibiane also takes care of two orphans.

Bibiane has been selling kitchen utensils for the past two years.  This is her fifth loan with Turame.  With his loan, financed by Kiva, she will be able to increase her capital and to buy a large quantity of kitchen utensils for resale.  Her goal is to increase her income.

In the coming years, she would like to import kitchen utensils from Dubai, and continue to see her children attend school.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of kitchen utensils for resale.

loans.name: Sy-Koutiala-01223 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe Kotognogontala 1  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Adamabougou, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec  Awa, assise 2ème de  gauche   à droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 275 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group “Kotognogontala 1” are married women, who average 37 years of age and three children each, all living in traditional families in Adamabougou, a village in Koutiala (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali.) The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their ninth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with Awa (sitting second from the left in the photo). With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs, seeds, and sundry tools and to cover the cost of plowing and weeding for maintaining 1 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a mixed customer base in the village and in Koutiala. She plans on making an average profit of 275,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, farm inputs, farm tools, and weeding

loans.name: Kotognogontala 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe Kotognogontala 3  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Adamabougou, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec  Tene, assise 2ème de droite à gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 265 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group “Kotognogontala 3” are married women, who average 37 years of age and four children each, all living in polygamous families in Adamabougou, a village in Koutiala (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali.) The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their ninth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with Tene (sitting second from the left in the photo). With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs, seeds, and sundry tools and to cover the cost of plowing and weeding for maintaining 1 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a mixed customer base in Koutiala. She plans on making an average profit of 265,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, farm inputs, farm tools, and weeding

loans.name: Kotognogontala 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe Kotognogontala 2  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Adamabougou, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec  Macourou, assise 2ème de   gauche à droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 285 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group “Kotognogontala 2” are married women, who average 40 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional families in Adamabougou, a village in Koutiala (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali.) The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their ninth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with Macourou (sitting second from the left in the photo). With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs, seeds, and sundry tools and to cover the cost of plowing and weeding for maintaining 1 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a mixed customer base in the village and in Koutiala. She plans on making an average profit of 285,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, farm inputs, farm tools, and weeding

loans.name: Kalaimagal Shg - Ashukudi Group

texts.en:
Ashukudi is a small village in Ariyalur district. Fourteen women from the village have formed a Self Help Group which is called “Kalaimagal” SHG. Santhi is the leader of the group. They have been receiving loans from “PAT” for the last 12 years, and they are repaying them successfully. 

Santhi is living with her husband and three children. Her husband is a farmer. The family is living in their own house. 

Santhi and the 13 other members are seeking a loan to buy a smokeless stove. Currently, all members are using conventional firewood stoves, and these stoves emit a lot of smoke, which is affecting the health of family members. All members have planned to buy Greenway Smart (smokeless) stoves because they are single-burner, high-efficiency cook-stoves designed for long-term, everyday use. The stove can use any type of solid biomass fuel, producing 70% less smoke and using 65% less fuel than traditional mud cook stoves.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Willian Asael

texts.es:
Willian, ha tenido un resultado positivo al invertir el capital anterior en su negocio, pues tuvo los recursos económicos para reparar el camión y pintar el microbús para brindar un mejor servicio y seguridad a sus clientes y de esta manera seguir generando ingresos para cancelar los gastos familiares. Su familia se encuentra en óptimas condiciones y continúa trabajando para seguir ampliando su negocio.
Nuevamente se decidió por un crédito para invertirlo en compra de 2 llantas, luces, pastillas para frenos y dos discos para el molino nixtamal, para dar mantenimiento a sus unidades de transporte y mantener la continuidad de su progreso.
texts.en: Willian has had a positive result after investing the previous loan in his business since he had the economic resources to repair his truck and paint his minivan to give his customers a better service and safety.  In this way he kept generating income to pay the family expenses.  His family is in optimal conditions and he continues to work to expand his business.  He again asks for a loan to invest in the purchase of two tires, lights, brake pads and two discs for his corn mill and to give maintenance to his transport units and give continuity to his progress.

loans.use: buy two tires, lights, brake pads and two discs for his corn mill and to give maintenance to his transport units and give continuity to his progress.

loans.name: Sri Saraswathi Shg - Kottur Group

texts.en:
Chitra is a 48-year-old woman who is married and has a child. Chitra’s husband is a farmer with many years of experience.

Chitra has learned of a smokeless stove manufactured by Grameen Infra that uses 65% less fuel than traditional mud cook stoves. Most members in her community use conventional firewood stoves in their kitchens, which cause 70% more smoke emissions than the smokeless stove. Chitra wishes to be able to save money on fuel expenses, as well as provide a good atmosphere in the house, devoid of caustic fumes.

Chitra is a leader of the Sri Saraswathi Self-Help Group (SHG), which is located in Kottur village of Tamil Nadu, India. She and the other six members of the group wish to request a group loan in order to buy this smokeless stove. They all are hoping to benefit from the lower fuel costs and safety of lower smoke emissions. 

The group members are very excited about the opportunity to purchase this sustainable stove and wish to thank the lenders.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Max

texts.es: Max es chófer asalariado y afiliado a un sindicato, vive en casa de sus padres la cual es muy humilde en la ciudad de la Paz. Max ha comprado una movilidad y desea un credito para reparar todos los desperfectos que tiene, de esa manera incrementara sus ingresos Max no tiene a quien recurrir por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Max is a salaried driver affiliated with a union.  He lives in his parents home, which is very humble, in the city of La Paz.  Max has purchased a car and needs a loan in order to fix a few imperfections that it has.  In this way Max will increase his income.  Max does not have any other means of assistance, and that is why he is requesting this loan.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta, sigue teniendo su negocio de tienda, venta de gallinas y su pupuseia funcionando, por lo que se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar aceita, azúcar, sal, arroz, frijoles, golosinas, harina y gallinas, para satisfacer a sus clientes en lo que demandan.
Con el financiamiento anterior fortaleció su negocio lo suficiente para atraer nuevos clientes, aumentar sus ventas y ganancias, su familia continua unida, todos se encuentran en óptimas condiciones.
texts.en:
Marta continues working in her restaurant / store selling chickens and pupusas, and it is going well.  For that reason she sees the need to request a new loan in order to buy oil, sugar, salt, rice, beans, sweets, flour and chickens, in order to satisfy the demands of her customers. 

With the previous loan she strengthened her business enough to be able to attract new customers, increase sales, and increase income.  Her family remains close and everyone is in good health.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, salt, rice, beans, sweets, flour and chickens for her store.

loans.name: Maa Manikeswari Shg Group

texts.en:
All the members of this Maa Manikeswari Shg (Self Help Group) first want to say thank you to Kiva and its lenders across the world for this kind support and help. Maa Manikeswari Help Group is located in a village in the Kalahandi district of Odisha, India, and has 10 members. All the members are women. As a group, they have supported and encouraged each other to save and improve their financial circumstances. 

Subhashree is the president of the group. Subhashree, 34 years old, lives with her husband and their one school-aged child in a humble home. Subhashree’s husband works as a farmer in the village. To help supplement the income of her family, Subhashree grows paddy in her field and sells it with the help of her husband. 

She has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and sacks for storing the paddy.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and sacks for storing the paddy.

loans.name: Thamarai Shg - Thiruneelakudi Group

texts.en:
Forty-seven-year-old married Shanthi is the leader of the Thamarai Self Help Group, which is managed by the local NGO People Action for the Transformation in Tamil Nadu. She lives in the small village of Thiruneelakudi in her house with her family. 

Shanthi's husband is a farmer. They have two children. Shanthi has taken loans from the PAT previously and repaid the loans on time.

Shanthi and the other members of the group want to buy a smokeless stove that emits less smoke. The smoke from traditional stoves irritates the eyes and lungs and makes family members susceptible to respiratory diseases. The smokeless stove reduces the risk of respiratory diseases and helps them lead a healthier life.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
En total son 21 mujeres inspiradas en la ayuda a sus seres queridos que se esfuerzan día a día para solventar los gastos del hogar y por sobre todo aumentar sus ingresos y ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra. Mercedes una de ellas se encuentra contenta por formar parte del comité, ya que mediante eso ella pudo emprender una  actividad para ganar dinero, ella elabora comestibles y se dedica a la venta, ya que con ello puede ganarse la vida de una manera honrada y honesta. Ella se define a su misma como una persona que quiere salir adelante, y que se esfuerza por lo que quiere.
Mercedes quiere invertir su préstamo en la compra de insumos varios para poder seguir con sus ventas de comidas, como ser carne, pollo, condimentos, verduras, y demás y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
In all there are 21 women in this group who are inspired to help their loved ones and who struggle day by day to meet household living expenses and above all to increase their income and help their families. 

Mercedes is one of these women.  She is happy to form part of the group, since through them she has been able to begin a business in order to earn money.  She makes food and sells it, which allows her to earn an income and live honorably and honestly.  She describes herself as a person who wants to get ahead and who works hard for what she wants.  

Mercedes wants to invest her loan in the purchase of varied food products in order to continue with her food sales.  She will buy things like meat, chicken, condiments, vegetables and other items in order to continue the work that she is currently doing.

loans.use: To buy meat, chicken, condiments, vegetables and other items

loans.name: Jay Maa Chanchala Shg Group

texts.en:
Jay Maa Chanchala Self Help Group is made up of 10 women from a small village of Kalahandi district of Odisha, India. All the members of this group are involved in different activities, such as betel leaf cultivation, milk selling, paddy and vegetable cultivation, etc. They are very hardworking women having a willingness to learn new business trends. They all help and support each other. Whatever they are earning from their businesses is used for their monthly household expenses. 

One of the group members, Gangeswari, is the president of this group. Gangeswari is 33 years old and lives with her husband, parents-in-law and two children. She does paddy and maize cultivation. She produces rice and maize and sells it at the market. Her husband is a farmer. Her husband helps Gangeswari in selling at the market. 

Gangeswari, along with her group members, is asking for a loan amount of 150,000 INR to invest in their business activities. Gangeswari will use her portion to purchase standard-quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her betel leaf cultivation. She wants to construct a house for her family. She says, on behalf of the group members, "Thank you, Kiva, for providing this opportunity for us!"

loans.use: to purchase standard-quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her betel leaf cultivation.

loans.name: Maisa

texts.en: Maisa is a 22-year-old married university student majoring in Child education, and she is in her second year. She lives with her husband in Irbid, Jordan, and she is seeking a good job in her study field after she gets her Bachelors’ degree so that she will help her husband in improving their living conditions. She doesn't have enough money to pay her upcoming semester fees, so she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Mary Cris

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mary Cris works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from her general store. 

Mary Cris has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Mary Cris hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen, aged 53, is the mother of five children. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last three years. She is keen to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. 

As Parveen wants to grow her business, she has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR to buy stocks of rice, sugar, grains, peas and flour from the market at lower rates. She will then be able to consistently meet the increasing demand. Parveen is in her seventh loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. 

Parveen wishes to utilize part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses and also to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, sugar, grains, peas and flour.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 43 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosalinda has been farming vegetables for 20 years and earns additional income from motorcycle transport and pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for her son's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items for resale

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en: Zareena is a 55-year-old married woman; she has been running a business selling cloth for the past seven years. She sells the cloth in her locality after purchasing it from wholesale at a slightly lower price. She has three children, and this business is the only source of income for her household. Zareena is in her sixth loan cycle with Kashf Foundation and shows a good repayment history. Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. With this loan she intends to purchase stock of fancy cloth with greater variety from the market. She hopes to get a good return from her sales, with which she wants to provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase stock of fancy cloth with greater variety.

loans.name: Akhtar

texts.en: Akhtar is a 54-year-old married woman and the mother of three. She has been running a business of cloths sales for many years. She purchases a variety of cloths from the main city and then sells it to the people in her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. Akhtar requested a loan of 45,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to buy bundles of different cloth for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy bundles of different cloth for the summer season.

loans.name: Nigat

texts.en: Nigat is a 53-year-old woman who financially helps her family. Some years ago, she took the initiative in her area and started a school that offers educational services to poor students at cheap rates, so they can have a better future. Her business is beneficial for her household and society as a whole. Nigat has requested her sixth loan from Kashf Foundation for 50,000 PKR, which she will use to purchase furniture such as chairs and tables, along with a new black and white board, to accommodate more students. She hopes to have more students in her school in the coming days.

loans.use: to purchase furniture such as chairs and tables, along with a new black and white board.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is a 34-year-old married woman and the mother of four.  She is a hard-working mother who provides tailoring services in her community. In this way, she is helping her family as her husband’s income on its own is not sufficient to meet their expenses. She is very knowledgeable about the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help Rani to continue operating her business, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy more spools of thread, ribbons, lace, cloth and buttons so she can stitch more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, Rani will use part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread, ribbons, lace, cloth and buttons.

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira is a 32-year-old married woman. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of sewing. She has received much appreciation from her community. Saira has accepted the fact that if only her husband works for their family, they will be unable to meet their household's expenses and their children's educational needs. Together with her husband, Saira manages their household while operating a business. Currently, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Saira has now requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, zippers and lace in various colors. In this way, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Saira hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, zippers and lace in various colors.

loans.name: Melitona

texts.en:
Melitona is 50 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines which she has been doing for three years. Melitona earns additional income from pig fattening and selling vegetables.

Melitona is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is a 37-year-old married woman and is running a small general store in her community with the support of her son. She has been doing it for the past five years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar, grains and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Abida wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar, grains and flour.

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en: Chanda is a 27-year-old woman. She earns her living by doing embroidery work. She is very famous in her town for the aesthetic designs that she makes. She has been able to expand her clientele over the years and her business is constantly expanding as a result. In her 4th loan cycle, she has requested a loan of 40000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to buy more frames, needles and threads of different colors, which will help in generating more income. She is hopeful that by expanding her business she will able to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy more frames, needles and threads of different colors.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 60-year-old active woman; she has been sewing clothes for many years. She sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of available funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenue so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 6th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo is a merchant from Leyte, Philippines. He earns a living through his sari-sari or retail store business. He sells various goods and items to the people in his village. Ricardo's business was ruined when a typhoon hit the country last year. Now, he is starting to rebuild. Ricardo is now asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, biscuits, snack foods, soda, beverages, cooking oil, etc. With this, he will be able to augment his stock, thus attracting more buyers. In the future, Ricardo hopes of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, biscuits, snack foods, soda, beverages, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Jastar

texts.en:
Jastar is a 42-year-old woman married to Justin, who adds additional income to support the welfare of their family. They are blessed with four children. Jastar has been operating a bakery shop for four years, earning an income of KES 5,000 at the end of every month.

Jastar is now servicing her second loan of KES 7,500 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy doughnut flour to make some buns and doughnuts for her customers.

Jastar plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy flour to make some doughnuts and buns for her customers.

loans.name: Waad

texts.en: Waad is a university student in her third year. She lives with her parents and four siblings. She is planning to work in her study field after getting her bachelor’s degree so that she will start helping her family financially, but she doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen has successfully built her general store business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family. Previously with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her fifth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase stocks of grains, sugar, flour, biscuits and oil along with packs of detergent and soap. This will enable her to increase her sales to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of grains, sugar, flour, biscuits and oil along with packs of detergent and soap

loans.name: Houda

texts.en:
Houda is the married mother of four children, born in 1964, and has an intermediate level of education.

Fourteen years ago, she started tailoring clothes and selling them from her house to help her husband in covering their family’s expenses and needs.

Today, Houda is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a special offer newly released collection.

This loan will help Houda increase her production and expand her work which will affect her life positively by increasing her income and saving profits for her children’s future.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a special offer newly released collection.

loans.name: Shugufta

texts.en: Shugufta is a 60-year-old, married woman and the mother of three. She has been running a business trading clothes for the past four years. She always has a great collection to offer to her customers and earns a good amount of income to bear her household expenditures. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently she is in her seventh loan cycle and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This will help her to purchase more variety of ladies’ clothes to cater to more customers in her locality. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of ladies’ clothes.

loans.name: Shila

texts.en:
Shila, 40 years old, is a married woman and mother of two children (one son and one daughter). She is from the rural village of Tekatuli in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. One of her children goes to school and is in grade 12. Her son is engaged in a small business.  Both she and her husband Dulal attended school up to the secondary level.

Shila's husband is a car driver by profession. Their family income is not sufficient to manage all the household expenses of the family. Thus, Shila decided to help her family financially with her earnings. For this purpose, she started her business of selling saris. Saris are garments consisting of a length of cotton or silk elaborately draped around the body, traditionally worn by the women of India.

Shila started her business from her house. She is taking the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy different varieties of saris from the wholesale market to fulfill the demands of her customers. Her neighbors, relatives and friends are her main customers. Now she is playing an important role by giving financial support to her family. With the growing needs of her family and the increasing educational expenses of her child, she started her business to give financial support to her family. She is a successful entrepreneur. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and her plans are to use the profit of her business for the betterment of her family members and to get ahead in her business.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase wide varieties of saris to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery items for resale

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
Tomasa is 57 years old and married with six children.  

Tomasa is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables and corn in the Philippines. Tomasa has requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Tomasa has been farming vegetables and corn for 45 years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Tomasa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Vinayaga Shg - Kathiramangalam Group

texts.en:
Kasthuri is the leader of the Vinayaga Self Help Group, which is managed by the local NGO People Action for Transformation (PAT) in Tamil Nadu. Kasthuri lives in Kathiramangalam village with her child and husband in her own house. Her husband is a farmer and works on a daily wage basis in their village. She has taken loans from PAT previously and repaid them on time. 

Kasthuri and the other members are requesting a loan to purchase a smokeless stove, which is manufactured by Greenway Grameen Infra Pvt, Ltd. It costs 1,400 INR. A smokeless stove emits less carbon dioxide, which reduces smoke. Traditional stoves consume more time and money. The smokeless stove is highly efficient and designed for long-term use. This will allow a reduction in problems related to health, deforestation and climate change.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en: Yousef is a 19-year-old university student majoring in computer information systems, and he is in his second year. He also works in the evenings at a cafe. He is planning to find a better job after he gets his bachelors' so that he will earn a better income. But he doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For that, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Sri Vinayagamurthy Shg - Andalampettai Group

texts.en:
Karthika is the leader of the Sri Vinayagamurthy Self Help Group, which is managed by the local NGO, People Action for Transformation (PAT) in Tamil Nadu. Karthika lives in Andalampettai village, Trichy district. She is 36 years old and lives in her own house with her child and husband. Karthika has taken loans from the PAT previously and repaid them on time. She has taken loans to improve her livelihood and for the cultivation of paddy, sugar cane, ragi etc.

Karthika wants to buy a smokeless stove, which is better than the traditional stove. The latter emits a lot of carbon dioxide and creates health and environmental problems. The smokeless stove emits less smoke, reduces the risk of respiratory diseases and is clean and easy to use.

Along with Karthika, the other members are requesting a loan to purchase a smokeless stove to lead a healthier life.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila is a 48-year-old married woman. A year ago, she started a small general store in her community to contribute to the family income. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. She is the mother of five children and is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy stock of rice, sugar, oil, tea, biscuits and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her sixth loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar, oil, tea, biscuits and flour.

loans.name: Kaniz

texts.en: Kaniz is a 38-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a business making flowers for many years. She offers various colorful flowers for decorating homes and events like birthdays, parties, etc. She sells them to the people of her community and also supplies the local market.  She has good communication skills and has a good client list. Her husband works as a laborer and earns insufficient income to support her family alone. She is motivated to provide for her family. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy raw material such as fabric, glace papers and floral tapes along with packs of paint in various colors. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demands of her customers consistently. She wishes to spend part of the revenues to deal with the expenses of her family and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as fabric, glace papers and floral tapes along with packs of paint in various colors.

loans.name: Jhunu

texts.en:
Jhunu is a 29-year-old housewife who lives in the small town of Maynaguri in her own house. She is married to Rabi, who is also 29 years old, and both Jhunu and her husband have a primary education. They are blessed with two little sons who are too young for school.

Jhunu, though a housewife, is engaged in a business of making BORI (made of different pulses) and sells it in her neighborhood. In this way, she tries to earn for the family. Jhunu's husband is a cycle-van puller. He carries loads and people on his cycle van and earns for the family. Cycle-van is a kind of carriage that is pulled using a bicycle and is widely used in rural areas by the regional people. But the income of both her and her husband is very small and it is difficult to maintain the family. Both of them thought of purchasing another cycle-van to rent to others for more income. 

Then Jhunu came to know about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and has taken a loan to purchase a cycle van for carrying people and goods in their locality so that her husband earns more than he earned previously. Their future dream is to strengthen their family economy and admit their children to renowned schools to become professionals.

Her full thanks go to BJS as well as Kiva for giving the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle van for carrying goods and people.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing items and kitchenware for resale.

loans.name: Sri Amman Shg - Thepperumanallur Group

texts.en:
Senthamilselvi is 29 years old and resides in Thepperumanallur, a small village in Tamil Nadu, India. Senthamilselvi is married and has two children, both of whom are studying in Elementary School. Her husband is a laborer in the agriculture fields. It is difficult to sustain the family with his income alone.

Senthamilselvi is the featured borrower of the nine-member “Sri Amman” Self-Help Group (holding a board with the SHG name). The group has been receiving loans from the local NGO “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT) for the last five years.   

Senthamilselvi and her group would like to take a loan to purchase a Greenway smart smokeless stove. Each group member is requesting a small loan of INR 1400, which will be repaid in easy installments. The Greenway smart stove is a single burner, high-efficiency cook stove designed for long-term, everyday use. The stove can use any type of solid biomass fuel including wood, cow dung and agricultural waste. It also produces 70% less smoke while using 65% less fuel than traditional mud cook stoves. 

Senthamilselvi and her group have the opportunity to save time and cut a recurring fuel expense while being able to cook in a healthier environment. This stove has also been tested and certified by the Ministry of New & Renewable Energy (MNRE), Government of India.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove

loans.name: Sameena

texts.en: Sameena, age 48, deals in the cloth trade. Two years ago she started her business to earn a good amount of income to contribute to the family income.  She buys a variety of cloth from the main city market and sells these to the people of her local community. By this time she has attained good number of customers. At present, she is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR which will allow her to purchase a greater selection of cloth in a larger variety of colors, taking into account the taste and choice of her customers. Sameena expects a boost in her net income through her increased sales. She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase a greater selection of cloth in a larger variety of colors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the fees for registering at a university.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
La señora Teofila tiene 53 años, tiene tres hijos ya mayores de edad, ella hace más de 5 años que tiene el negocio de panadería, anteriormente solo el padre de familia era el sostén de la familia, con el pequeño negocio pudieron costear los gastos familiares y en especial de sus hijos estudiantes, uno de sus mayores anhelos es de que sus hijos estudios culminen sus estudios, por lo cual todos colaboran en el trabajo diario del pequeño negocio.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo compra de harina en bolsas por cantidad para la elaboración de panificados, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo luchando por su familia.
texts.en:
Senora Teofila is 53 years old and has three (adult) children. For more than five years, she has had a bakery business. Her husband was previously the breadwinner, but with just a small business, the costs of household expenses were very high--especially when her children were students. Their greatest desire was for their  children to finish their studies, therefore they all began to collaborate on the daily work of the small business.

She is asking for this loan in order to purchase large quantities of flour in order to produce baked goods; this will allow her to continue her work and striving for her family.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of flour

loans.name: Yessica Esmeralda

texts.es:
Yessica, tiene un negocio en el que vende joyas de enchape y variedad de ropa, este oficio lo aprendió dentro de su familia, trabaja seis días de la semana, en un horario de 9:00 a.m. a 2:00 p.m., ya tiene clientes que prefieren sus productos; ella es acompañada, con su compañero de vida comparten el privilegio de criar a tres hijos.
Invertirá en la compra de nuevos estilos de ropa y el resto en joyería, podrá cubrir la demanda de sus clientes ofreciendo vestidos, blusas, faldas, ropa interior, camisas, pulseras, aretes, reloj, etc.; espera mantener su negocio funcionado y diversificar la mercadería, los riesgos son los niveles de delincuencia.
Sus aspiraciones es remodelar la vivienda que comparte con su familia para tener un mejor estilo de vida y ampliar su negocio mucho más.
texts.en:
Yessica has a business selling metal jewelry and a variety of clothing, a trade she learned from her family. She works six days a week, from 9am to 2pm. She already has many customers that prefer her products.

She is accompanied by her life partner, with whom she shares the privilege of raising three children. She will invest in purchasing new styles of clothing and jewelry in order to meet the demand of her customers, who want things like dresses, blouses, skirts, underwear, shirts, bracelets, earrings, watches, etc.

She hopes to keep her business operating and to diversify her store, though crime rates are a big risk. Her dreams are to remodel her home that she shares with her family in order to have a better quality of living, as well as to expand her store.

loans.use: to buy new styles of clothing and jewelry in order to meet the demand of her customers

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Juan está en su ciclo número 11 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, es un grupo bastante unido que hace todo tipo de actividades para poder tener un grupo consolidado y que se ayude.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gladys, quien además de ser una de las integrantes también es la presidenta del grupo, quien trata siempre de poder guiar a sus compañeras para que por medio del trabajo en equipo puedan salir adelante. Gladys se dedica a la venta variada de cosméticos que vende de manera ambulante y sobre pedidos, ya tiene una clientela que siempre le hace los pedidos. Gracias a su trabajo ha dado a su familia lo que necesitan para el día a día.
Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, y pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos variados, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con su trabajo, luchando por mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The "San Juan" group is in cycle number 11 of it's program committed just to women, who all work and help out in order to get ahead. It's a very tight-knit group that does a lot of different activities in order to help each other out.

On of the members is Senora Gladys, who, along with being a member, is also the president of the group. Gladys makes a living selling various cosmetics; she does this as a street vendor, but also by taking orders. She already has a large clientele that makes orders.

Thanks to her work, she can give her family what they need day to day. She is thankful for the opportunity that she has received, and is asking for this loan in order to invest in the purchase of various cosmetics; this will help her to continue with her job and to fight for a higher income.

loans.use: to buy various cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Carlos Alexander

texts.es:
Carlos, mantiene su esfuerzo por seguir mejorando, por lo que se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para comprar cadenas, pedales, carburadores, pistones, rayos, etc., para reparar las motocicletas de sus clientes.
Logro establecer mejor su taller con ayuda del crédito anterior, el servicio que ofrece es de mayor calidad, sus ingresos se han mantenido mejorando y sigue aportando para cubrir gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Carlos has maintained his efforts to continue improving, which is why he has decided to ask for a new loan to buy chains, pedals, carburetors, pistons, and lights, etc. to repair his customer's motorcycles. 

With his previous loan, he was able to better establish his workshop. Now, the services he offers are of higher quality, his income has been growing, and he continues to contribute to his family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy chains, pedals, carburetors, pistons, and lights to repair his customer's motorcycles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To food ingredients to make tamales and bread for resale so she can renovate her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticides to prepare his land for the planting season.

loans.name: Gladis Violeta

texts.es:
Gladis tiene 23 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, tiene dos hijos a su cargo, vive con su familia en casa propia la cual está ubicada en el distrito de Oyotun en la provincia de Chiclayo en la region de Lambayeque esta zona es rural en ella se dedican a la agricultura y ha criar y vender animales de corral.

Gladis es comerciante de animales como patos, cuyes, gallinas, ect. Solicita préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de animales pequeños para la crianza de ellos y luego de unos meses incrementar sus ingresos y así apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Gladis, 23, lives with her common-law husband and two children in their own home in the district of Oyotun in the province of Chiclayo.  It is located in the Lambayeque Region which is a rural area dedicated to agriculture and barnyard animal farming.

Gladis sells animals such as ducks, guinea pigs, chickens.  She is requesting a loan through Edpyme Alternative to buy small animals to raise and sell after a few months.  She wants to increase her income to support her family.

loans.use: To buy more animals and increase productivity.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Divino Niño Jesús está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Es un grupo nuevo que tiene muchas esperanzas de poder crecer y salir adelante. Están además dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una quiere crecer y salir adelante.
La Sra. Nanci, una de las integrantes, es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha para poder crecer y ayudar a su familia por medio de ese trabajo, comenta que se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales, como así también de sombreros, por medio de este humilde trabajo, ella está luchando por su familia y sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de remedios naturales y también de sombreros varios para la venta. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The communal bank Divino Nino Jesus is in its first loan cycle through the women's committee, where all the members work and help each other get ahead.  It is a new group with many hopes for growing and prospering.  They are also participating in the poverty elimination program in an aim to grow and get ahead.

One of the members is Nanci who is a very hard worker and struggles to grow and help her family through her work.  She says she sells natural medicines as well as hats.  Through her humble work she is struggling for her family and loved ones.

The loan she is requesting is to buy natural medicines and hats to sell.  She is grateful for this opportunity which will be of great help to her.

loans.use: To buy natural remedies to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth Santos

texts.en:
Elizabeth, 45, lives with her common-law husband and two children.  She is very well known in her community for her grocery store business.  She has good references and her family is very close knit.  The community she lives in is 45 kms from the province of Chiclayo, department of Lambayeque, along the northern coast of Peru.  The climate is warm and the people are friendly and work in commerce, agriculture and livestock farming.

Elizabeth sells groceries and, for over four years now, has been raising and selling small animals.  She is requesting the loan to increase her work capital to buy more merchandise for her store.  This is so she can generate more income and profits to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycles for resale and more dairy products such as cheese, cream, curd, etc.

loans.name: Kotognogontala  5 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe Kotognogontala 5  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Adamabougou, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec  Awa Tiemoko, assise 2ème de droite à gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 160 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The 10 members of Kotognogontala 5 Group are married women with an average age of 36. They have an average of three children and all live in traditional families in Adamabougou, one of the villages in Koutiala, the third largest administrative region in Mali. The women work with the micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso to better operate their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their ninth loan; the previous loans were all fully repaid. Awa Tiemoko, siting second from right to left in the photo, grows groundnuts. With her loan, she plans to buy inputs, seeds, small farm equipment, and to pay for the labor costs and weeding of 1 hectare of land. After the harvest, the output is sold at the village level in Koutiala to a mixed clientele. She expects to earn a profit of 160,000 FCFA at the end of the season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan as well as help her husband with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs, seeds, inputs, farming equipment, and weeding fees.

loans.name: Kotognogontala 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe Kotognogontala 4  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Adamabougou, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec  Barakissa, assise au bout et à droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 165 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The 10 members of Kotognogontala 4 Group are married women with an average age of 37. They have an average of three children and all live in traditional families in Adamabougou, one of the villages in Koutiala, the third largest administrative region in Mali. The women work with the micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso to better operate their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their ninth loan; the previous loans were all fully repaid. Barakissa, sitting at the far right in the photo, grows groundnuts. With her loan, she plans to buy inputs, seeds, small farming equipment, and to pay for the labor costs and weeding of one hectare of land. After the harvest, the output is sold at the village level, in Koutiala, to a mixed clientele. She expects to earn a profit of 165,000 FCFA at the end of the season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan as well as help her husband with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs, seeds, inputs, farming equipment, and weeding.

loans.name: Benkadi  I Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKADI I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BAKAMANI, un des villages de SANANKORO DJITOUMOU, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec  MAIMOUNA, 2ème personne debout  de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  95.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The 10 members of Benkadi 1 Group are married women with an average age of 35. They have an average of four children and all live in polygamous families in Bakamani, one of the villages in Sanankoro Djitoumou, the second largest administrative region in Mali. The women work with the micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso to better operate their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their third loan.  Maimouna, standing second from left to right in the photo, grows groundnuts. With her loan, she plans to buy inputs, seeds, and to pay for the labor costs of maintaining of one hectare of land. After the harvest, the output is sold at the village level a clientele of resellers and consumers. She expects to earn a profit of 95,000 FCFA per season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan as well as help her husband with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labor, inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Benkadi  Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  05 membres du groupe  BENKADI II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BAKAMANI, un des villages de SANANKORO DJITOUMOU, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide et le mil avec  MINATA, 1ère personne debout  de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  95.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The five members of Benkadi II Group are married women with an average age of 35. They have an average of four children and all live in polygamous families in Bakamani, one of the villages in Sanankoro Djitoumou, the second largest administrative region in Mali. The women work with the micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso to better operate their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their third loan. Minata, standing at the far left in the photo, grows groundnuts and millet. With her loan, she plans to buy inputs, seeds, and to pay for the labor costs of maintaining of one hectare of land. After the harvest, the output is sold at the village level a clientele of resellers and consumers. She expects to earn a profit of 95,000 FCFA per season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan as well as help her husband with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs, inputs, and seeds.

loans.name: Relwende De Wobzougou Group

texts.fr:
Mme ELISE représente le groupe RELWEND DE WOBZOUGOU. Mariée, elle est mère de 08enfants. Le plus âgé a plus de 30ans et le moins âgé a 09ans. 05 vont à l’école et elle a 05 personnes en charge.
Mme fait le jardinage et vend aussi des condiments depuis plus de 30ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants.
Elle veut s’acheter 01 boite de semence d’oignon, 01 boite de semence de tomate, 02sacs                     d’engrais et 03 boites d’insecticides.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut épargner. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité et mieux s’occuper de ses enfants.
texts.en: Ms. Elise represents the Relwend de Wobzougou Group. She is married and mother of eight children; the oldest is over 30 years old and the youngest is 9 years old. Five attend school and she has five dependents.  Ms. Elise has been growing vegetables and also selling condiments for over 30 years.  She buys her supplies in neighboring villages. She wants to buy one box of onion seeds, one box of tomato seeds, two bags of fertilizer, and three boxes of insecticide.  With her profits, she will increase her savings. Her goal is to grow her business and take better care of her children.

loans.use: to buy one box of onion seeds, one box of tomato seeds, two bags of fertilizer, and three boxes of insecticide.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Mariée âgée de 37 ans, Akossiwa est mère de quatre(4) enfants  et habite dans le quartier de Tokoin. Elle vend du Tchoukoutchou, la boisson locale qu’elle prépare elle-même à partir du mil et revend sous une baraque à son domicile. Elle s’approvisionne deux (2) fois par mois au marché d’Akodésséwa. Akossiwa  sollicite un prêt pour agrandir son stock en achetant un sac de mil supplémentaire, afin  de faire plus de bénéfices
texts.en: Akossiwa is married and 37 years old. She is mother of four children and lives in the Tokoin neighborhood. She sells Tchoukoutchou, a local beverage that she prepares herself using millet and then resells from a shack at her home.  She buys her supplies twice a month at the Akodessewa market.  Akossiwa is asking for a loan to expand her inventory by buying an extra bag of millet to make more profit.

loans.use: to buy a bag of millet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for car polish, wax, and sprays.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is a 29-years-old lady. She has had a beauty parlor for the past three years. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials.  

Over the time she has attained regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She needs to generate more repeat customers. For this she requires hair care products, skin products, hair rollers and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities so she applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation. She is in her 6th loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of a loan investment.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products, hair rollers, and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, es estudiante, una persona dedicada a sus estudios, y también trabajador.
Su meta es poder terminar sus estudios en Ingeniería Agroforestal, y de esa forma poder trabajar en un puesto del gobierno y servir a los demás.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en las cuotas de su universidad, ya que le será de mucha ayuda y podrá seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Esteban is from the city of Caaguaza. He is a student and a worker, and is very dedicated to his studies.

His goal is to finish his studies in Agroforestry Engineering, which he is studying to be able to work a government post and serve others. He is asking for this loan to be able to invest in his college fees, which will be a huge help and allow him to continue his studies.

loans.use: to pay college fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoe soles and heels.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
Valentin es un Señor de 43 años que vive acompañado de su mujer y un hijo de 6 años trabaja como personal de una empresa de reparación de refrigeración hace más de 5 años, ahora opto por estudiar el curso de Técnico en Refrigeración de Aparatos eléctricos de Frio para así, cuando culmine el estudio independizarse y montar una propia empresa lo cual le ayudará a generar más ingresos y tener una vida mejor.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su estudio y también cubrir la matrícula de la misma.
texts.en:
Valentin is 43 years old and lives with his wife and 6 year old child. He has worked for a refrigeration repair company for more than five years. 

Now, he has decided to study a course about how to be a technician in refrigeration, specifically for cold electrical apparatus'. When he finishes his studies, he will set up his own company, which will help him to generate more income and have a better life. He is asking for the loan to be able to pay for studying fees, and also to cover his tuition.

loans.use: to pay tuition and fees for studying.

loans.name: Candelaria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Candelaria de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado de básica, esta soltera tiene dos hijos que estudian en la escuela del lugar donde viven.

Candelaria es empleada en una tienda donde venden diferentes productos como ropa y juguetes, trabaja ahí desde hace siete años.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para cancelar una deuda en otro banco que obtuvo, ya que el dinero lo ocupo para construir su casa.
Su sueño es tener trabajo con mayores ingresos, para darle a su familia una mejor vida y culminar con los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Candelaria, age 31, was in school up to grade 9. She is single with two children who attend the local school

Candelaria is employed in a store that sells various products such as clothing and toys. She has worked there for seven years.
The loan that she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to pay off a debt that she obtained from another bank and used to build her home.
Her dream is to have a job that brings in a better income in order to give her family a better life and see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to pay off a debt from another bank which she used to build her home.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 22 years old, married, and has one child. Three years ago, she decided to use her proficiency and skillfulness in making “Mouneh” to increase her family’s income. She sells her special homemade “Mouneh” (conserving food from one season to another) and is able to help her husband in covering the family’s expenses and needs.

Rita requested a Youth Loan from Al Majmoua, which she will use to buy necessary “Mouneh” products, which have to do with the current season’s agricultural production to be conserved for other seasons where they do not exist. This loan will help Rita to improve her business and save some of her acquired income for her child’s future.

loans.use: to purchase “Mouneh” products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase grocery products to resell.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose es un joven que estudia para poder sobresalir en la vida y a la vez ayudarles a sus padres. Esta estudiando la carrera de gestión pública, que le permitirá abrirse camino y tener mejores ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia.
Jose tiene muchos sueños y metas, y es por ellos que está esforzándose y luchando, ya que quiere también ayudar a su familia por medio de sus estudios.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, lo que le será de mucha ayuda y podrá seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Jose is a young man who studies in order to succeed in life and help his parents at the same time. He is studying public administration, which will allow him to open doors for himself and make a greater income in order to help his family.
Jose has many dreams and goals, and for these he is working hard, as he also wants to help his family through his studies.
He is requesting this loan to pay his university tuition. It will be a great help and he will be able to continue with his work.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Sarita ella es conviviente tiene 27 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales ,menores como pollos, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio e l cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría a sus animales para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solictan,la socia a la vez se dedica a la artesania,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos.
Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, plastiqueria, ferretería, venta de anticuchos, docente, venta de ropa, transporté.
Las personas que salen en la foto adjunta son socios que pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo y salud.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Virgen del Carmen communal bank, located in the Wanchaq district in the province and department of Cusco.
Sra. Sarita lives with her partner. She is 27 and has two children. She alternates her daily activities with her business raising small animals such as chickens. She has had this business for some time and it is going well for her thanks to the hard work that she puts into her business every day. She raises her animals in order to later sell them to her clients. She also makes handicrafts. She wants to be able to keep working in order to continue supporting her family.
She is requesting this loan for the purchase of chickens.
The other members sell food, plastics, have a smithy, sell kebabs, teach, sell clothing, and work in transport.
The people in the inserted photos are members who requested permission to arrive late to the meeting for reasons of health and work.
Sarita is grateful to those who are part of this dream through this loan and promises to repay her quotas as established.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Amina

texts.ru:
Амина проживает в районе Вахш. Она замужняя женщина. Ей 42 года. Амина является матерью шестерых детей. У них большая семья. У нее два мальчика и четверо дочерей. Муж Амины работает мясником. Сама Амина более семи лет разводит коз и овец. В разведении скота ей помогают ее дети пока Амина подрабатывает в поликлинике, медсестрой. 
Амина берет кредит для закупа крупнорогатого скота. Она намерена разводит скот в течении 30 - 35 дней, а затем продать скот с наценкой. Амина ждет вашей поддержки.
texts.en:
Amina lives in the Vakhsh district. She is 42, married, and has a large family with six children. She has two boys and four girls. Amina's husband is a butcher and she has raised goats and sheep for over seven years. Her children help with the livestock while she works in the clinic as a nurse. 
Amina is taking out a loan to buy livestock. She takes care of the animals for 30-35 days and then sells them for a profit. Amina awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy calves to resell in order to feed her large family

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco de 77 años de edad, es una persona que se dedica a la agricultura su mayor  preocupación es el bienestar de su esposa, esto le a convertido en un hombre de trabajo con mayor eficiencia. A lo largo de sus años de vida Aprendió la agricultura a la edad de 15 años, cuando su padre le enseño las actividades agrícolas. Sus padres que en paz descansen, quienes lo instruyeron en la vida a hacer una persona honesta y con buenos principios, Actualmente, él vive con su esposa , quien se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar y su nieto.

Francisco se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas,obteniendo así su trabajo estable, luego los fines de semana dedica su tiempo a  reparar calzado, el tiempo libre lo dedica a su descanso juntamente con su esposa y a pasar tiempo con su familia.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar abono, semilla de maíz, pesticidas y herbicidas.   En la época de  invierno las personas aprovechan para cultivar la tierra y de esta forma almacenar las cosechas para el consumo. De esta manera, podrá dar una mejor seguridad alimentaria y nutricional a su familia. 


Las proyecciones de  Francisco son las de inculcar buenos principios morales a su nieto, servir en su comunidad como miembro de la asociación de desarrollo comunal, e impulsar el desarrollo en su comunidad mediante la organización de los miembros, apoyar en los estudios de su nieto
texts.en:
Francisco, age 77, works in agriculture. His greatest preoccupation is the well-being of his wife; this causes him to work with greater efficiency. He learned to work in agriculture at the age of 15, from his father. His parents, who are at rest, taught him life lessons: to be an honest person with good principles. He currently lives with his wife, who does the housework, and with his grandson.
Francisco works in agriculture. This is a stable job. On the weekends he repairs shoes. In his free time, he and his wife rest, and they spend time with their family.
He is requesting a loan from CREDICAMPO for the purchase of manure, corn seeds, pesticides, and herbicides. In the winter, people take advantage of the opportunity to cultivate the land and save the harvests for consumption. He will be able to provide better food security and nutrition for his family through this loan.
Francisco's goals are to teach his grandson good moral principles, to serve his community as a member of the association of communal development, and to propel development in his community through organizing the members. He wants to support his grandson's studies.

loans.use: to buy manure, corn seed, pesticides and herbicides.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea tiene 61 años, es casada, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y 01 hija, su familia es muy unida, vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería que está ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltì, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Cliente se dedica a alquiler de mototaxi para que la maneje un tercero y presta mano de obra en una piñatería. Además cuenta con ingresos por pensión de jubilación; la inversión del prestamo será para el mantenimeinto de cultivo y el mantenimiento de su mototaxi. Tendrá variedad de productos para ofrecer al público y generar ingresos para una mejora en calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Andrea is 61 years old. She is married and lives in her own home with her husband and one daughter. Her family is very close. She lives in a community dedicated to commerce, agriculture and cattle ranching. It is located in the district of Cayaltì, province of Chiclayo, department of Lambayeque, in the northern coast of Peru. 

She rents out a motorcycle taxi. Someone else drives it for her and she works at a party store. In addition, she has income from her retirement.
