The loan will be invested in doing maintenance on her motorcycle taxi and in crop maintenance. She will have a variety of products to offer the public and generate income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to do crop maintenance and motorcycle taxi maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy crates of tomatoes, green beans, onions, and cucumbers

loans.name: Zina

texts.en:
Zina, 56, has two children. She and her family live in Garni village in the Kotayq region of Armenia. 

Zina is a farmer. By means of this activity she earns an acceptable income that helps her support her family. She's been in this line of work for more than ten years and works alongside of her children who help her with all the chores that her crop requires.

The requested loan of $3,000 (USD) will greatly support Zina to purchase two cows, fertilizer and seeds, and to cover labor costs for gathering the harvest.

loans.use: to pay for two cows, fertilizer and seeds, and to cover labor costs for gathering the harvest

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural materials to help her coffee crops in this new season.

loans.name: Yuliana Estella

texts.es:
Yuliana, a sus 26 años de edad, es una mujer carismática, activa y servicial.

Ser independiente, es el principal motivo para luchar incansablemente día a día, buscando alternativas para ganarse la vida y llevar el sustento a su hogar. 

Desde hace aproximadamente 7 años, comenzó con un negocio de fabricación y venta de sandalias para todo tipo de clientes, de muy buena calidad y a excelentes precios, lo que le ha permitido darse a conocer en el sector donde vive. 

Esto la impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para fortalecer su negocio, pues comprará insumos como suelas, nylon, caucho, telas, entre otros, así podrá satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en esta temporada, pues cuenta con la ventaja de vivir en un barrio donde hay mucha afluencia de clientes potenciales, esto le ayudará a mejorar los ingresos que percibe por su labor. 

Yuliana manifiesta que nada le impide seguir haciendo lo que le apasiona, por ello siempre se propone nuevas metas y entre ellas está el de convertirse en una gran fabricadora y distribuidora de calzado, generando oportunidades de empleo, así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Yuliana is 26 years old. She is a charismatic, active and helpful women. Being independent is her main motivation day to day, seeking alternative to earn a living and supporting her home. 
 
Approximately 7 years ago, she started a business making and selling sandals for all types of customers. They are good quality and very well priced. It has allowed her to become known in the area where she lives.   

This has driven her to ask for the help of a loan to fortify her business. She will buy materials such as soles, nylon, rubber, fabric, and more. This way, she can satisfy the demand that goes up during this season. She has the advantage of living in a neighborhood where there is a wealth of potential customers. This will help her improve her income from her work.  

Yuliana says that nothing stops her from continuing to do what she is passionate about and so she is always setting new goals for herself. One of them is to become a great shoe manufacturer and distributor, generating employment opportunities. This way, she can improve the quality of life and well being of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as soles, rubber, nylon, and more to drive her business and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food warmers and gas cooker tops

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy electrical gadgets for resale.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a married man, and he has two children. 

Christopher operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for ten years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of finances. 

Christopher will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a motorcycle. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. He will use the anticipated profits to ensure that his job is sustainable.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Kakoli

texts.en:
Kakoli is a very young entrepreneur of only 27 years, and hails from Maynaguri. She is a rural housewife who lives with her husband, Sanjib, and two school-going children in a remote village, Debinagar of Jalpaiguri district. They live in their own house. Kakoli studied up to grade 10, whereas her husband completed grade 8. One of their children is in grade 6 and other is in grade 4. Kakoli's husband is associated with a small business of selling papadam. 

Kakoli is also engaged in a business of sewing garments, because she knows if her husband works alone for the family, they will not be able to meet the growing household expenses and their children's educational expenses. She stitches small clothing like shirts, trousers, frocks and ladies' garments. She wants to work hard with her husband to provide additional income for the family.

Kakoli has taken a loan from BJS to purchase another sewing machine, as the machine she is using presently has damage. She will also buy threads, cloths, buttons, etc., in order expand her tailoring business.

She hopes to grow the business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through hard work.

She gives her thanks to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for her garment-stitching business.

loans.name: Phoolmati

texts.en:
Phoolmati is a 31-year-old woman residing in a remote village, Tekatuli in Jalpaiguri district. She is illiterate and can sign her name only. She is married and is a mother of three children (one son and two daughters). Being a housewife, she looks after her husband and children and does all the household work at home. Their children are students of grade 5, 6 and 6, respectively.

Her husband, 40-year-old Dhaneshwar, provides services in shuttering work for building making. In this regard, her husband needs varieties of material such as wood, nails, ropes, hammer, rods, etc. Now he wants to improve his shuttering business to satisfy the demand of his customers and to generate more income to financially support his family.

So Phoolmati is applying for a loan from Kiva's field partner BJS for her husband so that he can buy materials to improve his shuttering work. With the profit, she hopes to enhance her husband’s business and earn more, which will increase her family’s financial status. She wants to save money to provide proper education to her children. Phoolmati is thankful to BJS and Kiva for this financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her husband's shuttering business.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a 56-year-old man married to Pauline who adds additional income to support the welfare of their family. They are blessed with four children.  Benson has been practicing cattle rearing  for a period of ten years, earning an income of KES. 10,000 at the end of every month.

Benson is now servicing his fourth loan of 90,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy cows to sell to his customers.

Benson plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children and hopes to become a successful businessman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy cows to sell to his customers

loans.name: Kalaimahal Shg - Perumandi Group

texts.en:
Vijayalakshmi is the team leader and a member of Kalaimahal Self Help Group (holding a board with SHG name), which was formed by the NGO People Action for Transformation (PAT) in Tamil Nadu, India. She lives in Perumandi village in Tanjore district.

Vijayalakshmi is 30 years old and lives in her own house with her two children and husband. He is a vegetable vendor. Vijayalakshmi has been receiving loans from “PAT” regularly for seven years now, and each time, she repaid them on time. She had taken the loans for the development of their land and to increase the yield.
  
Vijayalakshmi needs a loan to purchase a smokeless stove to save time and money. The traditional stoves require more time to collect fuel, or she must use her family income to pay someone else to collect it. The inefficient use of the fuel causes a high time or monetary burden and creates many problems like health, deforestation, quality of life and climate change.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove

loans.name: Luz Nelly

texts.es:
Luz, a sus 34 años de edad, es una mujer carismática y servicial que se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que inició por la necesidad de generar ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia, ya que es cabeza de hogar desde que se separó de su esposo. 

A pesar de las adversidades, ella tuvo la fortaleza y la determinación para levantarse y seguir adelante y, gracias a ello lleva 10 años de experiencia en este campo.

Su propósito en la vida es seguir progresando y por ello desea fortalecer su negocio acreditándolo con la compra de insumos tales como abarrotes, granos, gaseosas, frituras, licores, y otros comestibles.

De esta manera podrá ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor calidad y servicio, logrando aumentar notablemente sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe de ellas.


Luz manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo con su negocio y, en un futuro desea convertirlo en un supermercado, en el que los clientes puedan encontrar todos los artículos que necesiten y así mejorar la rentabilidad y poder ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Luz,at 34 years old is a charismatic and helpful woman who works in her own business a grocery store. She started it with the need to generate income to get her family ahead, as she is the head of the family being separated from her husband. Despite the adversity she had the strength and determination to get up and continue forward and thanks to this she has 10 years of experience in this field.

Her goal in life is to continue to progress so she wants to strengthen her business with a loan buying food products such as groceries, grains, soft drinks, fried foods, liquors, and other foods. In this way she can offer her clients better quality and service, mange to increase markedly her sales and the profits she gets from them.

Luz says that her main wish is to continue to grow with her business and would like to convert it into a supermarket in the future. Then her clients can find anything they need and thus improve her profit and be able to offer her family a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy groceries, grains, soft drinks, fried foods, liquors and other foods to stock her store.

loans.name: Brighton

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Brighton, a very young, hardworking small holder farmer who is 22 years of age. He is happily married to a beautiful wife, and they are blessed with one child. He hails from Kapsokwony village in the Bungoma area of Kenya. His upbringing was challenging and he never went to college so that he could secure a formal job, but he did not surrender to that and has been practicing farming for the past three years. Through farming, he has been able to take care of his young family.

His main source of income has been milk, eggs and crop farming, and through these ventures, he has supported his young family because he is the only breadwinner. Brighton passionately loves farming and has even nicknamed one of his animals “Brown,” which is an English word depicting the color of the cow. Brighton stated that the most enjoyable bit about farming is “it gives me personal fulfillment and feeds my family."

Although he has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious man. He has been facing challenges transporting his produce from the farm to the market; that is why he is seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. The Bungoma area is a rural town and roads are very poor, and transporting goods for Brighton has always been a “nightmare.” He has been suffering losses because goods reach the market when they are not fresh, hence fetching a low price. 

Vegetables and milk are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market, and through the loan, he will be able to achieve his dream. Brighton plans to employ someone who will be helping him in farm work and transporting the produce to the market, hence impacting the society positively through creation of employment. Increased profits from the loan will allow him to repay the loan fully and be able to permanently change his living conditions and assure his child of a secure future.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport his produce from the farm to the market

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin is a married man. He has two children, aged 4 years and 7 years old. He describes himself to be good. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are the general public. 

Kevin describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a motorcycle. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a good life.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Jacktone

texts.en:
Jacktone is a married man. He has two children, aged 5 years and 12 years old. He describes himself to be good. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are the general public. 

Jacktone describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a motorcycle. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is a 23-year-old hardworking single man who has been operating a motorcycle transport business and a restaurant as a secondary business for four years, earning himself an income of KES. 20,000 at the end of every month.

Boniface  is now servicing his fourth loan of KES. 101,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy a motorcycle to facilitate transport for his daily progress.  The profits he earns will be used to buy an electrical cooker for his restaurant. He hopes to become a successful businessman by building rental houses.

loans.use: To buy an additional motorcycle.

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru:
Ее зовут Мавзуна. Ей 24 года. Она замужем и имеет двоих детей. Ее муж водитель. Мавзуна дома предоставляет услуги портнихи. Для нее такая работа очень удобная, потому что она может одновременно присматривать за маленькими детьми и зарабатывать. Мавзуна научилась шить у своей мамы. По сей день одна использует ее советы и навыки в рабочем процессе. 
  На данный момент швейная машинка Мавзуны очень устарела и доставляет неудобства, и она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить новую модернизированную швейную машинку. У Мавзуны недостаточно средств, чтобы совершить покупку самостоятельно и просит Вас помочь ей.
texts.en:
This is Mavzuna. She is 24, married, and has two children. Her husband is a driver and she is a seamstress. Taking sewing orders from home is convenient for her because she can earn money and keep an eye on the children at the same time. Mavzuna's mother taught her how to sew and she uses this knowledge and expertise while she works. 
Mavzuna has an outdated, inconvenient sewing machine and applied for a loan to buy a new modern machine. She does not have the resources to buy it on her own and asks for your help.

loans.use: to buy a modern new sewing machine

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 50-year-old father of four children, ages 22, 18, 19 and 12. All his children are currently attending school. He lives in Ndola, located in the  Copperbelt province of Zambia, with his wife, children and their four dependants. He runs his own business, which is a Micro-Distribution Centre (MDC), where he sells Coca-Cola products wholesale to local retailers and customers. He has been running his business for 25 years now. 

John says he loves his business because it is a way for him to provide for his family rather than solely depending on his day job. When asked how his community benefits from the business, John is quick to say his business provides a local location to other small business owners in his community to purchase soft drinks. Without his location, small businesses would have to travel to the city and waste time and money on transportation. 

Now, John is requesting a Kiva loan so that he can increase his line of products. Currently, he only stocks Coca-Cola and Fanta in glass bottles, on a very small scale. This loan will help him to add Sprite and increase the volume of his product line. This increase in volume will help John turnover more sales and earn additional income.  

John has high hopes for the future. He dreams of being able to distribute a variety of Coca-Cola products, on a larger scale. With his profits, he plans on making sure his children get a good education.

loans.use: To add Sprite and increase the volume of his product line.

loans.name: Mahila

texts.en:
Mahila hails from Maynaguri. She is a 28-year-old married woman and a mother of two children (one son and one daughter). She is living with them in a house of their own in a small village, Kathalbari in Jalpaiguri district. She attended school till primary level, but she couldn't continue her studies. One of the children is in grade 3, and the other is too young for school.

Her husband, Samchul, aged 34 years, is a talented and responsible professional young man. He has high determination inside himself. He didn't receive the enough financial support from his family to study in school. Thus, he decided to start his own business. Over time, he has accumulated a good amount of money and purchased a cycle-van. One of the public services that is most important for the people of rural West Bengal is that of the van service. The people depend on this service in order to move from place to place and to carry loads. It is a kind of cycle-operated transport that is a very popular means of transport. Unfortunately, the van has been damaged severely due to an accident. So, he wants to purchase a new cycle-van in order to improve the living standards of his family. He thinks this business will be very profitable for him.

So, Mahila is requesting the loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) and hopes her husband will earn more through this business, and she will reach her goals to provide sufficient financial help for their children's education.

She conveys her thanks to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase one cycle-van for her husband's business.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en: Albert is a married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 6 years to 10 years. He describes himself to be patient. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a motorcycle. His business goal is to be prosperous within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 37 and lives in her own house with her husband and her three children, ages 19, 17 and 15. She has been farming for several years, and her main crops are tomatoes and some fruit trees. 

When her crops are ready, she and her husband store them in bins , so that later they can go and sell them in the markets where vegetables and fruits are bought and sold. 

With the earnings Anahit gets from her sales, she manages to pay her household expenses. She is requesting a loan of 3000 USD, so that she can buy seeds, fertilizer and purchase materials for renovation of her flour mill.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer and purchase materials for renovation of the flour mill

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is  a 58-year-old father of  five, ages 31, 28, 25, 23 and 20. Four of his children are currently attending high school. He runs his  own business , which is a Micro-Distribution Centre  where he sells Coca-Cola products wholesale to local retailers and customers. He has been running his business for 29 years now.


Allen says he loves his business because it's his only source of income and he is able to provide for his family and pay bills through the business.  It also gives him the chance to interact with other business  owners.

He is grateful to all Kiva lenders for the financial support he has been receiving, The loans have helped him to increase his stock and profit turnover, This has made sure he stays capable of providing for his family.

Now, Allen is requesting a Kiva loan so that he can increase his stock and working capital. Currently, he only stocks Coca-Cola and Fanta on a very small scale. This loan will help him to add Sprite and increase the volume of his product line. This increase in volume will help Allen turn over more sales and earn additional income.

loans.use: To Increase his soft drink stock and add Sprite to his inventory.

loans.name: Hassan Galadima

texts.en: Hassan Galadima remembers the extreme poverty that his family faced during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, Hassan Galadima, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Hassan Galadima is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”, expressed Hassan Galadima.  With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a vibrant location and her primary customers are of all types. 

Ruth describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to own a wholesale charcoal store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Agustin Roly

texts.es:
Agustin tiene 35 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún en la Provincia de Chiclayo en la region de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Él se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como patos, pollos, gallos, gallinas, pavos, cerdos, etc; con más de 10 años de experiencia, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, y solicita préstamo para compra de más animales, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor diversidad y variedad de animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; y además piensa mejorar productividad de los animales para poder atender las diversas necesidades y gustos de los clientes de la zona a un mejor precio, para que sus ingresos aumenten, su ganancias mejoren y por ende su calidad de vida y a de su familia.
texts.en:
Agustin is 35 years old and is in a common-law relationship. He lives with his family in Oyotún district in the Province of Chiclayo in Lambayeque region on the North Coast of Peru.

He has been working raising and selling animals like ducks, roosters, chickens, turkeys, pigs, etc. His business is located at his house. He is requesting a loan to buy more animals as this investment will allow him to have a greater diversity and variety of animals. This will influence his business and he also wants to improve the productivity of the animals to serve the diverse needs and tastes of his clients in the area at a better price. His income will increase, his profits will be better and in the end, so will the quality of living for his family

loans.use: to buy more animals.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Good people! Meet Francis, 58 years of age, who is full of strength and hope of succeeding in life. He hails from the rich highlands of Kisii, an area which is primarily a banana and sugarcane growing region. He is a family man and he is a responsible and caring father of five lovely children. 

Farming requires a lot of patience and humility and that is what Francis has been practicing for the past 42 years. He is the most experienced farmer in his village and most young farmers seek advice from him on the best farming techniques. His primary sources of income have been milk and crop farming. Francis said that “the most enjoyable part about mixed farming is that you never lack money and food for the family”.

Francis passionately loves dairy farming and has even nicknamed one of his cow “nyeusi” which is a Swahili word meaning black; this refers to the colour of his cow. Francis has planted Napier grass and has an expansive land and has always wanted to increase his number of dairy cows. The main challenge facing this ever smiling man is lack of capital; that is why he is seeking funds to buy a good quality dairy cow.

Dairy farming is a very profitable business venture and Francis wants to take advantage of the ready market that exists to make more profits and improve his living conditions. Through the loan he will buy a good quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing 10-20 litres of milk a day and this will translate into an immediate increase in profit. Marketing for the milk will never be a problem because milk is already in demand and also he plans to sell to a big milk processing firm.

With the partnership between Juhudi kilimo and Kiva he feels relieved to know that there are institutions that support and generate opportunities to progress. Through the loan he will be able to achieve his dream of improving his living conditions and securing the future of his children and grandchildren.


Good people! Meet Francis 58 years of age who is full of strength and hope of succeeding in life. He hails in the rich highlands of Kisii an area which is primarily a banana and sugarcane growing region. He is a family man and he is a responsible and caring father of 5 lovely children. Farming requires a lot of patience and humility and that is what Francis has been practicing for the past 42 years. He is the most experienced farmer in his village and most young farmers seek advice from him on the best farming techniques. His primary source of income has been milk and crop farming. Francis said that “the most enjoyable part about mixed farming is that you never lack money and food for the family”.
Francis passionately loves dairy farming and has even nicknamed one of his cow “nyeusi” which is a Swahili word meaning black and this refers to the colour of his cow. Francis has planted Napier grass and has an expansive land and has always wanted to increase his number of dairy cows. The main challenge facing this ever smiling man is lack of capital that is why he is seeking funds to buy a good quality exotic dairy cow.
Dairy farming is a very profitable business venture and Francis wants to take advantage of the ready market that is there to make more profits and improve his living conditions.
Through the loan he will buy a good quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing 10-20 litres of milk a day and this will translate to immediate increase in profit margins.
Marketing for the milk will never be a problem because milk has ready demand and also he plans to sell to big milk processing firm.
Through the partnership between Juhudi kilimo and Kiva he feels relieved to know that there are institutions that support and generate opportunities to progress. Through the loan he will be able to achieve his dream of improving his living conditions and securing the future of his children and grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Nvard

texts.en:
Nvard is 36 years old. She lives in the small village of Armash with her husband, three children and parents-in-law. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese products, two mother pigs and five piglets, as well as 20 chickens. Besides that, they have a vineyard with grapevines and a hectare plot of land where different kinds of crops are grown. They sell the harvested products and cheese locally. It is hardly enough for food for the family. 

The requested loan of USD $3,000 is very important for Nvard to be able to purchase fertilizer, forage for feeding the livestock and materials for organizing cultivation work. As this is Nvard's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who have not had access to credit products before, because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, forage for feeding the livestock and materials for organizing cultivation

loans.name: Maa Samaleswari Shg Group

texts.en:
Baidehi is a 43-year-old lady who lives with her husband and three children in a small village of Balangir district of Odisha state, India. Her children are in school. She is engaged in paddy (rice) cultivation. Baidehi, along with nine other women from her village, made a self-help group having the name of "Maa Samleswari" to educate each other in their business activities. All the group members are engaged in different activities like paddy cultivation, vegetable cultivation, flower selling, etc. All group members help and support each other in their personal lives, as well as in their business activities. 

Baidehi has been doing paddy cultivation for 12 years. She produces paddy and then sells it. Her husband is a farmer, and he also does paddy cultivation and vegetable cultivation. Baidehi's husband helps her in her activity, and also helps her to sell paddy in the market. 

She and her group members have requested a loan amount of 150,000 INR for their business activities. Baidehi will use her portion to purchase standard-quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her paddy cultivation. All the group members are very happy and excited to take this opportunity, and also they are very thankful to Kiva for this.

loans.use: to purchase standard-quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine is involved in agriculture. She lives with her husband, and two children. As she has been accustomed to do, Lusine is engaged in agriculture and she cultivates various vegetables and fruits. 

Lusine sells her garden’s harvest through re-sellers or in the wholesale market. Lusine also keeps a greenhouse where she currently cultivates tomatoes and eggplant. After gathering the harvest, she plans to grow golden daisy seeds for which reason she is asking for this loan. The loan of USD 1400 is very important for Lusine and she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for flower seeds (golden daisy)

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en:
Tereza lives in Griboyedov village with her husband and two small children (ages 8 and 1 years old). Her husband is an army officer and Tereza herself is engaged in farming. She owns a greenhouse and currently cultivates cucumbers, tomatoes, and eggplant.

Tereza's farm needs more funds, which is the reason for applying for this loan. Tereza asks the loan of USD 3,000 to be able to purchase fertilizer, seeds and a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse. 

She has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, was not able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her farming business is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Tereza has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds and a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse

loans.name: Toshjamol

texts.ru:
Тошжамол простая, трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 61 год. Она замужем. Тошжамол проживает в районе Носири Хусрав. У нее двое детей. Ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Тошжамол на протяжении четырех лет занимается животноводством. Благодаря отцу она научилась работе в этой сфере. 
Тошжамол берет кредит для закупа телят. Она очень ждет вашей доброты.
texts.en: Toshjamol is a simple and hard-working woman.  She is 61 years old and married, and she lives in the Nosiri Khusrav region.  She has two children and her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation.  Toshjamol has been raising livestock for four years.  She got her start in this line of work thanks to her father.  She is asking for a loan to buy calves and she is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle to continue her work.

loans.name: Haykanush

texts.en:
Haykanush, as she used to, is involved in agriculture. She cultivates tomatoes, onions, peppers, and grass. She's been in this line of work for more than 20 years, and works alongside her two sons, who help with all the chores the farm requires.

Haykanush also owns five hectares of vineyard with grapevines. The requested loan of USD 2,000 is very important for Haykanush to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, and to hire workers for cultivation of the land. 

Haykanush and her family are from Aknalij village; they hope for lenders' support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, pesticides, and to hire workers for cultivation of the land

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine lives in Kapan town with her husband and son. Her husband is a taxi driver, and Lusine herself is a farmer. She keeps 20 colonies of bees, gets honey, and sells it in local markets. 

Lusine is a high quality honey provider, and the honey she sells is highly valued among locals. 

The requested loan of USD 3,000 is important for Lusine to purchase 15 hives and 20 colonies of bees and expand her beekeeping business. 

She hopes for lenders' support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for 15 hives and 20 colonies of bees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as manure, fertilizers, pesticides, and banana seed in order to continue her business.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru:
Зухро проживает в районе Шахритус вместе с дочерью, сестрой и внучкой. Она разведена. Ее сын и зять находятся на заработках зарубежом. Зухро на протяжении пятнадцати лет работает медсестрой в городской больнице. Она скромная и трудолюбивая женщина. 
Зухро берет кредит для приобретения мебели для дома, так как у них небольшая квартира им необходима мебель для посуды и одежды. Она будет благодарна вашей помощи.
texts.en: Zuhro lives in the Shahrituz reggion with her daughter, her sister and her grandson.  She is divorced, and her son and son-in-law are migrant workers abroad.  Zuhro has worked as a nurse in the city hospital for 15 years.  She is a modest and hard-working woman.  She is asking for a loan to buy furniture for her home, as they have a small apartment and they need some furniture to hold dishes and clothes.  She will be grateful for your help.

loans.use: to buy furniture

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a vibrant location, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. 

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fruit fly traps and hire labour for clearing and pruning the farm.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells utensils. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a vibrant location, and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. 

John will use the Kes 45,000 loan to buy more stock of utensils. His business goal is to own a utensils shop within five years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will build a house. 

He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of utensils

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Hello! The above picture presents Evans, an ever-smiling 25-year-old young, hardworking and honest man. He is happily married and is blessed with one beautiful child, age 5 months. Being still young and full of energy, he has been practicing farming for the past five years, and has been making profits. His farming involves feeding and attending to his animals. His primary source of income is selling eggs, maize, vegetables and some small business he does to make ends meet. When asked what’s the most enjoyable bit about farming he answered, “I get food to eat and to sell”.

Evans has an expansive land, and has planted enough Napier grass. He has always wanted to buy a good dairy breed of cow, but the challenge he has been facing is a lack of finances.  That is why he is seeking funds to make his dream a reality.

Through Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, he will make his dream a reality because these institutions are all about helping small-scale farmers better their livelihood. He underwent training with Juhudi Kilimo, and has learned that microfinances help the poor access financing and help them in their projects.

He says that through the loan, he will increase his milk production and therefore increase his income levels. Profits from the loan will be used in repaying back the loan and securing the future of his young family.

loans.use: To buy a good quality cow

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a married woman. She has one child. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a rural area, and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. 

Rosemary will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy an overlock sewing machine. Her business goal is to employ more staff within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Hatun Sayhua Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “HATUN SAYHUA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Lamay, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dolores ella es viuda y tiene 63 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.

 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de agricultura, negocio de ganadería, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “HATUN SAYHUA” which is located in Lamay district, belonging to the province of Calca and Cusco Department.

Dolores is a 63 year old widow with three children. she works in her business selling animals. She raises guinea pigs and chickens, making them grow, fattening them and then selling them in the different markets. By way of this small business she raises her children. Her dream is to have a sales spot to sell her guinea pigs and chickens. Dolores is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens and feed for them.

The other members work in agricultural sales, raising cattle, a grocery store and selling animals. The members thanks all of those who form part of this dream through this loan and promise to comply with the payments of their installments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens and food for them.

loans.name: Virginia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Virginia vive con su pareja y tienen 2 hijos de 17 y 18 años, vive felizmente junto con su familia en zona rural del municipio de El Carmen De Viboral.

En la actualidad ya cumplió 14 años de estar trabajando con la producción y venta de ganado lechero, actividad con la que ha intentado sobrevivir y sacar adelante a su familia para que nunca les falte nada. 

Ha tenido dificultades económicas que han afectado su negocio y que lo han obligado a detener sus actividades en ciertas ocasiones. 

Sueña con mejorar su actividad y aumentar su capital, por esto pasa la solicitud de un préstamo, el cual invertirá en la compra de una vaca lechera que le permita tener una mayor producción bovina y de leche.

Su calidad de vida  y la de su familia se incrementará en la medida que aumentan las ventas de sus animales y alcance las metas establecidas para  un futuro no lejano.

Con el apoyo de este préstamo Virginia podrá continuar trabajando y podrá darle a su familia todo lo mejor.
texts.en:
Virginia lives with her life partner, and they have two children, ages 17 and 18.  She lives happily with her family in a rural area in the El Carmen De Viboral municipality.

She has been working in the production and sales of dairy cows for 14 years.  Through this business activity she has tried to survive and to get her family ahead so that they are not in need of anything.

She has had financial difficulties that have affected her business and have obliged her to stop her business activities on occasion.

She dreams of improving her business activity and of increasing her capital.  That is why she is requesting a loan.  She will use it to buy a dairy cow, which will allow her to have a greater bovine production and greater milk production.

Her quality of life and that of her family will improve as her animal sales increase.  She will reach her goals for the near future.  With the support of this loan Virginia will be able to continue working, and she will be able to give her family all of the best.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy products to sell

loans.name: Jaji Galadima

texts.en:
Jaji Galadima is a farmer from Furana. As a Babban Gona member, Jaji Galadima is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Jaji Galadima can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 
With access to high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seeds, Jaji Galadima can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. When asked, Jaji Galadima said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Dauda, Adamu  and  Yusuf, and in 5 years, I want to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Joab

texts.en:
Joab is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself as focused. 

He operates a welding business where he offers welding services. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a viable location and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

Joab will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy welding materials. His business goal is to be successful within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will be stable. 

This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy welding materials

loans.name: Jairo Vicente

texts.es: Don Jairo, hace cuatro años se dedica a la actividad de agricultura, principalmente a la siembra de arroz y hortalizas, está en unión libre y tiene un pequeño niño de cuatro años. La siembra de arroz la aprendió cuando trabajaba en una arrocera, le gustó mucho la experiencia y decidió ahorrar para implementar su propia siembra de arroz junto a otros compañeros hoy en día tiene sembrado arroz y tomate y espera que la cosecha sea buena. Este negocio le ha sido muy rentable y le ha permitido brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.  Don Jairo requiere el préstamo para pagar una máquina de corte de arroz y diésel, con este préstamo espera tener una mejor producción y brindarle mayor calidad en el producto a sus clientes. Dentro de sus planes futuros se encuentran comprar 2 manzanas de tierra para seguir sembrando. Su meta próxima es sembrar 5mz de arroz. Espera que el crédito le sea de mucha ayuda para seguir trabajando de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
Jairo has been working in agriculture for four years.  He mainly grows rice and vegetables.  He is in a common-law marriage, and he has a little four year old son.  He learned to grow rice when he worked for a rice farmer.  He really liked the experience, and he decided to save by establishing his own rice paddy along with other colleagues.

He now has planted rice and tomatoes, and he hopes that the harvest is good.  This business has been very profitable for him.  It has allowed him to provide his family with better living conditions.

Jairo needs the loan to pay for a machine to cut the rice and to buy diesel.  With this loan he hopes to have a better production and to provide his customers with a better quality product.  His future plans include buying two ‘manzanas’ [a manzana is a measurement of land, about 1.72 acres] in order to continue planting.

His next goal is to plant five manzanas of rice.  He expects the loan to be a big help to him in order to continue working in the best way.

loans.use: to pay for a machine to cut the rice and to buy diesel.

loans.name: Noah

texts.en:
Noah is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself as jovial. 

He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his tuk tuk. Noah has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in urban and busy area. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to service his tuk tuk. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. 

He hopes that in the future he will be happy. 

This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to service his tuk tuk

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as focused. 

She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a vibrant location and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

Rebecca will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to own a posho mill within 5 years. 

She hopes that in the future she will educate her children. 

This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru:
Мехринисо – уроженка района Пяндж, занимается швейным делом. Она работает швеей уже 5 лет и предоставляет свои услуги у себя дома. Она шьет платья разных фасонов, которые придумывает сама. 
Мехринисо замужем за мастера-строителя и у них один ребенок. Мехринисо уже исполнилось 27 лет. Она по натуре целеустремленная женщина и сейчас решила расширить свою деятельность. Дело в том, что Мехринисо шьет на старой машинке и в процессе шитья у нее возникают трудности с машинкой. Поэтому она хочет обновить швейную машинку, чтобы ускорить и улучшить процесс работы. На сумму запрашиваемого кредита, Мехринисо собирается купить компьютерную швейную машинку. И этот кредит ей действительно нужен.
texts.en: Mehriniso is a native of the Pyandj region and she works as a seamstress.  She has been in this line of work for five years and she offers her sewing services out of her home.  She sews different styles of dresses that she comes up with herself.  She is married to a construction worker/handyman and they have one child.  Mehriniso is already 27 years old, and she is a goal-oriented woman who has now decided to expand her business.  However, she sews on an old machine and the process of sewing is getting difficult for her.  Because of this, she wants to get a new sewing machine, as it will help the speed and quality of her working process.  With the money from the loan she is asking for, Mehriniso plans to buy a computerized sewing machine.  She definitely needs this loan.

loans.use: to buy a computerized sewing machine.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself as disciplined. 

She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

Susan will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be successful. 

This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Women Of Gold Group

texts.en:
Gloria (54 years old) is the featured member of the group, Women of Gold.  She lives in the Teshie-Accra, Ghana. 

She is a businesswoman selling rice, gari (cassava flour) and second hand clothing from door to door. She has been in this business for 5 years and it has been the main source of income for the family. She has one child to take care of.  

It is not easy to take responsibilities for herself and child. Gloria's business brings good income and that is why she is requesting for this loan to stay in this business and make more money. She is in urgent need of money to buy stock of her rice, gari (cassava flour) and second hand clothing so that she can save money for herself and child.

The group, Women of Gold, was formed by women of common interest sharing similar economic background to get a loan. The loan will help them to buy inventory for their variety shops, which are the main source of income for their families.

loans.use: To buy and sell rice, gari (cassava flour) and second hand clothing from door to door.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as focused. 

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a fast growing area. Everlyne describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to expand the business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. 

This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a male Kiva borrower. He describes himself as ambitious. 

He operates a retail business where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in an area with potential for business growth and his primary customers are regular. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved standards of living. 

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.  His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Justa

texts.en:
Justa is a single woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as determined and focused. 

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. Her business is located in a fast growing area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

Justa will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a single man. He describes himself as ambitious. 

He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in an area with potential for business growth and his primary customers are regular. 

He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. His business goal is to have a big business with a variety of clothes within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved standards of living. 

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.  His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Qristine

texts.en:
Qristine lives in Meghri town with her husband, mother-in-law and two infant children. 

Qristine is involved in farming.  She keeps 30 colonies of bees and grows different types of fruit trees (peach, plum, quince, figs and pomegranate).  The gathered honey and fruit she sells in a local open market, thus earning income for her family.  Qristine, due to her hard work, is able to cover her family's basic needs and the income that she gets from agriculture is very important for their living. 

The requested loan of USD 3000 is important for Qristine to enlarge her beekeeping business. The loan will allow her to purchase 21 hives and 27 sheets of embossed wax. 

She hopes that lenders will help her loan to be funded and she will be able to gather more honey.

loans.use: to pay for 21 hives and 27 sheets of embossed wax

loans.name: Nuhu Shawai

texts.en: Nuhu Shawai is a Babban Gona farmer from Gidan Shawai. Nuhu Shawai expressed that he is driven by one goal; to “make more money for myself and my family.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Nuhu Shawai to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Nuhu Shawai can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Nuhu Shawai, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Nuhu Shawai will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food and clothing for my family”. With this loan, Nuhu Shawai will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Roja Shg - Asur Group

texts.en:
Anandhajothi is married and the leader of the Roja Self-Help Group, which is managed by the local NGO, People’s Action for Transformation, in Tamil Nadu. 

Anandhajothi lives in her own house with her family. Her husband works as a daily wage laborer. They live in Asur, a small village in the Tanjore district. Anandhajothi has taken loans from PAT previously and has repaid the loans on time.

Anandhajothi and the other members of the group need a loan to purchase a smokeless stove, which is better than a traditional stove. The smokeless stove produces less carbon dioxide and maintains a healthy environment. They are convenient for cooking and designed for daily use.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 10 years to 30 years. 

He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells bread, sugar, soap, milk, and cooking oil. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in an area with potential for business growth and his primary customers are regular. 

He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, sugar, soap, and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will have improved standards of living. 

This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, sugar, soap, and other items

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals. He says that his biggest business challenge is financial problems. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. His business goal is to have a better business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Maa Durga Shg Group

texts.en:
Okia is a 43-year-old lady currently engaged in selling goats and goats’ milk. Currently, she has fifteen goats. From this activity, she is able to make 4,000 INR per month. She, along with nine other women from her village, created a Self-Help group named "Maa Durga Shg", and Okia is the president of this group. The group is made up of members having the purpose of helping and supporting each other in their business activities and in their personal lives. All the group members are engaged in different activities such as selling cows’ milk, selling flowers, selling vegetables, etc. 

Okia lives with her parents-in-law, husband and her two children. Her husband is a daily laborer, and sometimes he helps in Okia's business activities. Okia and her husband both take on all the family's responsibilities. Okia has a dream of making a house for her family and educating her children. 

Okia, along with her group members, has requested a loan of 150,000 INR. Okia will use her portion to purchase more goat kids for her animal raising business. She is really very thankful to Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase more goat kids and renovate the shed.

loans.name: José Candido

texts.es:
José de 42 años de edad, comenta que su educación escolar no la supo aprovechar por el hecho de solo haber estudiado hasta el segundo grado en la escuela, debido a que en el tiempo que él estudiaba las escuelas estaban demasiado lejos de su casa y tenía que caminar demasiado para llegar a una y también tenía que ayudarle a su padre en los trabajos, entonces decidió su padre no ponerlo más a la escuela y que se dedicara a trabajar junto con él.

José está acompañado,  su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen 3 hijos de las edades de 17, 15 y 10 años de edad los cuales estudian en la escuela, en su casa habitan cinco personas las cuales dependen de él.

José se dedica a la albañilería cuenta que de pequeño trabajaba de ayudante de albañil y fue entonces que le gusto este trabajo y decidió dedicarse por completo a esto, dice que lleva ya 10 años de albañil y que en todos estos años todo ha marchado bien y que siempre ha tenido trabajo para sostener a su familia, comenta José que él se mueve de un lugar a otro en su trabajo debido a que no es un empleo estable que a veces tiene que viajar a otros departamentos para ir a trabajar y tiene que viajar muchas horas en autobús, comenta que él labora ocho horas diarias y cuando necesita terminar trabajos más rápido realiza horas extras y además se dedica al cultivo de café desde hace siete años, él se dedica a esta actividad debido a un proyecto cafetalero que surgió en la zona donde habita y fue desde entonces que él también se dedica a este trabajo debido a que obtiene ganancias gracias al café.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar cucharas, cinta, palas, carretillas de mano, hilo, etc, debido al tiempo las que tenia se le han ido deteriorando debido al uso de tantos años y así él podrá ser más eficiente en su trabajo y poder darle una mejor vida a su familia y también para sembrar plantitas de café en una parcela que tiene de tierra.

José planea en un futuro poder importar  sus cosechas de café, para obtener buenas y mejores ganancias en el comercio, también poder comprarse un medio de transporte que lo pueda acercar más rápido a sus lugares de trabajo, también desea poder ayudar a sus hijos para estudiar una carrera universitaria y así puedan defenderse mejor en un futuro.
texts.en:
José, age 42, says that he could not take advantage of a school education as he only went to school through the second grade.  This is because, at the time that he went to school, the schools were too far from his house.  He had to walk too far to get to one.  Also, he had to help his parents with work.  Therefore, his father decided to stop sending him to school and to have José work with him.

José is married, and his wife devotes herself to the household chores.  They have three children, ages 17, 15, and 10, and they go to school.  Five persons live in his house and are dependent upon him.

José is a bricklayer.  He says that he worked as a bricklayer's helper when he was little.  He liked this work, and he decided to work full-time at this.  He has been a bricklayer for ten years.  In all of these years it has all gone well, and he has always had work to support his family.  

José says that he moves from one place to another in his work because this is not stable employment.  At times he has to travel to other departments to work, and he has to travel many hours by bus.  He says that he works eight hours a day, and when he needs to finish jobs more quickly, he works extra hours.

He has also been growing coffee for seven years.  He engages in this business activity due to a coffee growing project that emerged in the area where he lives.  He has done this since then because he gets good income thanks to the coffee.

The loan that he is requesting from CrediCampo is to buy trowels, tape, shovels, handcarts, and string, etc.  He needs these because he has used the ones he has for some many years that they have worn out.  This way he will be able to be more efficient in his work, and he will be able to give his family a better life.  He will also plant coffee plants on a piece of land that he has.

In the future José plans to be able to export his coffee harvest in order to get good and improved earnings when he sells it.  He also plans to be able to buy a means of transportation with which he will be able to get to his work places more quickly.  He also wishes to be able to help his children get a university degree so that they are able to better take care of themselves in the future.

loans.use: to buy tools and to plant coffee.

loans.name: Yusuf Shawai

texts.en: Yusuf Shawai is a Babban Gona farmer. Yusuf Shawai is driven by one goal; to “make more money for myself and my family.” It is this ambition that led Yusuf Shawai to join Babban Gona. Now, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Yusuf Shawai can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Yusuf Shawai, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season because with this loan, he will finally be able to access required yield enhancing inputs, such as improved seeds and fertilizer. Yusuf Shawai is hoping that as a result of this expected yield, he will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what changes he would like to make, he said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children. With this loan, Yusuf Shawai will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Luceros De Lucma Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LUCEROS DE LUCMA, el banco está ubicado en el sector de Lucma, distrito de Vilcambamba, provincia de la Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Severina tiene 50 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 05 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la ganadería y a la agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, semillas entre otros.
Los demás socios se dedican a la agricultura, venta de alimentos, restaurante, cultivo de café, venta de bebidas.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This group member belongs to the communal bank LUCEROS DE LUCMA, which is situated in the Lucma sector, in the district of Vilcambamba, province of La Convención and department of Cusco.

Severina is 50 years old, she lives with her partner and has five children. She divides her working time between raising livestock and crops. She has worked in this business for a considerable time, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts in every day. She is a responsible and diligent person, who wishes to carry on working in order to continue supporting her family. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds among other items.

The other members of the group work in agriculture, food sales, a restaurant, growing coffee and drinks sales.

Severina is grateful for the loan offered and promises to make her agreed repayments.

loans.use: to buy fertlizer and seeds among other items.

loans.name: Inna Ja'afaru

texts.en: Inna Ja'afaru is a 48-year-old farmer from Gidan Chino.  As a Babban Gona member, Inna Ja'afaru, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Inna Ja'afaru can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Inna Ja'afaru is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, she will be able to purchase inputs such as fertilizer and seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 35 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Inna Ja'afaru hopes she will finally be able to afford to educate her children: Esther and  Deborah. Inna Ja'afaru’s dreams do not end there: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, she expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Chrisphine

texts.en:
Chrisphine is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself as jovial. 

He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to service his motorcycle. His business goal is to have a vehicle within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will be successful. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Эту 30-летнюю женщину на фотографии зовут Фируза. Она в районе Пяндж живет вместе с мужем, 8-летней дочерью и 2-летним сыном. Муж Фирузы занимается животноводством и зарабатывает на жизнь таким путем. Сама Фируза тоже деятельная женщина. Она предоставляет услуги швеи  и принимает заказы на пошив женских национальных платьев. Фируза с любовью относится к своему делу и поэтому каждый ее заказ выходит оригинально красивым. Чтобы расширить свою деятельность, Фируза обратилась за кредитом. Она хочет купить необходимые ткани, а также новую швейную машинку. Кредит поможет ей в развитии дела и привлечении еще больше клиентов.
texts.en: The name of this 30-year-old woman on the photograph is Firuza. She lives with her husband, an 8-year-old daughter and a 2-year-old son in the Pyandj district. Firuza's husband is involved in animal husbandry and earns a living this way. Firuza is also a business woman. She provides seamstress services and accepts orders to sew national women's dresses at home. Firuza treats her business with love and this is why each of her orders is originally beautiful. Firuza requested a loan in order to expand her business. She wants to purchase necessary fabrics and a new sewing machine. The loan will help her develop her business and attract even more customers.

loans.use: to purchase necessary fabrics and a new sewing machine in order to expand her business

loans.name: Toji

texts.ru: Точи замужняя женщина в возрасте 62 лет. Она мать двоих детей. Точи с семьей живет в маленьком городке Турсунзаде. Она в течение 10 лет предоставляет услуги портнихи. Научилась мастерством швеи в профессиональной школе. С тех пор она зарабатывает своим умением и мастерством. Ее швейной машинке очень много лет и так как прежде она не в силах работать. Точи приняла решение приобрести новую швейную машинку, чтобы улучшить процесс работы и сохранить деятельность. Но для приобретения новой машинки у нее не хватает средств и по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en: Toji is a married 62-year-old woman. She is a mother of two children. Toji and his family live in a small town of Tursun-zoda. She has been providing seamstress services for 10 years. She learned the seamstress trade at a professional school. Since then, she has been earning a living with her skill and mastery. Her sewing machine is already many years old and does not work as efficiently as it did before. Toji decided to purchase a new sewing machine to improve her work process and sustain her business. She, however, does not have enough money to buy a new sewing machine and requested a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine to improve her work process and sustain her business

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en: Hajara is a 35-year-old farmer from Gidan Shawai.  As a Babban Gona member, Hajara, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Hajara can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Hajara is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, she will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 35 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Hajara is hopeful about what the future holds; she  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, she will finally be able to afford to educate her children. Hajara’s dreams do not end there: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, she expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Solidario Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SOLIDARIO, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Quimbiri, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Justa tiene 51 años de edad es viuda y tiene 03 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia siembra lo que son frutas como naranjas,piña entre otros,  a la vez siembra café, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, abono entre otros.
Los demás socios se dedican a la agricultura y venta de cereales.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member, Justa, is 51 years old, and a widow with three children.  She belongs to the communal group SOLIDARIO, located in Quimbiri district, La Convencion province, in the department of Cusco.

Justa carries out various daily activities, earning her living in agriculture.  She has been working at this business for a long time and doing well thanks to the effort she makes every day.  Justa grows different kinds of  fruit, including oranges and pineapples; she also plants coffee.  She wants to continue with this work to support her family.    She is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers and other things.  The other members of the group work at farming and selling cereal grains.  Justa is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other thigns

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru:
Малика пожилая, но еще активная жительница района Дж.Руми. Ей 64 года. Она имеет высшее педагогическое образование и является преподавателем предмета математики. Она работает в средней школе района Дж.Руми в течение 44 лет. Ей нравится работать с детьми и учить их, и Малика не представляет себя в другой профессии.
У Малики трое взрослых детей. Ее сыновья являются мастерами-строителями, а муж безработный. Сейчас Малика нуждается в кредите. Она хочет провести ремонт в доме. Уже многие годы ее дом не видел ремонта из-за нехватки финансовых средств. Поэтому этот кредит ей действительно важен. На сумму запрашиваемого кредита, она собирается провести ремонт в доме, чтобы улучшить жилищные условия.
texts.en:
Malika is an elderly, but still active resident of the J. Rumy district. She is 64 years old. She has a higher pedagogical education and is a mathematics teacher. She has been working at a secondary school in the J. Rumy district for 44 years. She likes working with children and teaching them, and Malika cannot imagine herself working in another profession.

Malika has three grown children. Her sons are construction workers, and husband is not employed. Malika now needs a loan. She wants to make repairs at home. Her house has not seen repairs for many years due to the lack of financial means. This is why this loan is truly important for her. She is planning to use the requested amount to make repairs at home in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to make repairs at home in order to improve her living conditions

loans.name: Naguin

texts.es:
Naguin tiene 49 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente sin hijos a su cargo, cuenta con casa propia en el distrito de Oyotun en la provincia de Chiclayo en la región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú, este lugar es una zona rural en la cual se dedican a la agricultura y a la crianza - venta de animales.

Naguin se dedica a la venta de abarrotes hace varios años el cual esta ubicado en su domicilio, y solicita préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por el monto es de 2000 nuevos soles los que invertirá en la compra de más productos para su negocio y cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes y así obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar su ganancias asi como la calidad de vida de él y de su familia.
texts.en:
Naguin is 49 years old, lives with his partner and has no children that he is responsible for. He has his own home in Oyotun district, in Chiclayo province, in Lambayeque region on Peru's north coast. This is a rural area where people engage in agriculture and in the raising and sale of animals.

Naguin has been selling groceries for several years and his business is located in his home. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which he will invest in the purchase of more products for his business to cover the needs of his customers, enabling him to obtain greater income and improve his earnings as well as his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: To acquire working capital for the purchase of more merchandise.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is married and the father of three children. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a marketable area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient stock. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more sugar, bread, flour and other items. His business goal is to have more stock within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, bread, flour and other items

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a married mother of six children. She describes herself as hard working. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for four years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuation. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more sugar, bread, flour and other items.

loans.use: buy more sugar, bread, flour and other items

loans.name: Bala Laure

texts.en: Bala Laure is a Babban Gona farmer. Bala Laure is driven by one goal: to “make more money for myself and my family.” It is this ambition that led Bala Laure to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Bala Laure can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14.
