However, Bala Laure is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season because with this loan, he will finally be able to access required yield enhancing inputs, such as seeds. Bala Laure is hoping that as a result of this expected yield, he will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what changes he would like to make, he said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children." With this loan, Bala Laure will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Amado Javier

texts.es:
Amado tiene 39 años de edad, su estado civil conviviente, tiene 3 hijos a su cargo vive en casa propia en el caserío el Alumbral en el distrito de Oyotun, en la provincia de Chiclayo en la región de Lambayeque, sierra norte de Perú, en este lugar la población se dedica a la agricultura, a criar y vender animales de corral.

Amado se dedica al comercio criá y vende animales de corral, tiene varios años de experiencia en el negocio, y solicita préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por el monto de 1000 nuevos soles los que invertirá en la compra de animales pequeños y en arreglos del corral donde criá a sus animales ya que luego de unos meses los podrá vender a un emjor precio y así obtendrá mayores ingresos con la venta de estos, lo que mejorará sus ganancias y por ende su caldiad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Amado is 39 years old, he lives with his partner and has three children to care for. He lives in his own home in the small village of Alumbral in the Oyotun district, province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region in the northern highlands of Perú. Here, the population work in agriculture, raising and selling farm animals.

Amado works raising and selling farm animals and has several years of experience in this business. He is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles that he will invest in buying young animals and in the repair of the pens where he raises his animals. In this way in a few months he will be able to sell them at a better price and obtain a larger income from their sale. This will increase his profits and consequently improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy more animals, the investment will enable him to have a greater diversity and variety of animals.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a married mother of five children. She describes herself as independent. She operates a retail business where she sells fruit. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be perishable products. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more fruit. Her business goal is to be a major supplier within five years.

loans.use: to buy more fruit

loans.name: Audu I.

texts.en: Audu is a Babban Gona farmer from Gidan Shawai.  Audu expressed that he is driven by one goal; to “make more money for myself and my family.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Audu to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Audu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Audu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Audu will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland”. With this loan, Audu will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro is 53 years old and works as a security guard for an ad agency. During the warm season he sells frozen flavored waters in the street to earn extra money. Alejandro is married and has four sons, but only one still depends on him. He is asking for a loan to make some improvements on his house.
He says that he is responsible and credit worthy.

loans.use: to make home improvements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy two main tires and a weed cutter for his tractor.

loans.name: Salele

texts.en: Salele is a 33-year-old, married woman with four children. She makes and sells barbeque in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. Salele needs a loan to buy mutton flaps, sausages, chicken leg quarters, soya sauce, onions and paper plates. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family’s weekly expenses and to help with her children's education. Salele has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy mutton flaps, sausages, chicken leg quarters, soya sauce, onions and paper plates.

loans.name: Otilia

texts.en: Otilia is a 38-year-old, divorced woman with two children. She runs a small crafts business within her village to earn a living by selling her items at the market or in her community.  She has been doing this for three years. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a barrel of varnish, paintbrushes, paint, carving tools and a load of coconut shells. In the future, Otilia hopes to pay for her family’s weekly expenses and to save for the future of her business. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a barrel of varnish, paintbrushes, paint, carving tools and a load of coconut shells.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
La socia Feliciana se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias y mercados, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Feliciana  continues working in her business raising small animals such as any pigs and chickens.  She fattens them and later sells them in the various fairs and markets. She works from 8 AM until 6 PM. She has  been in this business for four years already and it is going very well.  Her dream is to have a sales outlet where she can sell the animals. She is requesting a loan in order to buy guinea pigs and chickens. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her installment payments.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La socia Doris  se dedica al negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labiales y perfumes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Doris sells beauty products. She sells lipsticks, creams and perfumes, and works from 8 AM until 7 PM. She has been in this business for several years already. Her dream is to have a sales outlet where she can sell the beauty products. The borrower is happy about the loan and promises to make her installment payments.

loans.use: The borrower is requesting the loan in order to buy creams, lipsticks and perfumes.

loans.name: Clerk

texts.en:
Clerk is a married man. He has 5 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 17 years. He describes himself as ambitious. 

He operates a barber shop, where he does hair cutting. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located in an area with potential for business growth and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge as inadequate shaving machines. 

He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more shaving machines. His business goal is to have a barber shop with adequate facilities within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will have improved standards of living. 

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more shaving machines

loans.name: San Pablo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN PABLO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Huayopata, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Silvia Aurelia ella es conviviente y tiene 45 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva café, plátanos y cacao, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y semillas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de cafe, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de agricultura.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "San Pablo". This group is located in the Huayopata district, part of the province of La Convencion and the department of Cusco. 

The borrower is the Señora Silvia Aurelia. She is married, 45 years old, and has 5 children. She works in agriculture, and has a plot of land where she grows coffee, bananas and cocoa. The member works from 8am until 6pm. She has been working in this area for 5 years, and it suits her very well. Her dream is to expand her farm land. The member asks for this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds. 

The other members work selling animals, selling coffee, running a grocery store, and selling agricultural products. 

The member thanks those who form a part of this dream through this way, and promises to comply with her payments in the established time frame.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds.

location.town: Sector san pablo/distrito de la convencion

loans.name: Tapuni

texts.en: Tapuni is a 39-year-old, divorced woman with four children. She makes and sells Samoan taro and banana chips in her community to earn a living. She has eight years of experience with this business. Tapuni needs a loan to buy a barrel of cooking oil, a large pot, a strainer, plastic bags and a new oven. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family’s weekly expenses and to help with her children's school fees. Tapuni has been a member of SPBD since 2006.

loans.use: to buy a barrel of cooking oil, a large pot, a strainer, plastic bags and a new oven.

loans.name: Sulika

texts.en: Sulika is 38 years old and single with two children. She owns and operates a small flea market selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for four years. Sulika needs a loan to buy Samoan t-shirts, printed material, cava bowls, coconut carved earrings, bangles, shoes, hair gel, Samoan body oil and hangers. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family’s weekly expenses and to help with the expansion of her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like Samoan t-shirts, printed material, cava bowls, coconut carved earrings, bangles, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Shakarbibi

texts.ru:
Шакарбиби жительница района Шахритус. Ей 33 года. Она замужем. У нее трое несовершеннолетних детей. Шакарбиби трудолюбивая женщина. Она на протяжении трех лет занимается животноводством.
Шакарбиби берет кредит для закупа телят. Она планирует купить скот и через месяц продать с наценкой на рынке.
texts.en: Shakarbibi is a resident of the Shahrituz district. She is 33 years old, married and has three underage children. Shakarbibi is a hardworking woman. She has been involved in animal husbandry for three years. Shakarbibi is requesting this loan to buy calves. She is planning to buy livestock and resell it in a month with a markup.

loans.use: to buy calves for a subsequent resale

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en:
Amadu is a maize farmer from Chino.  As a Babban Gona member, Amadu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all other Babban Gona members, Amadu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.
With access to high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seeds, Amadu can reap up to 30 bags/hectare this season, double the national average of 14. When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money to expand my farmland, in order to make more money for myself and my family." With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to income and yield.

loans.name: Ane

texts.en: Ane is 50 years old and married with six children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Ane needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Ane will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: To buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade.

loans.name: Ateliana

texts.en: Ateliana is a 45-year-old single mother of seven children. She runs a small tailoring business from her home and effectively attracts people from around the island. She has been running this business for more than three years. Ateliana has requested a loan to purchase a new industrial sewing machine, a new measuring tape, pins, a pair of scissors, material, thread and needles. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly needs and hopefully to expand her business near town. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase a new industrial sewing machine, a new measuring tape, pins, a pair of scissors, material, thread and needles

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 33 years old and married with three children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for four years. Maria needs a loan to buy a large chest freezer, a new hanging scale, soft drinks, canned items, and bags of sugar, flour and salt. She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house and help pay for her children's education. She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a large chest freezer, a new hanging scale, soft drinks, canned items, and bags of sugar, flour and salt

loans.name: Erlinda Aurora

texts.es:
Erlinda Aurora tiene 51 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el distrito de La Florida San Miguel, una comunidad con paisajes verdes, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Región Cajamarca que pertenece a la sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica junto a su hijo a la preparación y venta de comida, cuenta con un restaurant típico-rural-campestre, con más de 20 años de experiencia en el negocio, Erlinda ha solicitado un préstamo de 3200 nuevos soles para la compra de insumos para la preparación de sus comidas como sacos de arroz, aceite, azúcar entre otros y de esta manera poder variedad de platos para ofrecer a sus clientes, ya que esto aumentará sus ingresos y sus ganancias lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Erlinda Aurora   is 51 years old and lives with her son in the district of La Florida San Miguel, located in Cajamarca region,  which is part of Peru's northern highlands.  It is a community with green landscapes.  People who live there engage in agriculture and commerce, and raise livestock.
 
She and her son prepare and sell food. She has a traditional country-style restaurant, with more than 20 years experience in the business. 

Erlinda has requested a loan of 3200 nuevos soles in order to purchase ingredients and supplies for preparing her food, such a sacks of race, cooking oil, sugar and other items, enabling her to prepare a variety of dishes to offer her customers, as this way she will increase her income and earnings, which will allow her to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and supplies for preparing her meals, such as sacks of rice, cooking oil, sugar and other items, enabling her to prepare a variety of dishes to offer her customers.
